DETAIL_AKASHISUMMERDIVE2108_H01: Akashi clad in an amphibious hero suit. With a good amount of heroic experience under his belt, he is starting to look and act the part more and more. In combat, he generates energized projectiles with his glove Parallel Weapon and launches them with his well-built shoulders from his days as an outfielder, delivering incredible fastballs to knock the pirate villains off the resort ship and reclaim everyone's summer vacation.
DETAIL_AKASHISUMMERDIVE2108_H02: The hero suit developed by Hisaki's lab, with its ability to transform into something relatively themed, unleashes its true power in a waterlogged place like Muirauqa IV. The combat units that float around Akashi conjure up bubble-shaped shields, allowing him to fight at full capacity even when submerged in water. Though his new outfit is far more revealing than his previous one, its designer Maculata is quite satisfied with it, saying, "It really does bring out the best in him," with a smile.
DETAIL_AKASHI_H01: Akashi transforms into a hero who fights with balls of fiery, coalesced energy and a bat to send them flying. He generates the fireballs from the rings attached to his arms using his own energy and slams them toward his foes with a special bat that enhances his already significant skills as a slugger. When he swings his bat, you can rest assured that his fiery payload will be hit fast and hard.
DETAIL_AKASHI_H02: Akashi has been eaten by a Kaibutsu before in an encounter gone wrong, providing him with firsthand knowledge of the horrific fact that those eaten by Kaibutsu have their very being erased from the memories of all. Everyone who lives dies, but they live on in the hearts and minds of those who knew them. Those unfortunate enough to be once consumed by a Kaibutsu and live to tell the tale, however, are not allowed this mercy. Bat in hand, Akashi worries whether he will be able to leave a mark that will prove he once lived.
DETAIL_AKASHI_S01: A Terran born and raised in Orient City, his full name is Akashi Tamura. Though testy at times, his sense of justice is remarkably strong. He attends Hinowa Athletics University while working part-time and is a member of the university's baseball team. While his batting average could give any pro a run for their money during practice matches, his tendency to fall prey to being nervous stifles his potential during matches in front of a real audience.
DETAIL_ALCHIBACHASERS2105_H01: Alchiba has achieved the form of a combat detective who is able to use not just facts and logic to solve cases but also strength of arms. He foils the schemes of terrorists who dare destroy priceless artifacts with his calm deductions, his passionately burning heart, and his trusty laser gun. The gun bears a striking resemblance to the one he used during his time on the force, and Alchiba caresses its familiar trigger with a derisive sneer. Though his foes may try to escape through the deserts of Tentotres, there is no sense trying, for Alchiba is "The Chaser," his newfound form with exceptional mobility that no one can outrun.
DETAIL_ALCHIBACHASERS2105_H02: With his newly acquired transformation, Alchiba's wings are not white but black—as they were meant to be. No longer will he run from his past, for his wings serve as a symbol of overcoming his days as a police officer in which he was traumatized by being called "The Black Wings of Misfortune." Now that he has both wisdom and power, he is able to reevaluate the police as an organization with a fresh pair of eyes. Though his mistrust for them remains, his stance toward them is changing, slowly but surely.
DETAIL_ALCHIBA_H01: Alchiba believes in bringing light to darkness. This belief is displayed when he transforms into his hero form: his black wings become majestically endowed with pure-white plumage, manifesting his dedication to the truth. He uses his monocle Parallel Weapon to scan for all concealed information from his targets. He converts the findings into a legible report, which he analyzes to deduce their weaknesses and crimes committed—exposing their truths to the shining light of day.
DETAIL_ALCHIBA_H02: Alchiba once served with a national police force, where he found evidence of deplorable corruption among its ranks. When he attempted to bring this corruption to light, however, he was falsely accused of a crime and subsequently stripped of his badge and title. He has harbored a deep distrust of police forces ever since, resorting to bringing light to the "darkness" behind criminal cases on his own. As long as there are cases needing to be solved and crimes for which reparations are needed, he will keep on being a detective and a hero.
DETAIL_ALCHIBA_S01: A winged Cosman who serves as a private eye for his own detective agency. He fancies himself as the "cool, above-it-all inspector"—and a handsome one, at that. His seductively dreamy eyes and baby face do help him look the part, but, alas, as a lecher among lechers, he has a penchant for hitting on everyone, even his clientele. Worse still, he will purposely make grating remarks with a straight face to get under the listener's skin. Nevertheless, he holds strong to his principle of seeing every job through to the end, even if it kills him, as his core belief. In turn, his work has a reputation for perfection, winning him an established reputation in the detective industry.
DETAIL_ALEND_H01: The skintight suit Alend wears as a hero is modeled after office wear, including a collared shirt, a necktie, suspenders, and more. This is a reflection of his strong belief that no matter how harsh the environment, people will be able to live normal lives if he has anything to say about it. When battling, he activates the Parallel Weapon terminal attached to his arm and perceives all that he sees as one big "city,"  then he uses his pen Parallel Weapon to create buildings and roads of energy, protecting people and spaces from Kaibutsu and villains.
DETAIL_ALEND_H02: Picked up by a group of terraformers, Alend has never known his parents. He grew up with other children in the same situation, and living in an environment where it took everything he had just to live formed his efficiency-prizing personality. A harsh environment claims lives quickly, and he has seen too many fall a day away from a safe haven being finished, or an hour before the proper energy was connected. Seeking to build a better world where anyone can live comfortably wherever they wish, Alend travels from one developing planet to the next as both an urban planner and a hero.
DETAIL_ALEND_S01: A young urban planner on the cutting edge. Having to perform a variety of urban design jobs in the harsh environments of developing planets has pushed him to train his body. This eye for efficiency carries into his work, though he also prizes flexibility in his thinking. As such, his city designs reflect his personality, being functional, awash with the latest technology, and made with incredible speed. His desire is to let the residents dwelling in the harsh environments of frontier planets live safely as quickly as possible, and his efforts are appreciated. While his cool, aloof conduct stands out, he expresses his emotions with abundance through his expressions and the moving horns atop his head.
DETAIL_ALPHECCATHERMAE2307_H01: Visiting the beautiful watery city while on an incognito vacation, Alphecca finds himself utterly entranced by tales of the great king of old who started the city with his passion for development and a love for his people. Alphecca's new hero form is reminiscent of that king. He wields a great trident Parallel Weapon which conjures up water that moves in accordance to his will. With his regal garb and royal trident, Alphecca is the very picture of a king who stands at the head of his army, cutting open a path to victory and a better tomorrow.
DETAIL_ALPHECCATHERMAE2307_H02: Alphecca reminisces on his succession to the throne. With his father and brother suddenly passing away one after another, the crown had been thrust upon him. He took it in stride, protecting his people as king just as well as he had as a knight. Yet, something has been nibbling at his heart. Simply protecting his kingdom as it is cannot be the end of his duty. He must blaze a path to the future for the subjects he loves so much and make Aradicia a greater kingdom. It is with this strongly held wish in his heart that he, the gentle king, holds high the "Trident of Tomorrow."
DETAIL_ALPHECCA_H01: Unable to fully leave behind his dreams of knighthood, Alphecca dons a mask over his face and shining white armor over his body when a hero is needed. He wields a sword of flame that burns as bright as the passion in his heart on the battlefield, showing all who challenge him why he was once known as Aradicia's greatest swordmaster. As for whether his ferocity in combat is a result of frustration over being denied his dream of knighthood or a genuine desire to protect his people, no one knows.
DETAIL_ALPHECCA_H02: In Aradicia, the second son inherits the household in the event that the first son dies. When his brother and father both passed away, Alphecca had no choice but to take the throne. Neither the life he had imagined as a knight nor the dream he had held and trained for since childhood has been so easy for him to just cast aside. Tormented by the conflict of his old dream and his current duties as king, Alphecca summoned his inner circle's Observer to share his plan.
DETAIL_ALPHECCA_S01: Alphecca Genma the 21st is the current king of Aradicia, a small, off-world kingdom. His noble aura and imposing visage gained him immediate popularity with his subjects and soldiers after his ascension, yet those closest to him know better. Possessing great curiosity and impulsiveness, he gives his inner circle no end of trouble. As the second prince who was not intended for the throne, he had trained all his life to be a knight. Incidentally, he seems to have some sort of connection to the mysterious white knight who often appears during losing battles to turn things around.
DETAIL_ANDREWLOSTANCIENTS2208_H01: On lake patrol, Andrew dons his new hero suit, which is perfect for underwater activity. He is in need of no jet thrusters because his legs are more than powerful enough for him to move freely through the water. Offensively, the mechanical components covering his arms constitute his Parallel Weapons, which change ether into energy to generate water currents as he dishes out punishing punches. Andrew's new resolve is made manifest in this form, which combines biological mobility and mechanical strength.
DETAIL_ANDREWLOSTANCIENTS2208_H02: Bonds exist which transcend the gap between mechanical robots and organic Hito. Andrew had this epiphany when he realized that his permanent shutdown would sadden others. His mind processes thus changed, giving him the resolve to protect the bonds he has created to the bitter end. As to whether all this constitutes evidence of his having a heart, no one can say. Heart or no heart, he cherishes the mounting errors in his mind processes as he begins exploring what only he can accomplish as a mechanical life form in his new form.
DETAIL_ANDREW_H01: Andrew's appearance as a hero most strongly expresses his yearning for biological humans. His body combines the advantages of both organic and mechanical life forms: a heavy-armament-like modular exterior with superb defensive capabilities encasing an organic interior with the neural plasticity to produce complex thought processes. As unfortunately ephemeral as this hero form is for Andrew, whenever he is able to operate in this form, he strives to experience what it is like to be a human in the flesh, and for that, he truly does appear to be literally "alive."
DETAIL_ANDREW_H02: Created for the purpose of scoping out the actions and movements of organic life forms in an information warfare waged between them and his fellow mechanical life forms, infiltrating human society has resulted in Andrew growing fond, even envious, of them while living among their rank and file. In doing so, he came to recognize the charm that the inner workings of these organic life forms had. So, when the war came to an end and he found himself adrift in the cosmos, he found refuge in a place where humans toiled away to make a humble living—vowing to fight for them so that the heartwarming solace he has found shall never be squandered, till the day that he, too, shall become one and the same as them: human.
DETAIL_ANDREW_S01: Andrew is a truck driver who works for an interplanetary freight transport company. Though he outwardly appears to be an adult male Terran, he is actually an Android who hails from the planet of Tronecion, the home world of mechanical life forms. He was manufactured as a spy operative during an age of interstellar warfare between organic and mechanical life forms. His initial purpose put aside, Andrew harbors great love and envy toward organic life forms, and he continues to research humanity in hopes of being more like them. His maturity level is lower than his appearance would otherwise suggest, but his heart is as pure as gold.
DETAIL_ANDROIDSOLDIEREARTH_H01: These mechanical life forms wear suits perfectly fitted to their frames, and they wield anti-Kaibutsu armaments with machine precision. Though every Android soldier's abilities are stunning, their true potential is unlocked thanks to being linked to their superior, independent communication network rooted in Tronecion. Soldiers share personal situational data with others instantaneously, allowing squads to optimize role assignments and teamwork via high-speed calculations. Their group efficiency in missions is second to none.
DETAIL_ANDROIDSOLDIEREARTH_S01: Android soldiers from Tronecion, the birthplace of these mechanical life forms, have muscular, bio-based body parts made with unparalleled precision; ignoring the sutures, they look exactly like those of humans. The soldiers are all connected to their home planet's independent network that distributes orders and directives to each unit. Though the orders which dictate that they fight are undisclosed, their unyielding adherence to their prime directives is akin to biological life forms' notion of conviction.
DETAIL_ANDROIDSOLDIERFIRE_H01: These mechanical life forms wear suits perfectly fitted to their frames, and they wield anti-Kaibutsu armaments with machine precision. Though every Android soldier's abilities are stunning, their true potential is unlocked thanks to being linked to their superior, independent communication network rooted in Tronecion. DETAIL_ANNA_H01: Anna's hero suit itself serves as her Parallel Weapon. Her fluttering flared skirt and veil pulse with energy and resonate with Anna's desire to liberate those around her, filling them with invigorating power. Her contemporary dance style is not one-size-fits-all, however. While some viewers will find her movements soothing, others will be pumped up and encouraged by her efforts. Anna takes it all in stride, nonetheless. After all, everyone wants something different with their freedom.
DETAIL_ANNA_H02: All it took was one look at an enchanting dancer for Anna to decide that she would dedicate her life to the art. It did not take much self-study for her to pick it up, either, proving her talent. Her father, however, did not share her enthusiasm. He wished for her to have a better life and a secure future, while she wanted to devote herself to her dream. The two argued fiercely, and Anna ended up running away from home. She hopes that Hito who feel repressed will see her dance performances and realize from her steps that they, too, can be free. And, she hopes and prays that, one day, her father will understand that.
DETAIL_ANNA_S01: A senior high school student at the Sakuramoto Central Private Academy, Anna Akemichi is an active and enthusiastic member of the dance club with hopes of becoming a professional dancer. Fearless, curious, and a touch impatient, she will often travel to cities or even planets where she has never been before with only the clothes on her back, letting her terrible sense of direction take the reins and ending up tragically lost. On the other hand, her sincerity and her tendency to treat everyone equally no matter their gender, species, or personality has won her the adoration of her classmates.
DETAIL_ANTARES_H01: Wishing to see life grow in the soil that he has tilled, Antares transforms into a Hero wielding a large hoe. That hoe has the ability to transform what it pierces and tills, creating more habitable spaces for certain forms of life. His specialty is using this ability to transform the land, change the soil, and give plants more space to survive and thrive in. This is, of course, his personal desire, and he knows all too well that it is not the ideal power for a sect herald such as himself.
DETAIL_ANTARES_H02: As a child, Antares always loved seeing people plant seeds, till the soil, and spread green life across the land to make Biotope. Yet in his position as herald, he was only allowed to watch from afar those who planted trees and cared for plants. As his powers as herald grew, however, so did his connection to the plants. He found himself able to feel their vitality with surprising vividness, and what followed was... joy. Joy that this life had been raised by the people who planted it. Then came the birth of his desire to till the soil with his own hands, so that more life could live on more land.
DETAIL_ANTARES_S01: Antares is a Cosman who leads the sect Foresight, a group dedicated to its ideology. He comes from the small artificial planet the sect is based on, commonly known as Biotope. His permanent calm and ever-gentle tone in speech has captivated countless individuals. Sights of him showing emotion are rare to nonexistent, and he always wears a smile. When he engages in his hobby of caring for his plants and their soil, however, one can catch a glimpse of a hint of joy in his expression.
DETAIL_APPRENTICEEARTH_H01: Their will to protect the populace and their admiration for veteran Heroes is made manifest by their buckler Parallel Weapons and light Hero Suits. Though their battle experience may be lacking, they take on Kaibutsu and Villains with their innate courage and drive to improve. Their combat strategy, drawing from their experience as stream assistants, is every bit as effective as a professional Hero's when it comes to getting views. Undaunted by the challenge, they take the field with their signature scarves fluttering in the wind, adding to the excitement as they battle alongside their allies.
DETAIL_APPRENTICEEARTH_S01: Rookie Heroes wielding fresh licenses. They each join the agencies they want and start off as apprentices. While in training, they mainly work as assistants during Hero streams, running around the field carrying the cameras and getting in the occasional transformation and battle. They've become a common sight ever since Hero culture took root on Earth—indeed, many were inspired by the figure of the Kaibutsu-fighting Hero and wanted to join the field themselves. Though still apprentices now, they dream of gaining S-class licenses and heading to the stars. And when they make it to the end of that tough road, they might become that special Hero to someone else.
DETAIL_APPRENTICEFIRE_H01: Their will to protect the populace and their admiration for veteran Heroes is made manifest by their buckler Parallel Weapons and light Hero Suits. DETAIL_ASTARLASTRESORT2506_H01: Having visited Enoshima on a job from Parallel Flight, Astar finds himself wishing to free the local children from their fear of Kaibutsu through the wonder of marine sports. After all, as a young child he once described his dream of becoming Santa to the southern hemisphere, and that desire has been clearly reflected in the swimwear and paddle blade Parallel weapon that comprise his new suit. Using a perfect sense of balance gained from operating his "sled," he guides his surf board Parallel Weapon with his paddle to shred waves and Kaibutsu alike.
DETAIL_ASTARLASTRESORT2506_H02: Astar has not missed a day of brutal training in his efforts to be a Santa. When he takes on surfing with his resulting skills and muscular body, however, he notices that all of the effort he expended to become the sled-riding, joy-spreading Santa has opened up other doors for him. There are people, for instance, who rejoice in seeing him ride the waves. He savors this praise and smiles back, sharing joy with no artifice. They love his moves and expect nothing but the best, and he cannot let them down, putting on an aquatic performance with both power and grace.
DETAIL_ASTAR_H01: Astar's Parallel Weapon is a tablet-like device that scans and evaluates. Recreated from his dreams, it is an evolved version of something which was once lost. The tablet detects Hito-esque life forms within his immediate surroundings then simulates the muscle movements of each. It was originally made to identify which homes had children in them to then determine whether those children had been naughty or nice that year. Astar, however, uses it for entirely different purposes. Any time this stark discrepancy is brought to his attention, he simply gives the person a harsh look as he grumbles to himself.
DETAIL_ASTAR_H02: To Astar, being "Santa" is fraught with setbacks and suffering. He once performed the activity on a much greater scale but has since cut back and gone solo. In his mind, he is not only a lesser form of what Santa should truly be, but he is also a corruption of it. His reasons for continuing despite the self-criticism are twofold: his desire to become Santa having not waned and the value he sees in his own suffering.
DETAIL_ASTAR_S01: A massive, red Cosman covered in flames, Astar tells all who will listen that he is a professional "Santa." During his "off-season," that being every month aside from December, he mainly works as a lumberjack and woodworker in the forest. Not eager to socialize with others—he has his reasons—his lack experience has left him an exceptionally poor conversationalist. If he is going to interact with others, it will have to involve Santa-ing, or something else that touches on the yearning in the depths of his heart.
DETAIL_ASTOSISWONDERLAND2602_H01: グルメットファイターズ主催の料理大会に参加することになったアストシスは、パラレル・キューによる新たなスーツを身に纏う。マクラータによってデザインされたそのスーツは、とある童話をモチーフとした意匠が随所に盛り込まれている。そして、右手に装着された時計型アームガードと、そこから伸びるペンデュラムがアストシスの新たなパラレルウェポンだ。いつか自分がそうしてもらったように、今度は自分が仲間を助け、導きたい。そんな願いが込められたペンデュラムは、アストシスの精神を研ぎ澄ませて進むべき道を指し示す。
DETAIL_ASTOSISWONDERLAND2602_H02: かつてのアストシスは、亡き父と幼馴染への贖罪のためだけに生きていた。その贖罪の果てに自らが裁きを受け、全てを失う覚悟で。しかし、アストシスに投げかけられたのは「自分自身のために生きてほしい」という赦しだった。その言葉に、凍りついていたアストシスの時間が再び動き始める。突然目の前に現れた大きすぎる可能性に戸惑いながらも、アストシスは自分の未来を模索していく。自らを救ってくれた者たちに恥じない生き方がしたいと願って。その想いが、彼を今でもヒーローたらしめている。
DETAIL_ASTOSIS_H01: When donning his hero suit, Astosis wields a staff Parallel Weapon that has scales attached to the tip. His weapon embodies his notions of justice and morality. When he swings it, those who ought to be punished are struck with immense force, and those who ought to be rewarded receive immense magical support. However, this judgment depends entirely on Astosis himself, and should he waver or doubt himself about who is in the right, its power is greatly diminished.
DETAIL_ASTOSIS_H02: Astosis's father was a brilliant attorney who always sought a fair verdict and saved many a desperate client. Watching his father as he grew up, he vowed to become an attorney himself and put in the back-breaking effort to achieve that goal. He then trained under his father, the very man whom he respected the most. Those days were fulfilling, but they came to an abrupt and cruel end when his father tragically committed suicide. Left behind all alone to fend for himself, he clung to his attorney's badge and the ideals it stood for. Carrying on his father's legacy, Astosis dons his suit and stands in court beside his clients to see that justice is served.
DETAIL_ASTOSIS_S01: Astosis is a Leo Therian Cosman who works as an independent attorney, who is renowned for his meticulous, prompt work and excellent communication skills. Quick to gain his clients' trust, he specializes in extracting information key to their defense. As a surprising contrast, however, he is loath to talk about himself. Though he is very hands-on when greeting people, there seems to be another benign reason behind this behavior.
DETAIL_BARRELHEROFESTA2109_H01: Barrel's desire to put on a proper fight under the blazing summer sun summoned up this new form. Donning an ambitious swimsuit and wielding multiple water guns, he fills the battlefield with jets of fierce, refreshing water spurts while flashing handsome smiles to the audience as he gains countless points and fans. Or, at least, that is what he has planned. The water guns' tanks provide unlimited ammunition as long as Barrel has the guts and the drive to match.
DETAIL_BARRELHEROFESTA2109_H02: A man who has always wanted to be a cool gunfighter, Barrel had looked amazing whenever he would blast foes with his pistol. However, he was shocked to discover that he was not the flashiest of them all. He was stuck with an inescapable weakness: when fighting with guns, he could not avoid the fire or the heat. Barrel went back to the drawing board, and his sought-after hints came from his firefighter hero friend's water streams and the water pistols at festival shooting galleries. Given his love for summer and the beach, rebranding himself as a water-blasting summer hero was inevitable.
DETAIL_BARRELSTELLA2510_H01: The Galaxy Carnival Expo, a festival of festivals. Barrel is there front and center, acting as a walking billboard for the Japan Pavilion which is modeled after the religious festivals of old in Japan. Fancying himself to be Orient City's number one Festival Man, he asked Sui to design him the most appropriately festive outfit for a Japanese matsuri, and that is what he received. His Hero suit is based on summer loungewear called a jinbei, befitting of one seeking to enjoy some fireworks and festival noodles. For his Parallel Weapons, he has replaced his dual pistols with twin jitte-shaped stun rods, hearkening back to the cool cop Heroes that Barrel's grandmother told him were in Japanese period dramas in days past. Or, at least, what he imagines them to have looked like.
DETAIL_BARRELSTELLA2510_H02: Born in a particularly dangerous area, Barrel was nearly kidnapped when he was still too young to remember. He grew up as a quiet child strictly told to keep to himself by his parents, and was loathe to show much emotion. It was his grandmother living in Japan who changed him. One day, while they were going for a walk and enjoying a traditional festival, she idly mentioned that if you and the one you're with are both truthful, it's more fun to do as you wish and follow your hearts. Though it wasn't framed as a grand revelation or earth-shattering advice, her remark lodged itself deep in Barrel's heart, forming the core of his dream to become a gunfighter of justice.
DETAIL_BARREL_H01: When duty calls, Barrel transforms into "Symphonic Trigger," a hero donning the sheriff's garb he has always wanted to wear. Wielding two pistol Parallel Weapons, he can suppress foes with a barrage of bullets faster than the eye can see. Transforming revolutionizes his aim: each blazingly fast blast is made with perfect accuracy as opposed to missing every shot erratically. When in his costume shooting up a storm of energy bullets, he looks like he is genuinely having the time of his life.
DETAIL_BARREL_H02: Riding into a town plagued by some tyrannical gang, blasting at them with a six-shooter and landing every shot, then laying down the law before riding off into the sunset... Barrel has always been captivated by Western movies, no matter how old or "outdated" they may seem to others. He has always dreamed of becoming a gunfighter of justice, like the sheriffs in those pictures who pulled their triggers to do what was right. Though this desire was genuine, it transformed him into something the world had never seen before: a loose-cannon cop hero.
DETAIL_BARREL_S01: Barrel is a Cosman raised in Houston, Texas, U.S., who works as a local patrol officer in Orient City. Honest, genuine, and with much love for the people, he seems like a model police officer at first glance. However, he simply cannot let go of his love for the sheriff stereotype seen in Westerns, which leaves him with a trigger-happy, loose-cannon side. He pulls out his tranquilizer-loaded pistol at the slightest provocation, but a first-time amateur could shoot better, as he cannot hit his targets, much less innocent passersby on accident, no matter how many shots he fires.
DETAIL_BARTE_H01: Barte's passion as a bladesmith is reflected in her appearance as a Hero, as well. Her Parallel Weapon allows her to forge Ether into a variety of weapons, her favorite of which is a large, one-handed battleaxe. Though she can craft any weapon her imagination and aesthetic sense conjure up, they are specifically made not to cause harm, leaving her offensive power lacking. The third eye that shines on her forehead when she transforms has nothing to do with her Parallel Weapon and everything to do with her birth. Since opening it allows her to see the energy waves given off by living beings, it has obvious utility in combat.
DETAIL_BARTE_H02: Barte, survivor of a mysterious people, has been under Ganran's care for as long as she can remember. From childhood, she has watched the old blacksmith forge all sorts of creations, from farming tools to weapons, yet it was bladed versions of the latter that truly captured her heart with their beauty. Ganran has taught her that weapons are dangerous, which she understands. Weapons are also beautiful, though, and she believes this beauty has meaning, much like the forgotten country of her birth has legends of a beautiful axe that became a symbol of peace. Now, as a disciple of Ganran and a student of blacksmithing, she swings her hammer in pursuit of her own aesthetic peak.
DETAIL_BARTE_S01: Barte is a young apprentice blacksmith who studies the art of forging under Ganran, a blacksmith from the volcanic city of Garndera. Though cheerful and affable, she has a touch of arrogance to her and often uses rough language, picked up from her mentor and acting foster father who brought her up. As a terminal geek regarding all things bladed, she will talk nonstop about weapons and blades, describing silhouettes, decorative patterns, edge shapes, and more. She can walk the walk as well, being well known and well regarded by clients for forging weapons that are both aesthetically pleasing and highly functional.
DETAIL_BOREALIS_H01: Borealis uses a conducting baton Parallel Weapon which is fully specialized for gathering and harnessing View Power. The average viewer can hardly look away when he raises it. He conducts his musical drones to play a variety of symphonies in battle, with different songs having different supporting effects for his allies. His Parallel Weapon's ability to enhance his allies comes from his natural ability to listen to the sounds of others, and by using that ability in reverse, he pours so much emotion and energy into the hearts of others, thus strengthening and invigorating them. This works outside of battle, as well, and Borealis is fond of using his abilities during concerts to utterly charm his audience.
DETAIL_BOREALIS_H02: Since birth, Borealis has been able to hear the inner sounds of other individuals' hearts and minds. Unconsciously listening in to their emotions and thoughts caused him immense mental stress, but his family and best friend were there to help him cope. Their disappearance is why he is so possessed to always gain more and more views at all times in hopes that he may reach them. He resonates with the inner sounds of those around through his music, enchanting the hearts of his audience. He hopes that, one day, those tunes may surely reach the ears of those dearest to him.
DETAIL_BOREALIS_S01: Borealis is a conductor who leads an orchestra of instrument drones. He hails from a frigid, sparsely populated planet which has now since been annihilated by a meteor collision. Though records show he had worked as a hero before, since the destruction of his planet, he has cut off all contact with hero agencies and begun using his powers for self-preservation. The concerts he holds on his personal theater spaceship are watched all over the galaxy, commanding an immense viewership. His ship is an exclusive realm, too, which can only be breached by those select supporters and people he has a fondness for via private invitation.
DETAIL_BYGUL_H01: Transforming into the hero "Zippy C," Bygul's greatest weapon is his immense strength, which is enhanced by the difference in gravity between Earth and his home planet. By using the environmental adaptation suit he normally wears as a Parallel Weapon, he is able to jack up his muscular output to unleash staggeringly powerful attacks. However, because the suit was made for the purpose of helping him adapt to his environment, Bygul must have a clear vision of himself actively thriving in said new environment for him to adjust accordingly. That means his Parallel Weapon's effectiveness is drastically affected by how well he understands his surroundings and by how immersed he is in the situation.
DETAIL_BYGUL_H02: Bygul journeyed off to the stars, carrying the hopes of his homeland on his back. His home is economically frozen and completely in thrall to another, more powerful planet, and he has been tasked with gathering intel which may help them regain independence. He was chosen as an emissary specifically because of his deep knowledge of Earth, a planet far outside of their sovereign power's sphere of influence. For his part, Bygul diligently carries out his mission, going to all sorts of places and speaking to all sorts of people, while also taking time to visit all the real-life locations where all of his favorite movies and anime series were set or filmed. He wishes to be like the protagonist of his favorite movie, fighting to save the people of his home planet and of the galaxy at large. Until the movie of his life reaches that dramatic climax, he will continue to don his hero suit, ready to punch out evil at a moment's notice.
DETAIL_BYGUL_S01: Bygul is a Therian Cosman from a far-off planet who has come to Earth's sphere of influence in search of gainful employment. A consummate nerd who has watched countless movies and anime series originating from Earth, he is excited to finally live in the promised land that gave birth to all of his favorite entertainment. Unfortunately, he is having a hard time adjusting to his surroundings on Earth. All he does is stir up trouble wherever he goes, casting dark clouds on his would-be bright future. Still, he remains amicable, which means he has no problem getting along with other passionate geeks. No sooner does he start talking than he has made himself a new dear friend.
DETAIL_CANES_H01: Canes has complicated feelings toward his brother, who is blessed with both a far more impressive build than he and more talent as a space hunter. This led to his overpowering desire to become the strongest of hunters with the greatest of partners, giving birth to his Parallel Weapon. Both massive, floating arms act on their own, protecting or attacking whoever Canes directs them to—whether it be himself or others. Having been trained as a hunter, Canes' preferred fighting style is to observe his prey, wait for the right moment, then deliver a fatal strike from a blind spot.
DETAIL_CANES_H02: To Canes, heroes were always on the other side of the screen, fighting as noble souls on their streams. He loved how they worked in teams diverse in species and builds, with everyone's power having a place. Now a hero himself, young Canes seeks to meet the expectations of those who look up to heroes as he did. As he pursues the heroes who came before him, he is fueled not by anxiety but by hope. One way or another, the rookie vows with shining eyes that he's going to make the wish that led to his awakening come true.
DETAIL_CANES_S01: A young humanoid Cosman who lives on the developing planet of Muirauqa I.  Picked up by a family of Space Hunters who protect the planet's pioneers from dangerous native lifeforms, he lives as a hunter's apprentice. Diligent and with a strong sense of duty, he believes he will eventually take over the family business. Surrounded by adult hunters, the only person he grew up with around his age was his brother, who also had far greater size and physical abilities than he did. Such an environment pushed Canes to pursue them with constant daily training, fueled by a hidden anxiety that he may be left behind by them someday.
DETAIL_CERASTIUM_H01: Cerastium yearns to be a shield of justice that protects the innocent, and her hero form grants her this wish. She wields a massive shield Parallel Weapon which she uses both to defend her allies and to crush her enemies. Lauded as the "Iron Wall" in her riot police unit, she takes advantage of her natural tenacity by volunteering herself to be used as a shield between her allies and all that threatens them on the front line. She risks herself in battle neither to gain glory nor to bolster her reputation but rather to see that justice, which she prizes so highly, gets served.
DETAIL_CERASTIUM_H02: Cerastium had a dear friend who joined the Gendarmerie Nationale alongside her who shared her desire of enacting justice. When said friend asked Cerastium about her vision of justice, however, she found that she had no concrete vision of the very thing she touted. She had always followed the visions of "justice" that others lauded, whether it be those of her commanding officers or her team leaders; she did as they commanded while trusting all would be well. She had forged no independent beliefs nor vision of justice to call her own. This never ceases to agonize her. Indeed, her most pressing issue now is to find her own vision of justice and stick to it.
DETAIL_CERASTIUM_S01: Cerastium serves in France's Gendarmerie Nationale as a riot police officer, but she also serves as a hero in the UEHA France Chapter. A Terran from the city of Lyon, being half Cosman has endowed her with large horns which protrude from her head. She sought to join the Gendarmerie Nationale at a young age, and her meticulous, forefront personality helped her achieve this fabulous undertaking. Cerastium is enamored by the notion of "justice" and has a zero-tolerance policy for social injustices in her purview. Unsurprisingly, she idolizes Bolt of Justice, as one might imagine, and views herself as one of his most avid fans.
DETAIL_CONCHE_H01: ヒーローに変身したコンチェはコックコート風のスーツを身に纏い、不慣れな戦場に飛び出していく。彼が手にしたパラレルウェポンは、スパチュラやボウルなどの製菓道具を模したもの。ボウルから発生させたエネルギーをチョコレートのように練り、それを用いて味方を支援する戦法を得意としている。体力の回復や盾の成形もできるなど、応用の利く能力ではあるものの、実際の製菓工程のように繊細なコントロールを要するという弱点を抱えている。
DETAIL_CONCHE_H02: コンチェは、ショコラティエをしていた父が大好きだった。悲しい時や落ち込んだ時に食べさせてくれたチョコレートの甘さと、父の優しい言葉がいつもコンチェを支えてくれていた。しかし、故郷の村に突如として現れたカイブツによって、父は帰らぬヒトとなる。穏やかで幸福な日々を失ったコンチェは亡き父の言葉を胸に刻み、傷ついたヒトたちをチョコの魔法で癒やしたいと願いショコラティエになった。そのひたむきな想いが、彼をヒーローに目覚めさせたのだ。
DETAIL_CONCHE_S01: オリエントシティでショコラティエをしている少年。つい最近まではひまわり銀河の辺境の星で暮らしていたため、あまりヒーロー文化に馴染みがない。引っ込み思案な性格をしており、事務所の先輩たちに揉まれて戸惑うこともしばしば。戦いの経験にも乏しいため、カイブツと相対した際は内心怯えている。しかし、ショコラティエとしての熱意は本物で、美味しいチョコを作るためであればふんばりをみせる。母親が入院しているため定期的にお見舞いに通っているが、とある事情から親子関係は良好とは言えない。
DETAIL_CROWNE_H01: A girl who dreamed of traveling the stars, exploring all the latest and greatest technologies the cosmos had to offer. She rekindled those dreams as an adult, realizing she still wanted to tinker and experience the depths of sentient inventions. Thus, a hero was born. As her weapon, she wields a huge supercomputer that can transform into an array of tools to fit any scenario and even precisely analyze the construction and abilities of her targets—particularly the weapons they hold.
DETAIL_CROWNE_H02: Crowne grew up in an environment with strict gender roles. Men were to be one way, and women were to be another way. Her personality and interests were deemed masculine by those around her. Everyone wished for her to be more feminine, and they even deemed her dreams to be too masculine, demanding she aspire for more girly ambitions. It did not take her long for her to give up on her dreams, leaving them to be rediscovered in adulthood.
DETAIL_CROWNE_S01: Crowne Applefield is a Terran hailing from Seattle, U.S., and she is a mechanic who works for Ramjet, one of Earth's most prestigious spaceship-building companies. Contracted by Parallel Flight, she works exclusively for them as both a mechanic and a pilot. Strong of will and arm, she hates being looked down on for being a woman. She is also a terminal geek for the latest technologies and has a bad habit of disassembling and analyzing any rare mechs or robots she gets her hands on.
DETAIL_DANZOTRAVELERS2504_H01: While journeying with the Chosen One's party on a quest to save the world, Danzo realizes a new wish. This is reflected in his aesthetics, which resemble those of a bard who travels the world to spread his music far and wide. Yet the stereotypical appearance of a fantasy bard, with their graceful clothing and precious harps, does not agree with Danzo. He is more of the punk variety, with a leather jacket, spiky belt, and tons of metal accessories, plugging his electric guitar into his own body to rock out. If you ask him, he'll tell you that the kunai hanging at his waist can be used both as a guitar pick for a sweet solo or as a projectile to take out a pesky foe.
DETAIL_DANZOTRAVELERS2504_H02: To Danzo, music is hope itself which brings back the rich emotional life he used to have. No matter how hard or brutal his training or missions, an ordeal that required replacing most of his body with machinery included, music has always given him a lust for life and the energy to go on living it. Is it any surprise, then, that upon seeing a world numbed by despair and shrouded in a cloak of resignation, his first thought would be that everyone needs music? There is nothing he wants more than to bring music to the masses with their dead eyes, to reignite the life in their hearts, and that is what powers the upbeat melodies he lets rip from his electric guitar.
DETAIL_DANZO_H01: Danzo transforms into a flashy, ninja-themed hero named "The Groover," armed with a variety of ninja implements and audio device Parallel Weapons. Wielding his record-shaped chakrams with utmost precision as he operates the phantasmal turntables around him, he unleashes sublime tunes that turn battles into concerts. The music he makes as he fights vitalizes his allies and mesmerizes the audience, keeping them glued to their screens. The beautiful sounds of battle are not the only kinds of sounds he can make with his phantasmal speakers—supersonic wave attacks are also on his playlist.
DETAIL_DANZO_H02: Danzo was raised as a descendant of a long line of ninja warriors who had fought in the shadows of Japanese history. He operated not just on Earth but also in space. He incurred life-threatening injuries during an off-world mission, but when he awoke, he found himself cyborgized. Surviving as a cyborg, consequently, meant starting to crave the experience of being truly "alive" again. Using both his love of music and the skills he cultivated when he had all of his limbs attached, he pursues life as hard as he can, continuing to fight as a hero until the day comes when he can truly say he is having the most fun he has ever had.
DETAIL_DANZO_S01: Danzo Yahiko, also known as Dz. NINJA, is contracted with Neo-Talents Productions, where he handles all things related to music: DJing, composing, editing, and even production. His technical wizardry does not end there, however. Though Danzo is a Terran, he is also a cyborg, with machinery making up half of his body. He has a fondness for ninja themes in both his artistic endeavors and his fashion concepts, but his rambunctious behavior and love of flash and attention are about as far away from a stealthy warrior as one can get. On occasion, however, he will show a side to him so cold it would stun even the most stalwart of hearts.
DETAIL_DENEBORA_H01: Denebora wears a hero suit modeled after the hunting garb of the tribe's first chieftain, a figure remembered as the "Legendary Hunter." Designed to adapt to any hunting scenario, the suit appears light and unencumbered, yet conceals a wide array of parallel weapons, ranging from handgun-type arms to dagger-like blades. Favoring claw-shaped weapons above all others, Denebora moves with the grace of a sudden gust of wind, leaping fluidly into motion and striking vital points with unerring precision in the very next instant. Guided by the tribe's belief that 'a hunt is a one-on-one exchange of life, Denebora puts these parallel weapons to use not in war, but in pursuit of justice, capturing wanted villains and earning a living as a bounty hunter.
DETAIL_DENEBORA_H02: “Hunting means taking a life.” That was the lesson Denebora's father impressed upon him, a belief made all the more cruel when the man himself lost his life on a hunt. From then on, Denebora grew up with the understanding that the hunter would one day become the hunted, and with death ever at his side, he learned to accept it as an unavoidable truth of the world. That certainty, however, was shattered during a single, fateful hunt. Denebora's younger brother—clumsy, hesitant, and poorly suited for the chase—defied the tribe's laws to drag him back from the brink of death. In that moment, the boy's actions, and his desperate plea to “value life,” struck deeper than any wound, forcing Denebora into conflict with both the tribe's traditions and his father's teachings. From that turmoil, a new conviction took root. The necklace Denebora wears is a handmade gift from his brother, a quiet reminder of that turning point. Until the day he can reclaim him from those who abducted him before his very eyes, Denebora will never part with it.
DETAIL_DENEBORA_S01: A young man distinguished by the horns growing from his forehead, a feature that has become his trademark. He was born into a merit-based tribe whose civilization revolves around hunting, and he has a much younger brother. Having only recently left his closed-off homeland, he still shows a sheltered, inexperienced side to the wider world. Whether by bad luck or because others took advantage of that naivety, he has often suffered misfortune, falling for deals that seemed too good to be true. Those experiences have left him exceptionally wary of others. For reasons even he does not fully understand, he is perpetually short on money, struggling to keep up with the loan payments on a spaceship he purchased in a once-in-a-lifetime decision, justified as being "for work." Having grown up without anything resembling a proper meal, he will never forget the shock—and the tears—of tasting a hamburger for the first time in Earth space.
DETAIL_DIGRAM_H01: Valuing the safety and timely operation of public transport above all else, Digram transforms into the mechanoid hero "Transaber" to unsparingly remove all obstacles and impediments from the system's rails. His body was originally created to combine the emotions of a biological being with the Kaibutsu-busting capabilities of a hero, and he draws on the latter when transforming to eliminate obstructions. Digram's personal favorite weapon is his railgun, which can eliminate targets in the blink of an eye with its tremendous firepower.
DETAIL_DIGRAM_H02: After many years of war had finally come to a close, the Interstellar Passenger Transport Service resumed operations, connecting peoples between the galaxy's many worlds. To Digram, the sight of these trains traveling across the cosmos is a symbol of hard-won peace. He feels deep reverence for its punctuality and aspires to protect it at all costs. Anything that would dare bring harm to his symbol of peace would surely be met with elimination.
DETAIL_DIGRAM_S01: Digram is a living, humanoid robot hailing from the planet of mechanical life forms, Tronecion. He works as a conductor and driver for the Interstellar High-Density Passenger Transport System, commonly referred to as the "Galactic Railway." Intensely coolheaded, diligent to a fault, and a stickler for rules, Digram will not forgive even a few seconds of tardiness. Though he does act more machine-like than others of his kind, he is a living being with emotions, nonetheless. If shown love, he will react positively, albeit sometimes.
DETAIL_DIVEREARTH_H01: Wearing diving suits, they wield pile bunker-like Parallel Weapons as they boldly take to the water. The core of their combat style is their skill reading the flow of the water and turning even roiling tides into allies, a style that blesses their underwater pugilism with grace and style. The process of digging up small discoveries with their Parallel Weapons and the joy that follows is what drives them ever deeper, into the black abyss of the oceans and the dangers they hold.
DETAIL_DIVEREARTH_S01: Divers are specialists of the sea, challengers of the abyss. They possess highly trained bodies built to withstand the pressures of the depths, as well as minds strong enough to take any strain without flinching. They know from experience that the most important ability to have when trouble happens in the water is the ability to restrain one's panic and remain calm. Divers are hired for a variety of missions, as well. They'll perform dangerous tasks like investigating sunken ships and fending off aquatic Kaibutsu, but they will also do showy events in aquariums, earning them an enduring popularity with children.
DETAIL_DIVERFIRE_H01: Wearing diving suits, they wield pile bunker-like Parallel Weapons as they boldly take to the water. The core of their combat style is their skill reading the flow of the water and turning even roiling tides into allies, a style that blesses their underwater pugilism with grace and style.
