Divers are hired for a variety of missions, as well. They'll perform dangerous tasks like investigating sunken ships and fending off aquatic Kaibutsu, but they will also do showy events in aquariums, earning them an enduring popularity with children.
DETAIL_ESPERDICA_H01: Esperdica wields a coffee roaster Parallel Weapon, the aromas from which rustle the emotions and affect the actions of all who smell them. For example, he can fill a room with a fragrance to dull the movements of his enemies while also boosting the morale of his allies. His aroma-filled smoke can onset hallucinations, confounding his foes while he lunges at them with martial arts moves. However, because his powers are scent-based, he is at a disadvantage when fighting in windy areas, or when he is up against enemies with no sense of smell.
DETAIL_ESPERDICA_H02: Enchanted by the flavor of coffee as a child, Esperdica hit the books so that he could open his own café one day. He loves the aroma of coffee most of all, and he takes utmost care in brewing each cup, hoping the aromas will enchant his customers as much as they enchant him. He would not have been able to devote himself to coffee, however, had he not met a certain boy when it came time to decide which path he would take. "Don't take the easy road," the boy had said. "Be greedy. Go for it all." His words gave Esperdica the strength to choose his desired path.
DETAIL_ESPERDICA_S01: Esperdica owns a café near a quiet public park located on the outskirts of Orient City. He also works as a barista while managing the shop and possesses a deep knowledge of coffee. He boasts several relevant certifications, also working as an appraiser who actively helps other cafés in need of assistance. Esperdica is awfully well informed on a variety of subjects outside of coffee, but he will laugh and dodge the question when asked why. While he is gentle and calm most of the time, he is merciless to those who would steal away the relaxation time of others, and rumor has it that he can be downright terrifying when angered.
DETAIL_EXIO_H01: Exio is a ■■■■■■■ ■■■ate■ fr■m a human ■■■■ with Observer potential. His abilities as an Observer are simply his ■■■■■■■■ ■■■■■■ serving ■ similar ■■■■■■■, and his transformed appearance is no more than a ■■■■■■■■ ■■■■■■■■■ ■■■■■■■■. Because his body is ■■■■■■ ■■■■■, he leaves combat entirely to ■■■■■■■ ■■■■■■■■■■■■■ of his mind, ■■■ ■■ ■■■■■■■. The madness-granting skill his sidekick manifestation is endowed is merely an ■■■■■■■■■■ of an ability intended to be reflective of ■■■self.
DETAIL_EXIO_H02: ■■■■ is an experi■■■■■ lab rat of the ■■■■■, who attempted to find out what would happen when a ■■■butsu's unique information ■■■■■■ faculties are paired with an Ob■■■■■■'s potential and ■■■■ance for ■■■■■-dimensional observation. ■■io, it turns out, was the first subject to survive the Brok■■'s experimentation. He managed to keep his ■■■ity in check amid the infinite circulation of his infinite ■■■■■ in paral■■■ universes—their sen■■■, thou■■■, and experi■■■■■ in tandem—by intervening with his own thoughts and continued embrace of a ■■■■■■■■ known commonly as a dream. Although more of an obsession, that dream is, of course, taking revenge on the ■■■ker so that he may ■■■■■■■ those whom he ■■■■■■■■ to be his ■■■■■■.
DETAIL_EXIO_H03: Exio is a Kaibutsu created from a human base with Observer potential. His abilities as an Observer are simply his Kaibutsu powers serving a similar function, and his transformed appearance is no more than a Kaibutsu epidermal exterior. Because his body is mostly human, he leaves combat entirely to another manifestation of his mind, the Id Replica. The madness-granting skill his sidekick manifestation is endowed with is merely an adaptation of an ability intended to be reflective of himself.
DETAIL_EXIO_H04: Exio is an experimental lab rat of the Broker, who attempted to find out what would happen when a Kaibutsu's unique information-sharing faculties are paired with an Observer's potential and tolerance for multi-dimensional observation. Exio, it turns out, was the first subject to survive the Broker's experimentation. He managed to keep his sanity in check amid the infinite circulation of his infinite selves in parallel universes—their senses, thoughts, and experiences in tandem—by intervening with his own thoughts and continued embrace of a delusion known commonly as a dream. Although more of an obsession, that dream is, of course, taking revenge on the Broker so that he may protect those whom he considers to be his heroes.
DETAIL_EXIO_S01:
A mysterious Observer who often works with Parallel Flight, Exio is a Terran from Sydney, Australia. His full name is "Exio Grant," and although, outwardly, he is a highly acclaimed massage therapist for his marvelous talent and gentle nature, behind the scenes, he is a member of an underground organization which seeks to bring a "certain plan" to fruition. He appears to harbor intense hostility toward the Broker.

Not even Melide, Yoshiori, or Monomasa, who are closest to him, know his true objective. Yet, everyone who works with him knows that he knows more than anyone else what the Broker's ambitions are, and that he is doing all that he can to ensure that those ambitions are not brought to fruition. Anyone who comes to crack the code behind Exio's true intentions will likely unlock the truths behind the Observers in society, their standing, how they are treated, and how they came to be.
DETAIL_FARDEN_H01: His Parallel Weapon is essentially a pop-up book. He wants to be a figure children look up to, ideally without putting in much effort—after all, combat is scary. This is the unheroic Fayden in our world. In the book containing the works his parallel self created, he finds a way forward, and by opening that book and calling to the stories he has penned to unleash the pages into the world, he brings the denizens of his fantasy land into reality. On one page a fairy provides the Heroes with mystical aid, while on another animal soldiers block the Kaibutsu's advance. If everything is in order, Fayden can even rewrite an entire area into a scene from his book. His combat style confounds his foes with techniques that border on magical, and what could suit a dreamer like Fayden more?
DETAIL_FARDEN_H02: The Parallel Weapon he wields contains every story imaginable to him, regardless of whether he dreamed it up and abandoned it halfway or heard it from someone else. He is the ideal author in his mind's eye as a Hero, and a figure beloved by children as well. Underlying Fayden's desire to become a smash hit, however, exists a powerful Hero's dream, and upon awaking from it, he begins to walk the path of a true Hero. Staring down reality as he puts his ideals to pen and paper, that dream remains firmly in his grasp, and should it somehow become lost, he can simply imagine a new one.
DETAIL_FARDEN_S01: A famed picture-book author known all throughout the galaxy! Popular with both children and their parents! That is what Fayden hopes and dreams to become while lying in the pit of his slothful, lazy lifestyle. He typically imagines a rosy future for himself before falling back into his gray reality—such is his cycle. While dreaming, he often sees his former beloved, now gone from his presence. Ever since that shocking breakup after they had vowed to spend their future together, Fayden has adopted the habit of averting his gaze from painful reality. This effects his career as an artist, and is a contributing factor to his lack of success despite his talent.
DETAIL_FLAMIERGHOSTWOODS2204_H01: Working with Hisaki's lab as a volunteer, Flamier attends Wehmalt's flower festival in an appropriate hero suit, complete with Parallel Weapons that bear a striking resemblance to the dance shoes her grandfather once gave her as a child. The glowing shoes draw the attention of all around her, and the trails of light left behind beguile her foes. Her grandfather told her that whatever she does, that she ought to enjoy it to the fullest. She continues to follow his advance, dancing like a beautiful flower petal twirling about in the wind while overwhelming all who challenge her with dazzling grace.
DETAIL_FLAMIERGHOSTWOODS2204_H02: As a child, Flamier loved to dance; however, her education demanded that her actions fall in line with her status, thus resulting in her suppressing her childish desires so that she could play the part that those around sought from her. It was her grandfather who took note of this and treated her for the person she was rather than simply as a granddaughter of his ilk. He taught her to be true to herself, to be proud of herself, and to love herself. These virtues form the bedrock on which she stands, even now, long after his passing.
DETAIL_FLAMIER_H01: With her lab coat fluttering like a cape as she fights, Flamier transforms into a hero who commands a vast array of tools for combining and igniting chemical compounds in battle. Rather than harm her foes with explosions, however, she seeks to enchant her audience with beautiful flames, making her attacks more like a pyrotechnic show than a bombing run. Still, it is difficult not to feel some level of terror in response to the infernos that she ignites.
DETAIL_FLAMIER_H02: Her heartfelt wish is to set off the galaxy's most beautiful fireworks wherever they will bloom most beautifully. However, ignition can only occur where there is atmosphere, and the various atmospheres on various planets complicate matters further. Worse still, there are so many substances that cannot even combust! Thus, she spends her days researching different ways to ignite all sorts of different substances, all in service of her dream. Indeed, one could search all the galaxy and never find anyone as attached to flames as she.
DETAIL_FLAMIER_S01: Flamier works as a chemistry teacher in one of the most prestigious high schools in the Lunar Cities. A Lunarian, she was born the daughter of the family which lays sole claim to all asteroid belt mining. Though her brains and beauty have won her many admirers in school and from society at large, her bizarre attachment to everything that burns bright and beautiful has led her to acquire an unusual amount of knowledge concerning gunpowder, explosives, and other flammables. Still, she dreams of one day making fireworks that bloom with beauty yet unseen.
DETAIL_FURLONGCIRCUS2202_H01: Set to perform acrobatics at the circus, Furlong resolves to transform not to save lives but to entertain. His eye-catching yet lightweight outfit is constructed to make the best of his considerable athletic abilities. Since he spends his days undergoing harsh training to rescue people from desperate situations, he has absorbed high-level jujitsu-like acrobatic moves like a sponge—mastering them quickly and performing them boldly under the spotlight. His performances are so breathtaking that they make it seem as though his bashful personality might also be just as an act of his.
DETAIL_FURLONGCIRCUS2202_H02: His transformation was originally meant for personal development. By psyching himself up and playing the part of a strong, dominant individual, he hoped to hide away his own weaknesses and cowardice. When faced with the source of the trauma that had left his heart so deeply scarred, hiding this crux any longer proved impossible. In the end, transforming for others instead of for himself finally enabled him to attain his new form.
DETAIL_FURLONG_H01: Furlong had long vowed to become a firefighter whose passion for the job burned hotter than any flame, and his hero form truly manifests that. He transforms into "Burn Striker," a bold hero whose daring persona is second to none. He will leap into action at any disaster site without a moment's hesitation, braving flames and smoke to save lives. The Parallel Weapon oxygen tank on his back has nothing to do with this change in personality. Rather, this change is thanks to the courage that dwells beneath his usual timidity, which is awakened by the transformation and brought to the forefront.
DETAIL_FURLONG_H02: How did such a shockingly timid and wimpy man end up responsible for saving lives? He wanted to change his cowardly nature, no matter what. Having people's lives in his hands forces him to reach deep and draw out his courage. His mind and body metaphorically pass the baton to his bold, invincible other self who will lose to no one just as much as he will lose to no fire. Once his braver self has taken over, he dashes in to save the innocent from what threatens them, whether it be monster or flame.
DETAIL_FURLONG_S01: Furlong is a firefighter who works in Orient City. A Cosman born off-world, his full name is Furl Furlong Heil. Coming from a planet with much higher temperatures than Earth, Furlong has both a higher basal body temperature than the average Terran and a much greater tolerance for heat, making him a perfect firefighter for rescue missions at the scenes of intense fires. In his social life, he is a shy, timid, peace-loving man who can be easily pressured into doing almost anything, and he speaks fairly formally to everyone. When speaking to the police officer Barrel, however, who happens to be close to his age, his language grows more casual.
DETAIL_GAISEI_H01: Gaisei's people are blessed with metal-hard bones, and the blade Parallel Weapons extending from his forearms are made even stronger by his genetic stock. His steel-cutting blades and bone-shaped armor all come from his body's inborn abilities, which is why his hero suit is particularly revealing and designed not to obstruct his movements. It also serves to send the message to his foes that his body and skill are greater than theirs.
DETAIL_GAISEI_H02: Having grown up in an orphanage on a backwater planet wracked with brutal inequality, Gaisei has seen the strong plunder the weak all of his life. Even the orphanage director who had taught him martial arts and protected the children with all he had had been destroyed by a greater force. Taking these lessons to heart, after being rescued and brought to Earth, he ran off to journey throughout the stars, seeking only battlefields where he could face off against the strong. These are his beliefs and this is his compulsion. Strength determines all, and he must be the strongest.
DETAIL_GAISEI_S01: A bodyguard to a pawn broker-cum-used goods salesman with a past, Gaisei is a Cosman youth with a strong resemblance to a Terran. Seeing meaning in nothing other than tempering his abilities and defeating the strong, he will leave his shop of employ in the blink of an eye to seek combat on the battlefield if worthy opponents are to be found. While he wears a cruel smile in combat, slashing his way through the field with perverse joy, he brings no such energy to life outside of battle. When not fighting or training, he can often be seen staring off into space.
DETAIL_GAIUSSEEKERS2502_H01: Having visited a certain desert country, Gaius hears legends of a king who brought abundance to the people of the land in ages long past—a king he bears a resemblance to. Contemplating this monarch of old, he gains a new visage, one that performs a blade dance to soothe the hearts and minds of his subjects. The suit he wears combines the authority of a ruler with the grace of a dancer, and it is complemented by a ceremonial two-handed sword Parallel Weapon. The blade glitters to match Gaius' dancing on the battlefield, invigorating the hearts of those who fight alongside him on his stage and unleashing the vitality within.
DETAIL_GAIUSSEEKERS2502_H02: Gaius disembarks on a desert planet, in search of information on his roots. There, he finds himself in a festival honoring a former king who looked just like him. The king was a man of the people: drinking and making merry with them, dancing for them, living with them. As he rubs shoulders with the locals in the festival and gets to know them, a thought occurs to Gaius. Perhaps, he surmises, that king of old sought his true self in others, as Gaius does now. Because, as does gazing alone at the lake's surface daily to find his roots while absorbing its beauty edify his soul, so too does sharing the sensation of the refreshing desert winds with another.
DETAIL_GAIUS_H01: Gaius uses a glove Parallel Weapon that can generate a bow and arrows from ether. The strength and size of these energy arrows depend on available View Power, and he can control their speed at will after firing them, allowing him to attack from afar without suffering any penalties to impact strength. On the mobility side, Gaius's hero suit is optimized for underwater action, and he uses the ring and dorsal fin modules on his back to control the flow of the water around him, allowing him complete mobility and the ability to enter a combat stance in the blink of an eye.
DETAIL_GAIUS_H02: The elderly couple who raised Gaius passed away when he was a teenager, leaving him a letter that revealed they were not related by blood. Having always felt a barrier between himself and others, Gaius resolved to live on his own and by his own strength—relying on no one. He would discover where he came from, too. He often finds himself staring down at his reflection on the surface of his beloved lake, asking himself the question that rules his life, "Who am I?" When he dives into the water, he believes in his heart of hearts that the answer lies in its depths.
DETAIL_GAIUS_S01: Gaius always loved diving in his hometown's lake, making him a perfect fit to become both a tour guide and an instructor. Unfortunately, his love is a bit too strong, which is shown in his rather scary demeanor, and he hates the idea of the lake being harmed or polluted, so he does not get many requests for lessons or tours. A lover of the quiet world beneath the waves, diving in the lake is a daily habit of his, leaving Gaius with more experience diving in the lake and knowledge about it than anyone else. His skin is covered in tattoo-like patterns, and he will often wear a wetsuit to hide them.
DETAIL_GAMMEIRAKUSAI2304_H01: Undertaking an undercover investigation in a city awash with festival spirit, Gammei dons his UEHA-supplied combat tag-shaped Parallel Cue and transforms. When the light subsides, he stands wearing a new hero suit in the spirit of festival garb. The banner Parallel Weapon he carries was once used by firefighters in the Japan of antiquity and is now commonly seen at the head of festival processions. He holds it up and swings it proudly, eyeing the battlefield like a garden he is destined to mess up.
DETAIL_GAMMEIRAKUSAI2304_H02: He remembers his hometown well. Living in a town so devastated was never easy, but his childhood remains irreplaceable to him, as it forms the core of who he is as a person. Justlock is a hero who protects the people. He is a being who goes beyond social positions and roles to live in a manner that Gammei finally realizes fits his wishes. Dressed in his best for the anticipation of all, Gammei holds his banner up high.
DETAIL_GAMMEI_H01: Gammei transforms into the hero "Justlock," wielding handcuff-shaped rings with chains that can extend endlessly. Both the chains and the rings can expand and contract to fit their target, allowing him to arrest beings of any size. His battlefield skills reflect his storied career as both a detective and as a hero, as well as his surviving the Kaibutsu attack that destroyed his city.
DETAIL_GAMMEI_H02: Gammei does not see his job as the glitzy, made-for-camera work of a hero. In fact, he calls himself a "trench cleaner." Cases involving villains and Kaibutsu often have no clear evidence left behind and usually go cold. That is where Gammei comes in as a hero, but it is also why he gets all those cases dumped on him. He clears them, of course, albeit while grumbling on his way to the crime scenes.
DETAIL_GAMMEI_S01: Gammei works for Orient City's Metropolitan Police Force as a detective in charge of cases involving Kaibutsu and villains. A Terran from Chiba, Japan, his full name is Gammei Tsukinowa. Though he seems unmotivated and apathetic, he is as serious a police officer as one comes. Even so, he has a tough row to hoe; cases nobody wants get thrown his way, and he constantly feels pressure from above and below as a mid-level manager—not to mention dealing with old age or being poorly paid... It never ends for Gammei.
DETAIL_GANRAN_H01: When Ganran transforms into a hero, he wields a massive hammer Parallel Weapon, and the hero suit he dons wraps him in a heavy chain. The chain grows hotter and ever more durable with every attack sustained, gaining strength much like steel being forged. This power is delivered to the hammer attached to the end of the chain, allowing him to slam superheated blows into his obstacles. Ganran is also able to manifest a metallurgical hearth for creating weapons and armor by unleashing his accumulated energy.
DETAIL_GANRAN_H02: Ganran was once summoned to a far-off kingdom to forge a replica of a legendary axe that would serve as the land's symbol of peace. He toiled away at trying to forge the perfect replica, but he could not produce an axe that could meet his satisfaction. One day during this struggle, however, the kingdom was attacked by Kaibutsu. As the land fell into ruin, he rescued Barte, the king's child, and resolved to raise them back home. Once fully grown, Barte coaxed their way into becoming Ganran's first disciple, but then they got caught up in another Kaibutsu attack and vanished from the cosmos. Ganran believes that Barte will come back one day, and so he continues to work the forge, striving to be the mentor his disciple will need upon their return.
DETAIL_GANRAN_S01: Ganran is a Dwarven Cosman who works as a blacksmith on the planet Garndera. Though regarded well enough to get requests from far-off planets, it is his stance as an artisan to treat all of his jobs equally no matter who his client is. He loves the moments when he finds himself able to withstand something which he previously could not, much like steel which grows stronger with forging. It is in those moments when he feels that he has truly become stronger, and for that reason, he is quite fond of endurance tests. Though he will never force such a test on anyone, he is always overjoyed when they oblige.
DETAIL_GARBO_H01: When the situation calls for a hero, Galvo sheds most of his clothing, and his hands and feet become crystalline and wreathed in azure flames. This form represents what he will become after achieving his wishes—a vision of himself that came to him in a dream. The loose garb that adorns his body is the traditionally significant dress of his people. Each time he unleashes the ferocity of his draconic heart with his flaming limbs, tapping into instincts and temperament rarely touched upon in his daily life, his flames burn ever brighter. It is quite apparent that their blinding light fills Galvo with much pride.
DETAIL_GARBO_H02: Galvo's species is able to reincarnate, leaving records of their lives preserved in a viewable archive when they do so. To hear Galvo describe it, "It's like passing the torch." The lifespan of any individual, reincarnations included, only ends when they are satisfied with their life as a whole. However, it is not death Galvo seeks in becoming a hero. What he seeks is the experience of living a full life. He once saw a version of himself in a dream—a version of himself who had seen it all, done it all, and lived it all—and that is the form he takes when he becomes a hero.
DETAIL_GARBO_S01: Galvo is a linguistics researcher, a translator, and a long-lived Cosman who bears a striking resemblance to a dragon. In a world that speaks Space Common, Galvo's linguistics research pursues that which has been softened and cast off by the existence of the common tongue. With a deep knowledge of cultures, he works to both preserve concepts in danger of being lost and to bolster Space Common. He greatly values experiencing cultures as they are firsthand, and he often takes an eager interest in whatever is trending.
DETAIL_GENJI_H01: Genji bears Parallel Weapons on his back resembling steel tubes when he takes to the battlefield. He wields them like poles, sweeping, slicing, and swiping as he confronts his foes. Despite their functionality as weapons in close combat, their true use lies in the creation of scaffolding and bridging. Sticking the tubes into the ground spawns construction materials around them and creates bridges between them. This comes in handy when evacuating civilians or chasing after villains. He can also use them as barricades to support his allies. Genji believes that his role is to make other Heroes shine, and that it is his duty to create the stage for them to accomplish that.
DETAIL_GENJI_H02: Equipped with his Hero Suit, Genji is able to stand or maneuver in any environment as if it were Earth at sea level, whether it be atop water, in midair, or surrounded by a vacuum with no gravity. His perception determines land and sky, and his footsteps leave behind temporary footholds others can trod upon. Genji says that he lacks the big dreams for the future that many other Heroes have, and that ever since making a great mistake in the past, he has been living to atone. In order to fulfill a wish someone else left behind and send the next generation off to a nebulous future, he has decided to become a bridge himself. Though this is clearly Genji's dream for the future, he refuses to acknowledge it as such.
DETAIL_GENJI_S01: A Terran in the thick of middle age who runs Drum Scaffolding, a small construction company in Orient City, he himself is a scaffold worker who teaches his younger workers on work sites techniques he has learned over the years. Very particular, rough of speech, and plenty brusque, he is the very picture of a stubborn, old-school craftsman, a stereotype that is nearly extinct on Earth. On the other hand, he is extremely attentive to work-related details and prizes opportunities to let his younger workers shine. Though the company started out as a family business, he ended up running it on his own at some point. He rarely mentions the reasons for that himself, and very few know what it is that drove him to become a Hero.
DETAIL_GIANSARLIGHTYEARS2412_H01: Christmas is said to be a time when nice children are given presents while naughty children are punished. Clad in black Santa garb, however, Giansar does neither. His Parallel Weapon present box holds many objects of energy within it, all of which pop out in the form Giansar chooses when he wills it. He pulls out a bomb? Just a loud sound and a flash. See some adorably wrapped candy? It explodes and now it's all over the place. Giansar's surprise gifts, mixing in truth and deceit, almost seem to destroy the very concept of dividing naughty and nice being "correct" as he decorates the battlefield with his trickery.
DETAIL_GIANSARLIGHTYEARS2412_H02: Giansar had thought he was doing the right thing. Others disagreed, and he was unable to become a hero. Then, despite his wishes or beliefs, word about him spread, along with the idea that he had done the wrong thing. Time passed, and Giansar ended up helping with a certain Christmas event. There, he saw an unorthodox urban planner and "wrong" idols. They were following their beliefs and principles to make the event happen. As Giansar helped, spewing sarcastic comments all the while, the data of a black-garbed Santa showed in his eyes. Presents for nice children and punishments for naughty ones? He scoffs at the dichotomy and wishes for neither.
DETAIL_GIANSAR_H01: Giansar's knife Parallel Weapon absorbs and analyzes information about targets he stabs, allowing him to reproduce their appearance with his hero suit as a form of camouflage. Though the disguise created is incredibly convincing, his knife only works on heroes, and he cannot save the information he has absorbed for later. If he wishes to change his disguise from one hero to another, he must deactivate this ability and analyze once again. Though frequent use reduces this ability's effectiveness, worlds based on information, such as advanced VR spaces, have excellent compatibility with his Parallel Weapon, along with his hacking skills.
DETAIL_GIANSAR_H02: The valedictorian of his class, Giansar was full of promise when he entered an influential hero training agency as an intern. Then, it all went wrong when he found himself caught up in a crime in progress. The actions he took in response were judged to be unheroic, so he did not get a hero license. Denied his dream and forced to endure regular observation as a dangerous figure, Giansar vowed that he would become the strongest hero of all, a hero with domain over the information of all heroes across the cosmos. He would become the true hero of his dreams, and he would do it all on his own.
DETAIL_GIANSAR_S01: Possessing deep technical knowledge of systems, both hardware and software, Giansar's rough speech and attitude are in stark contrast to his meticulous, nearly anal-retentive personality. He loves words like "perfection" and "accuracy," and he does all he can to eliminate every last ambiguity and complication from his plans. He also feels strongly resistant and resentful toward heroes, which is likely a result of his attempt to obtain a hero license in the past.
DETAIL_GNOMON_H01: Under normal circumstances, Gnomon portrays the appearance of a traditional wizard, wearing a robe and wielding a wooden staff. When he transforms, however, he takes on the visage of a wizard of the future, wielding a Parallel Weapon that improves both mobility and tactical effectiveness. His staff Parallel Weapon acts as both a computer and a matter converter, operated by the insertion of coin-shaped materials and the entry of spell chanting codes. In combat he uses techniques one would expect from a wizard, like launching fireballs and calling down lightning, but considering the time his Parallel Weapon requires calculating material usage and processing chanting codes, as well as his poor athletic abilities, he finds himself performing less than stellar in close range engagements.
DETAIL_GNOMON_H02: Gnomon's family possesses access to the world's highest-class grimoires, and they have fought through the generations against those who would steal their power or oppress them for it. As a result of this long-standing strife, by the time Gnomon came of age, he found himself living outside of society and feared as the Archmage. Growing up, he spent his days studying magic while living alone with his beloved uncle. Even after the death of his teacher, leaving him by his lonesome, he continues to protect the grimoire said to hold the sole method of avoiding the end of the world. He holds to this duty so that he may entrust the fate of the world to the Chosen One, who is sure to seek him out.
DETAIL_GNOMON_S01: Gnomon is a young Leo Therian Cosman. He hails from the planet Endoaira, in a parallel universe, which is on the brink of destruction. The most powerful spellcaster on his planet, he is referred to as the Archmage. Because of his penchant for tackling everything with a coldly competent and rational eye, people consider him to be distant and aloof, and lacking in feelings. In reality, he simply has a hard time directly expressing his emotions—in fact, his emotional range is far broader than one would expect. Due to his upbringing, he has difficulties interacting with others, and he calls himself a coward for this. Furthermore, although he is prodigious in size, he suffers from a lack of movement and exercise.
DETAIL_GOMEISAXMASMELT2212_H01: Gomeisa hopes for Christmas to be a time people of all ages may enjoy with jolly smiles on their faces. Having some dreadful threat ruin the festivities is the last thing he wants. With that desire in mind, he has attained a new hero form drawn from distant memories. The ice walls he conjures up from his hands and feet protect the innocent in a chilly embrace. His unending smile and vibrant dances provide just the right flair for the festivities. As the season of Christmas joy reaches its climax, the blessed dancer wishes from the bottom of his heart nothing but joy to all who look upon him.
DETAIL_GOMEISAXMASMELT2212_H02: Gomeisa reflects upon the sacred tree in his home village which would enclose itself in ice to protect itself from winter's bitter cold, as well as how Procy once cheered him up on a snowy Christmas Day by making him a snow hut. Both memories had taught him just how warm one could be when surrounded by walls of snow and ice. The knowledge gained from his homeland mixed with his warm memories of Christmas had redoubled his resolve, thus granting him his new form.
DETAIL_GOMEISA_H01: Gomeisa takes to the battlefield as a dancing hero, cloaked in the garb he wore as a dancer when he once performed rituals for the sacred trees back home. Since he is a passionate pacifist who dislikes fighting, he very rarely directly harms his foes. His true strength as a hero lies in the crystals of sunlight his body generates. These scatter through the air and shatter as he dances, and the light they leave behind heals the wounded.
DETAIL_GOMEISA_H02: Though he hates fighting, loves all things cute, and simply wants to get along with everyone, his desire for everyone to live a life of harmony and dancing has brought him to the battlefield. He believes that even the cruelest and most villainous foes, Kaibutsu included, can one day make amends with everyone else. So, he dances in battle, hoping that the peace he yearns for will arrive sooner than later.
DETAIL_GOMEISA_S01: Gomeisa is a young Giant Cosman who works as a waiter at Procy's bar, which is popular with heroes. He hails from an off-world culture that worships enormous trees. He was even once one of their sacrilegious dancers, which left him with a deep fondness for dancing. Innocent, nonchalant, and carefree, he loves people and never doubts them. He has no qualms with being touched or taking off his clothes and often makes clumsy mistakes due to his large size, resulting in Procy having his hands tied.
DETAIL_GOROGHOSTWOODS2204_H01: Goro's new hero suit is based on the costumes worn during Wehmalt's flower festival. He wields handmade toys and musical instruments that are recreated out of energy. The Parallel Weapon toys, filled with tricks and mechanisms designed to make children smile, act with minds of their own to protect Goro's allies while he plays his accordion Parallel Weapon, enabling its sound energy to invigorate those who listen with fighting energy.
DETAIL_GOROGHOSTWOODS2204_H02: Goro has one rule for himself: when dealing with kids, no drinking. Perhaps this is a humble parent's wish, a quiet desire that his own child would not dislike him for having alcohol breath. He has lost his child, his family, and his home, yet in the face of that loss, his song of choice on his accordion is a soothing lullaby. Goro savors his one heartfelt wish along with the joys of a past which he shall never relive. He has lived with the weight of the world on his shoulders, along with unrelenting regret, and he will continue to do so.
DETAIL_GORO_H01: Goro transforms into a hero form that allows him to use his hero powers to the fullest. He is as drunk as ever in this form, but his rubber-soled socks Parallel Weapon allow him to stand even on vertical walls, and he can pull out a variety of tools from his Parallel Weapon toolbox to create barriers and shelters with speed that would put even a full construction crew to shame.
DETAIL_GORO_H02: Goro had lived peacefully as a shipwright with his family until a Kaibutsu attack ruined everything. Adrift and separated from them, he eventually ended up on Muirauqa IV. That was when he became an alcoholic. When he awoke as a hero around this same time, he came to realize how strongly he desired to make a home even Kaibutsu could not destroy. His loss of family has left him sensitive and prone to worrying whenever he sees those bonded by love or blood torn apart, even if he does not know them.
DETAIL_GORO_S01: Goro handles boat construction and repair as a shipwright in a seastead city on the oceanic planet of Muirauqa IV. Though not originally from Muirauqa IV, his long journey through the stars brought him here. Laid-back, optimistic, but rather sleazy, Goro is never without a bottle of booze in attendance, even when on the job. Drinking aside, he is a fantastic shipwright with a sharp mind and deft hands. He also possesses the impressive ability of laying out blueprints in his mind and duplicating them in construction, even down to the finer details.
DETAIL_GRIGORY_H01: Since Grigory himself is seldom eager to don his suit and go out to do hero work, few know what he looks like in hero form or even how he operates as one. His Parallel Weapon consists of two spheres with geometrical patterns that possess tremendous broadcasting functionality—providing hero repletion, filming and photography, streaming, and more. His most impressive ability is the power to instantly teleport to where a hero is even if he does not know their location. This does, however, require more View Power the farther away he must teleport.
DETAIL_GRIGORY_H02: What deeply frustrates Grigory the most, as a hero himself, is heroes not being able to make full use of their abilities. Seeing news reports on missing heroes during his youth left him filled with rage and indignation from the thought that, just maybe, they had been slain while still unable to transform. Though he cannot remember precisely when he awakened as a hero, his Parallel Weapon is a manifestation of the power he dreamed of on that day, which is the ability to go anywhere and leave no hero behind.
DETAIL_GRIGORY_S01: Grigory is a drone designer and developer. Despite being a founding member of Warden International, which is active throughout Earth's sphere of influence, he modestly downplays his involvement, claiming that "It is the others there who possess true talent, whereas he is merely a hired hand." Operating under the motto that "heroes will surely die with no View Power," he works day and night to develop camera drones capable of hero surveillance and observation regardless of the circumstances or the hero's location in the cosmos. His brilliant design sense and all-round knowledge have also won him a job with Zero Trust as their technology consultant.
DETAIL_GUARDMANEARTH_H01: Guardsmen are Cosmen with rugged faces, mountainous bodies, and large horns on their heads. They live in the dark underbelly of society, and they are hired by those in power for their profound physical strength and cunning intelligence. Loose lips lose lives in their world, and each would rather die before spilling a secret or betraying an ally. They know too well that trust cannot be bought with money, and they play the part, proving they are more than just talk.
DETAIL_GUARDMANEARTH_S01: Wearing black hero suits and wielding black Parallel Weapons, they stand bravely before their targets. They work under the cover of dark and prefer the color black for all that it hides. Bodyguards lurk in the shadows, accomplishing their missions without wasting a shred of effort or piece of equipment. Efficient clothing and armaments are most optimal when one values trust above all else.
DETAIL_GUARDMANFIRE_H01: Guardsmen are Cosmen with rugged faces, mountainous bodies, and large horns on their heads. They live in the dark underbelly of society, and they are hired by those in power for their profound physical strength and cunning intelligence. Loose lips lose lives in their world, and each would rather die before spilling a secret or betraying an ally. They know too well that trust cannot be bought with money, and they play the part, proving they are more than just talk.
