Bodyguards lurk in the shadows, accomplishing their missions without wasting a shred of effort or piece of equipment. Efficient clothing and armaments are most optimal when one values trust above all else.
DETAIL_HISAKILOSTANCIENTS2208_H01: Hisaki has gained new gear from guarding the floating ruins on the planet of Sama-ed. His Parallel Weapons are now fish-shaped robots that act autonomously to protect him in battle, primarily deploying bubble shields to rebuff enemy attacks. They are helpful in the mobility department as well, since Hisaki can grab their backs to swim freely underwater with stunning speed and maneuverability. Hisaki puts all his effort as an inventor into grappling with as-yet-unknown technology, and this particular effort has borne fruit. He is of one mind and one heart with the machines as he zips through the water.
DETAIL_HISAKILOSTANCIENTS2208_H02: In a parallel world, Hisaki developed a new form of life combining Hito and robot—a link he invented after experience taught him his technology could be misused for ulterior motives contrary to his intent. What does he truly wish to make? What kind of relationships can Hito and robots have? How should technology be used? Determined to grapple with these questions and their lack of clear-cut answers, Hisaki utilizes technology to cut through the unknown with the flames of his passion ever burning.
DETAIL_HISAKI_H01: Hisaki dreams of a glorious future for himself, and lo behold, his Parallel Weapons are, in fact, a pair of gloves spawned by that very future self of his via his own hands. His future self has attained the zenith of cutting-edge technology possible in the whole universe, and by accessing the mind of his future self, he can produce and weaponize inventions impossible with today's technology through his gloves. These weapons are so advanced that their effects are indistinguishable from those of magic—true testaments to the boundless possibilities science has to offer.
DETAIL_HISAKI_H02: Hisaki prides himself on his genius intellect, always conducting himself with absolute confidence in all that he does. Though his pervading self-assertive demeanor and need for approval are typically viewed as negative qualities, he candidly advocates these traits. His personality has been shaped by his defiance against the continued labeling of himself as a "phony" by those around him as well as by his concurrent desire to be acknowledged by those very people. These innermost desires fuel his drive to continue making the unbelievably incredible technological advancements accredited to him.
DETAIL_HISAKI_S01: Hisaki Yodobashi, a young factory worker for a mid-tier industrial manufacturer, is actually a Therian Cosman despite his Japanese name given to him by his foster parents. Hisaki is a genius inventor who possesses vast knowledge in the sciences as well as in engineering—and everyone knows it. Rather than working on the assembly line, he is generally holed up in his lab tucked away in a corner of the factory, completely absorbed in developing their latest line of products. Though pleasant to be around, self-assured, and quite sociable, he can be quite flippant and careless at times. Hisaki views his old college upper-classmate Crowne as an older sister figure, trusting and fearing her in equal measure.
DETAIL_HITOMISUMMERDIVE2108_H01: Performing on the oceanic planet of Muirauqa IV, Hitomi comes dressed for the occasion. "A pop idol," she says, voice burning with enthusiasm hotter than the summer sun, "always fights and dresses to match the theme!" And fight does she ever, using floating speakers to fire out sound waves at her foes. Driven by the desire to let her fans enjoy the resort in peace once again, Hitomi dons the mantle of Heartstopping Red Mermaid, singing and fighting until the day her voice gives out.
DETAIL_HITOMISUMMERDIVE2108_H02: Hitomi is deeply passionate about her choice of costume and always picks something appropriate for whatever concert or program she is performing in. This, naturally, led her to be interested in hero transformations, along with the deeply significant costumes they involve. Though her goal of becoming a perfect idol is still far away, she knows that with this costume, she has taken another sure step forward. Reinforcing that belief is her new hit summer single, which is available on streaming services now!
DETAIL_HITOMI_H01: Clad in a cute, glamorous stage costume, Hitomi takes to the battlefield as the idol hero dubbed "Heart-Stopping Red." When she sings into her microphone Parallel Weapon, she invigorates her allies, weakens her enemies, and so much more. Her scores of audience members are transfixed by her exhaustively researched, well-practiced demeanor as a performer.
DETAIL_HITOMI_H02: As a young girl at age fifteen, having physical strength that far surpasses that of her peers was bound to give her a complex disorder. While the crowds praise her for her cute demeanor and laud her as a professional idol, she struggles with containing her decidedly less-than-cute abilities in her daily pursuit of perfection. She finds herself in the ambiguous position of being seemingly popular yet somehow not at the same time. Notwithstanding, her single-minded pursuit of her dream has, indeed, inspired many who have found themselves on the brink of giving up to keep pushing forward with their own endeavors.
DETAIL_HITOMI_S01: Half Terran and half Cosman, Hiroshima-born Hitomi Ayauta is a pop celebrity based on Earth in Japan. Though energetic, pleasant, and a hard worker in the vein of the classic icons who came before her, her Cosman mother's genes have endowed her with physical strength far greater than that of a typical Terran. She often breaks company property due to her inability to control her strength, which stokes her fears toward interpersonal interactions that require physical touch such as handshaking in meet-and-greets with her fans.
DETAIL_HOULEY_H01: Houley's dream, to record any and all Hero activity, is the guiding principle of Zero Trust. This is expressed through his Parallel Weapon, a miniaturized version of the satellite bands the company has all over inhabited planets. It guides the Operator's power to observe and creates a Path in a location Houley dictates, allowing movement, acceleration, communication, and more to ignore the laws of physics there. This powerful ability does have a flaw, though, in that it depends on his synergy with the Operator in real-time, as well as the strength of his relationships with his allies.
DETAIL_HOULEY_H02: It happened long ago, when Houley was an ambitious manager in the Operation department thinking only of his next promotion. Immense environmental damage occurred in a far-off backwater planet, causing a large-scale shutdown of communications. Many died in the time it took to repair the lines, and he saw it all, leaving him scarred. Ever since that incident, he has worked tirelessly to make real an unthinkable dream: to create a world in which all people of the galaxy are connected and able to observe Heroes at any time. This unusual ambition is why he takes a strong interest in those who boldly attempt to realize difficult dreams.
DETAIL_HOULEY_S01: Houley is CEO of the company managing LIVE@HERO, the streaming app essential to any Hero, as well as the IT giant Zero Trust and its satellite band infrastructure needed to stream throughout the galaxy. An older gentleman from Muirauqa III's Reefcall, Houley has a rather flighty demeanor for one in such a dire role and is always upbeat, with a boy's playfulness and innocence. On the other hand, characteristic pauses and confident smiles blend in with his impressive stature to give him a rather imposing aura. A fan of exercise, he often calls his subordinates to the gym for "gym meetings."
DETAIL_HUCKLE_H01: The S-rank hero "Leap of Faith" is best characterized by his brilliant mind and the steel-shattering kicks he unleashes with his tree trunk-like legs. Since his return, neither quality has changed. When he leaps high into the heavens, with his white cape fluttering, and descends like a raging meteor to deliver an earth-splitting kick, the sheer force is so powerful that it leaves even his old partner "Bolt of Justice" utterly dumbfounded. Huckle himself, however, pretends not to notice that his weight gain has augmented his falling kick.
DETAIL_HUCKLE_H02: Although he was born with formidable leg strength, the reason why his legs are heightened further upon entering his hero form lies in his upbringing. He spent most of his early years of life like a caged bird, barred from going outside. This only strengthened his interest in the outside world, which led to a strongly held desire to travel and save the world on his own two legs. His Parallel Weapon fortifies his hips and legs, and the costume that adorns him is reminiscent of the seasoned traveler that he had aspired to become in his childhood.
DETAIL_HUCKLE_S01:
Founder and current CEO of Parallel Flight, Huckle occasionally takes to the battlefield as a hero operator. For a Cosman born off-world, he has adapted well to life on Earth. Mature and responsible while maintaining a laid-back demeanor, he can sometimes miss key details. This is possibly due to all the stress of reining in Ryekie's wild antics, who is under his guardianship. A talented observer, he excels at commanding other heroes in battle.

In days past, Huckle had been an S-ranked hero in a tag team with Ryekie under the names "Leap of Faith" and "Bolt of Justice" respectively. One day, Huckle's powers as an Observer suddenly awakened, and he found himself unable to transform into a hero anymore. Given the position he was in, he ended his hero career and shifted to supporting heroes instead. This backstory explains why he is so physically adept for battle and always knows how to make the right judgment call in combat.
DETAIL_HYDOORTRAVELERS2504_H01: Hydoor has agreed, reluctantly, to join the Chosen One's party on a journey to save the world. On that road, he attains a new form as a warrior who leads the way, cutting open a path forward. Yet there is something familiar about his "new" visage. He bears a striking resemblance to his appearance in the old days, when he was a pirate. His Parallel Weapon—or rather, Weapons—are the two large cutlasses he loved to use in those old days, as well. He charges into battle with his gleaming blades, slashing at foes and avoiding their attacks with the same grace and beauty he shows while swimming in his natural habitat, the sea.
DETAIL_HYDOORTRAVELERS2504_H02: Born to a race whose existence was waning, Hydoor took to the open seas to escape the air of resignation. Back home, people had given up on productive thinking and only lamented the tragedy they saw as inevitable. To his misfortune, the world Hydoor found himself in was much the same. Feeling the spirit of rebellion rising in him, he defied the approaching end of the world and resolved to struggle against it. No matter how illogical it may seem, or how impossible the odds, he feels that to forget resistance is to die a spiritual death. The cutlasses he wields are for cutting through fate with sheer determination, and he swings them with all the charisma he did back in his pirate days.
DETAIL_HYDOOR_H01: A surviving member of Muirauqa IV's indigenous population, Hydoor dons the traditional garb of his people when he assumes his hero form. The floating lane rope Parallel Weapon he wields unleashes liquified energy over spaces it extends across, creating a "sea" of sorts. With the stage set, the sea-born Hydoor swims through the water with absolute freedom, evading and eluding his foes while taking advantage of the water's currents to go on the offensive.
DETAIL_HYDOOR_H02: Impulsive, aggressive, and avaricious, Hydoor is the epitome of a thug, yet his heartfelt and wholesome desire is to protect the sea. On his home planet, the sea as well as his people were destroyed by an influx of off-worlders and their intense competition to extract and develop resources. While lamenting at the sight, his simple desire "to resist" drove young Hydoor into piracy. This experience stayed with him, and he refuses to turn a blind eye to anyone who dares to pollute the sea, the source of life, no matter what planet's sea that may be.
DETAIL_HYDOOR_S01: Hydoor is a swimmer affiliated with the sporting goods company Phalanx. He had started out looting the high seas of the oceanic planet Muirauqa IV as a pirate in a villain crew until a hero vanquished him and left him in prison. After his release, he worked at becoming both a professional swimmer and a reformed hero, making him quite a rarity. His imposing visage as a former pirate and harsh temperament stand out, but his time with his former crew also left him with a strong proclivity for teamwork. He also tends to take care of those around him. On the other hand, he is incredibly susceptible to flattery and provocations, making him rather gullible.
DETAIL_ISARIBIBATTLESHIP2411_H01: Taking part in the Fishing War, a proxy conflict over Muirauqa IV's waterways, Isaribi comes clad in a suit made just for it. His suit's skirt, an expression of his will to help his allies by hauling up the fish they catch, acts both as a device to improve defense while attached and as a net when detached. With both hands he wields a Parallel Weapon that bears a striking resemblance to the fishing rod his father used to use. The lamp hanging from its tip draws fish to it with its light, ensuring big hauls. However, fish aren't the only thing its light attracts.
DETAIL_ISARIBIBATTLESHIP2411_H02: Fishing rod Parallel Weapon in hand, Isaribi finds his mind drifting back to distant memories of childhood. Fun days of losing himself in fishing with his silent father, the core experiences that led him to become a fisherman. He has no memories, however, of the lantern atop the rod. This dogs him with the sense that he's forgetting something important, but try as he might, he cannot recall. He laughs it off, assuming that he'll remember eventually, and dazzles the battlefield with his impressive fishing techniques. When he manages to regain that memory, however, his Parallel Weapon will unleash its true power.
DETAIL_ISARIBI_H01: Isaribi's hero form allows him to take full advantage of his experience as a fisherman. Because the suit covers almost none of his body, his defense device is in the form of a straw skirt. His main Parallel Weapons are the harpoon on his back and the gloves on his hands. The gloves fire out nets that precisely fit the size of his target, and once they are immobilized, he goes in with his harpoon. Isaribi is a little rigid in his thinking, however, and does poorly against more cunning foes.
DETAIL_ISARIBI_H02: When he was still a rookie fisherman, Isaribi was attacked and swallowed whole by a gigantic fish during a fierce storm. While a hero did rush to the scene to rescue him, the beast that tried to eat him managed to escape into the dark waters, never to be seen again. Ever since that fateful moment, Isaribi has fought both as a hero and as a fisherman, dreaming of the day he encounters that fish once again for a rematch.
DETAIL_ISARIBI_S01: A fisher Cosman who makes a living via inshore fishing in the bountiful seas of the oceanic planet Muirauqa IV. Isaribi is impatient—quick to tear up when emotionally moved, and quick to fight when irked. Confident in his well-sculpted body and beefy muscles, he is always willing to get in a brawl or strip down to show off his bod. Indeed, an easy way to get on his good side is to compliment his punches or the aesthetic beauty of his muscles. He and Goro live in the same neighborhood of a seastead on Muirauqa, and they could never shrug the other off even if they tried. They drink far too often together for that.
DETAIL_JOEZEN_H01: When transformed into a hero, Jozen dons a suit reminiscent of a high-ranking military officer—his conception of the responsibility of his position made manifest. In hero form, the broken compass he wears around his neck regains its functionality, becoming helpful for grasping one's location again. Using his Parallel Weapon pen and ruler, he is able to write down shifts in air pressure and currents onto a manifested sea chart, bringing about those changes in reality. Though this ability is capable of conjuring up storms or lightning in specific spots, its usage requires a deep knowledge of the surrounding environment, making it weak and far less effective when used in unfamiliar territory.
DETAIL_JOEZEN_H02: It was Jozen's strong sense of responsibility and excellent ability to learn that propelled him into being a respected navigator at such a young age. He appears to be of a different species than Kiloc, and that is no surprise since the father and son are not actually blood-related. Though he finds himself cringing at his father, who is crowned with the nickname of "Laid-Back Craptain," he feels a deep gratitude to the man for raising him. From this gratitude comes the belief that his duty is to support his unreliable captain of a father and share in his dream of leading everyone to calm waters and a world with no conflict. For that reason, he does his best to work at both of his roles as navigator and hero, seeking a better future.
DETAIL_JOEZEN_S01: A boy who acts as the navigator for Muirauqa IV's city fleet, the Este Volta. Though the youngest crew member of the fleet's flagship, he possesses a great knowledge of navigational techniques and meteorology, and his ability to craft logical and accurate ship routes has won him great trust and respect. Cheerful, honest, and forthcoming, he is often doted on by those older than him, but he has no fondness for being treated like a child. He has complex feelings towards his adopted father Kiloc, captain of the ship. Since they have opposite personalities, Jozen often thrashes his father with a harsh word or two.
DETAIL_KALASKISUMMERNIGHT2407_H01: It was supposed to be a simple job to get Kalaski back into the groove after his vacation: make a photographic record of a hotel in its last days. He snaps picture after picture, preserving sights soon to be gone for the sake of all those who had stayed in its cozy halls before. Kalaski then gets dragged into performing in a send-off show and ends up attaining a new transformation through a Parallel Cue. The photographer's new form is flashy and fashionable, as expected of a stage performer, and he fights his glitzy battles with a spotlight Parallel Weapon, putting on an exciting show for all those who watch.
DETAIL_KALASKISUMMERNIGHT2407_H02: A photo Kalaski had taken. It depicts a scene of a refugee ship retreating from a war-ruined homeland. In the midst of gloom and despair, one refugee sings the song of a movie popular at the time with a smile. Looking at the photo, Kalaski remembers his subject saying, "even if our planet is gone, even if it's destined to fade as a piece of terrible news, I'm going to sing. I'm going to live." This gives him the courage he needs to take to the stage. Even if this is not a battlefield, it had its way of life, and he will make sure its fading shouts will not be forgotten.
DETAIL_KALASKI_H01: Kalaski's camera Parallel Weapon can literally freeze frames, stopping time for whatever he snaps a shot of. Though it is unreliable and only lasts a few seconds, when his parallel world paths are working at full power, its duration and area of effect remarkably improve. With the impressive, battlefield-trained athletic powers packed into his small body, five seconds, in his words, is all he needs to get the job done.
DETAIL_KALASKI_H02: Separated from his family during a civil war that engulfed his hometown, Kalaski somehow managed to survive. In his nearly thirty years of life, he has visited countless conflict zones, risking his life for photo after photo. For him, taking snapshots of the lives that burn bright and burn out on the battlefield to create records of their having once lived is his sworn duty and purpose in life.
DETAIL_KALASKI_S01: Kalaski is a Tigris Therian Cosman and noted war journalist who has photographed battlefields and soldiers all across the cosmos. Because his species takes longer than Terrans to mature, he is in his late 20s despite his childlike appearance. His professionalism as a journalist has led him to construct unbreakable emotional walls which keep out the private affairs of others while pushing those same people away from his own affairs. Still, if someone is nice to him, he cannot bring himself to treat them poorly—though he will act as surly as ever. In keeping with his persona as a cool, collected journalist, he will do his damnedest to act composed. His temperament, however, has cursed him to immediately fly off the handle on occasion, nay, on many occasions.
DETAIL_KILOC_H01: When transformed into a hero, Kiloc takes to the field wearing military garb befitting of a ship's captain for his hero suit. The anchor Parallel Weapon he holds over his shoulder can serve as a projectile, but that is not its true use. An anchor must hold its ship in place, and this anchor, when thrown, does just that. In other words, wherever the anchor falls, the ship and its crew will reach that point safely, protected by a barrier. The anchor is plagued with the weakness of being ineffective if shot down, meaning that one must know the right situation to deploy it in.
DETAIL_KILOC_H02: Son of the former Supreme Captain of the Este Volta, Kiloc has been trained from a young age in everything to do with operating a city fleet. His father was stern and passionate about his work while distant from his family, something Kiloc had little fondness for. Thus, he grew far outside of the mold of "perfect son" his father had in mind. Cheerful, laid back, and loath to work, the people of the Este Volta came to consider him a layabout prodigal son, yet were unable to dislike him regardless. When he became both captain and hero, he awakened to the dream of leading everyone to calm waters and a world with no conflict, something wildly distant from his normal conduct. Very few, however, know the truth of his heart.
DETAIL_KILOC_S01: The man in charge of the largest city fleet in Muirauqa IV, the Este Volta, as its Supreme Captain. Living up to his reputation as the most laid-back person in the whole Muirauqa system, he is impulsive, flexible, and very lustful. Considering how well disciplined his adopted son Jozen is, being the navigator of the fleet, one wonders who the guardian is when watching their daily interactions. Rumors abound of how such a man ended up in charge of the Este Volta, with speculations of Muirauqa IV's ruling body, the Captains' Council, pulling the strings.
DETAIL_KIRSCH_H01: When evil is afoot, Kirsch transforms into a hero wielding a large whisk Parallel Weapon that can transform into a variety of kitchen utensils. She can also use it to conjure up spirals, allowing her to utilize a secret technique known as "Twirl Baking," which her mentor passed on to her. The Parallel Weapon-made pastries and treats of all varieties she spins up restore her allies' energy along with their weapons when eaten.
DETAIL_KIRSCH_H02: A larger-than-life girl with a larger-than-life wish, Kirsch wishes to spend her entire pastry-chef life recreating the legendary pastry her mentor found at the edge of the galaxy after risking life and limb before leaving the recipe behind. Until the day comes when she can recreate it with her own hands, she shall continue down her path of being a combat pastry chef. As an aside, little gives her as much joy as hearing compliments for her treats.
DETAIL_KIRSCH_S01: A Cosman pastry chef in a small-town bakery, Kirsch, who is also known as "Storm Baker," treats pastry baking like both a sport and a martial art as she constantly trains to improve. Inheriting the will of her ill-fated mentor, a chef of renown who had fallen prey to a Kaibutsu's jaws while undergoing training to create the ultimate pastry, she makes treats using both eccentric and unorthodox techniques. This passion comes at a cost, however, and her lack of interest in anything other than pastries makes her stand out for her rather absurd conduct.
DETAIL_KOUKIRAKUSAI2304_H01: The townsfolk are eagerly looking forward to the festival, and Kouki steps up to protect them from forces that may threaten them. His suit, summoned by the Parallel Cue, satisfies his professional aesthetic with its mix of mobility and design. Though this is his first bout donning the suit, the actor believes strongly that it is a professional's duty to give the audience an enchanting performance no matter the situation. With a blade-shaped paddle Parallel Weapon in his hand and Sirius at his side, Kouki is ready for battle.
DETAIL_KOUKIRAKUSAI2304_H02: Kouki frets over who he is and where he ought to go. As he grows up, will he be able to keep on playing the role of the good boy that everyone expects of him? Will the audience accept him as he truly is? Sirius watches him struggle, quietly walking alongside him as his ever-present family. If dressing in his glamorous suit gives off the image of a protector, then stepping onto the field of battle in his festival attire makes him the aggressor. Kouki has faith that his heartfelt dream will come true one day as he carves out his path toward the future.
DETAIL_KOUKI_H01: A hero duo, Kuki and Sirius don matching attire when they transform. In their flashy costumes befitting entertainer heroes, they perform countless dazzling moves, all to keep the audience's eyes on them. When it comes to gaining attention on the battlefield through flashiness, this duo is second to none. It turns out they have a particular reason for why they take this approach, too.
DETAIL_KOUKI_H02: Kouki is in search of his mother who disappeared on him. Becoming an actor, receiving special approval to become a hero, along with everything else that he does are actions that he takes in hopes of standing out for his mother to take notice of him. Yet, no matter how high he rises or how many accolades he attains, his mother is nowhere to be found. While Kouki waits anxiously for her to reappear, his ever-present companion, Sirius, fulfills his wish that made him a hero, which is to forever remain by his master's side.
DETAIL_KOUKI_S01: Kouki Inukura and Sirius, both Nagoya-born, are a child actor and show animal duo featured heavily in the showbiz of Earth's sphere of influence. Programs, movies, shows, they do it all. Kouki's incredible performances have won him great acclaim as an actor, but his personality drastically differs based on his proximity to the cameras. When the cameras are rolling, he plays the part of the "good boy" who is obedient and loved by all. The moment filming stops, however, he becomes haughty and demanding, baring his fangs.
DETAIL_KYOICHIVALENTINE2102_H01: Donning a black suit and firing off chalk-shaped bullets, Kyoichi calls himself, "ETL, Agent of Love," and his passion is to save all the children at the center of acts of terrorism which plague the galaxy. As "love" itself is oftentimes viewed as an embarrassing, idyllic romanticism given how all secrets become exposed in this day and age, these children conversely paint a far more hellish reality in which they constantly torment, tease, and taunt one another. As the mature adult among them all, Kyoichi runs through enemy bases to rescue as many of these children as he can.
DETAIL_KYOICHIVALENTINE2102_H02: Poor at hiding things, Kyoichi actively reveals his thoughts and emotions in a manner he had been developing over the course of many years winning the trust of others. Intense honesty, however, does not always produce the desired results. In fact, being overly frank can lead to hurt feelings and broken hearts. Facing this dilemma in its most brutal form and feeling the task given to him far too great, Kyoichi is left scratching his head over the extreme burden this has placed on him—struggling not to be crushed by the responsibility that accompanies it.
DETAIL_KYOICHI_H01: The first time he encountered a Kaibutsu was at an elementary school he was visiting as a trainee. An older brother figure by nature with a strong desire to protect anyone younger than him, he realized at that moment how he desired to protect the very world his students lived in. Filled with this resolve, he became the hero known as the "Ele-Mentor." He uses grade school lesson props such as balls, vaulting boxes, triangles, and so forth to turn battles against Kaibutsu into teaching moments about why one ought not to do bad things, all while he protects them.
DETAIL_KYOICHI_H02: Kyoichi keeps it a secret from his students that he is the friendly neighborhood "Ele-Mentor." First and foremost, he does not wish to expose them to danger from villains who might come after him. Secondly, he is not a hero to simply show off or pad his resume. Whenever he sees kids pretending to be Ele-Mentor on the playground, all he does is quietly smile.
DETAIL_KYOICHI_S01: Kyoichi Otomo, a Terran from Sendai, Japan, works as an elementary school teacher in Orient City. He was Akashi's college upper-classmate and has just started work in the education sector. Since he had originally aimed to be a professional baseball player, his athletic abilities and reflexes are off the charts. Though he possesses the leadership skills and a magnanimous heart that makes the children look up to him, he does have a sleazy side to him, having a fondness for younger partners. Rest assured, of course, grade schoolers are far too young to qualify.
DETAIL_LILACSUMMERNIGHT2407_H01: Slated to perform in a show on a floating stage to send a closing hotel off with a bang, Lilac equips a Parallel Cue made specifically for the festivities and transforms. He now clothes himself in a stage outfit that appears to be a cross between a swimsuit and rainwear, and he wields an umbrella Parallel Weapon. When he opens his umbrella, the rain falling around Lilac bends to his will, becoming either a weapon to destroy obstacles in his path or refreshing waters to heal his allies.
DETAIL_LILACSUMMERNIGHT2407_H02: Taking to the stage, Lilac remembers a time in early childhood when he took a walk with his brother after the rain. While Lilac complained, saying he hated the rain, his brother showed him the beautiful buds that grew after the heavens' watering, saying that he loved the rain for the life it brought. Then his brother opened his umbrella and taught Lilac how to dance while it poured. There, they made a promise that when Lilac was grown enough to hold a big umbrella himself, they would dance at the flower festival. This would not come to pass. Yet even with this memory in his breast, Lilac smiles atop the stage, his face as clear as the sky after a storm.
DETAIL_LILAC_H01: Lilac controls flower shears as his Parallel Weapons with his mind alone, sending them flying toward his foes without touching the Parallel Weapons themselves. While he can increase the size and number of shears with View Power, this consumes a considerable amount of his stamina and mental energy in turn. Either way, even the smaller ones are deviously sharp, and he can shear anything, no matter how firm it is, that he likens to a branch with his Parallel Weapons.
DETAIL_LILAC_H02: Lilac's older brother, Hashidoi, was born sickly and with poor vision, but he consequently found himself drawn to smells, particularly those of flowers. As a child, Lilac was quite the opposite, being spunky, energetic, and always wanting to play. One day, after Hashidoi had spent a stretch of days bedridden and unable to play with him, Lilac said something heartless that he did not actually mean to say. Though as apologetic as a small child could be, losing his brother before he could express his apology to him branded him with the conviction that "if you have something you want to tell someone, say it right then and there."
DETAIL_LILAC_S01: A young man born and raised in the quiet, temperate off-world town of Wehmalt. He may look no different from a Terran, but he is indeed a Cosman, and that is not the only surprising revelation about him. Despite the imposing look in his eyes that often scares away strangers, he is gentle and kind, not to mention self-conscious about his appearance. He tries to hide his fearsome eyes with his bangs. Influenced by his older brother Hashidoi, he became interested in flowers at a young age. He has come to believe that they hold as much communicative power as words do—people often give flowers as gifts to share their feelings, after all.
DETAIL_LOREN_H01: Loren descends upon the battlefield as an angel donned in white, bearing the hero codename of Plaguer L. The feathers of his wing-shaped Parallel Weapons transform into medical supplies and apparatus in his hands. He then uses those supplies and apparatus to treat rescued civilians, heal his allies, and provide all sorts of other battlefield support.
DETAIL_LOREN_H02: The town Loren grew up in suffered a terrible Kaibutsu attack when he was still a student. He rushed out to heal the wounded in the disaster's wake, and one particular, heavily injured man took his hand after being treated by him and gave him a sincere thank-you, calling him an angel. Deeply moved by this, Loren vowed to become a nurse. He takes great pride in continuing to be an angel in white robe, and as long as there are wounded in the world who need his help, he will continue to take to the sky to save their lives.
DETAIL_LOREN_S01: Loren is a nurse who works in a general hospital in one of the Lunar Cities. Hailing from Birmingham, England, his full name is Loren Farrand. Though popular with patients for his soothing demeanor and kind heart, it is rather impressive that he is so popular considering how unthinkable and clumsy his constant blunders are. However, as the only staff member capable of stopping his fellow hero and colleague Dr. Rakta from running wild (as he tends to), Loren is greatly valued by the hospital.
DETAIL_MACULATA_H01: As a designer always on the offensive, her hero suit expresses her role as a tailor and as a woman defined by her moxie and aggression. From her fingertips, she fires out threads comprised of materials that will best assail her target, knitting them up into fabrics and clothes with idiosyncratic traits. The sight of her weaving clothes together from glittering thread enchants both her audience and enemies alike.
DETAIL_MACULATA_H02: To Maculata, to be daring is to fight, to resist, and to be oneself. She neither folds in to the masses nor bends to the trends, for she is the one who sets the trends. To always steer the ship at its helm is simply her way. Her people's customs demanded that she live by her own means. This fueled a rebellious stance toward adults, the ones imposing this on her, but now that she herself is an adult, this stance has shifted to possessing an identity that values being oneself above all. She now recognizes the importance of her own identity and also how important it is for her to protect it.
DETAIL_MACULATA_S01: A Cosman fashion designer based in Orient City, Maculata calls herself a "daring woman." She is bold, competitive, confident of her worth, and always ready to bite back if anyone looks down at her. With her blessed looks and physique, she also often takes to the runway as a model. She is hard on herself and equally hard on those around her, hence her tendency to meddle. Maculata also serves as Sui's mentor and guardian. She was entrusted to look after them, the child left behind by her friend. Still, with circumstances being what they are, the two do not have the closest of relationships.
DETAIL_MARFIKRUINS2104_H01: Marfik's new hero form was summoned forth by his boundless curiosity in the face of a labyrinth filled with mystery and wonder. His dungeoneering-optimized suit is supplemented with a variety of exploration tools and a Parallel Weapon that can be used both as a shovel and a greatsword. All this equipment befits a man who considers himself someone who will remain an adventurer till the day he dies. Nevertheless, the suit itself is a bit too "adventurous" even for him, being far more revealing than he had expected.
DETAIL_MARFIKRUINS2104_H02: Even after achieving his childhood dream of becoming an adventurer and traveling throughout the stars, Marfik finds himself coming up against that hard limit no one can resist called old age. Yet, even as he feels the years taking their toll, he continues adventuring, being powered by an insatiable curiosity and an unquenchable thirst for knowledge. As long as desire flows from the spring of his heart, his life as a hero and adventurer will go on.
DETAIL_MARFIK_H01: In his hero form, Marfik looks the part of an adventurer, wielding a pickaxe and rope Parallel Weapons. When he digs with his pickaxe, he calls forth the dormant memories within the depths of the planet. His rope then pulls out those memories as energized entities, which he may use to attack enemies. There are limits to these energized entities, though, as they can only maintain their form for only a few minutes.
DETAIL_MARFIK_H02: Marfik is the embodiment of intellectually driven curiosity and wanderlust. His highest duty in life is to unlock all the secrets of life in the galaxy. Following his curiosity, he goes wherever, does whatever, and studies whatever he pleases. This way of life has resulted in parting ways with countless partners and lovers, regardless of how genuine and mutual his feelings were. If someone or something were to catch his attention and leave him obsessed and unwilling to let go, then that would truly be a manifestation of the universe's many mysteries.
DETAIL_MARFIK_S01: Though employed as a university archaeologist on paper, Marfik is and always will be an adventurer. A Terran from Indianapolis, U.S., this mischievous old man possesses superhuman vitality and tenacity. He has the analytical skills of a coolheaded scholar, brimming with curiosity much like a child. So great is his thirst for adventure that people say if he catches wind of some strange ruins on a planet on the edge of the galaxy, he will be gone by the next day. Marfik is in it for the love of the game, and he has no interest in whatever material wealth unearthing artifacts may bring.
DETAIL_MELIDE_S01:
A young Terran female Observer of unknown nationality who lives with Exio, her powers awakened at a much younger age. She is quite proficient at using her powers, and she has a greater capacity to interact with parallel universes than Exio. Quiet and reluctant to show her emotions, her demeanor and abilities have earned her the nickname of "Witch" from those around her. She uses this nickname herself now, since it matches how she is always on the prowl for witchy merchandise. Dainty and one not to give off much of a physical presence, she will often bring Monomasa along with her as her bodyguard during outings.

The awakening of Melide's powers occurring well before her teens ensured that her childhood would be a horrible one. She was feared and disdained by all. Some would even persecute and abuse her. In the end, on the day Kaibutsu brought death and destruction to her hometown, she was left for dead. This traumatic past had left her devoid of emotions, so much so that she had even forgotten how to cry. It was a fellow Observer by the name of Exio who extended an olive branch of salvation to her. Exio gave Melide the love her parents never did, and she was able to gain the resolve to live her life as a witch in part to return the favor to her new surrogate father.
DETAIL_MERCENARYEARTH_H01: The strongest consensus among mercenaries is that any job ought to be carried out through and through so long as one is paid; however, it is also a well-understood fact that one's martial arts skills are of utmost importance in gaining the trust of both comrades and employers. Mercenaries master every weapon they can and clear every mission they are capable of to build a resume of accomplishments. They hide themselves with optimal camouflage cloaks and blast their enemies with laser rifle Parallel Weapons, then slice at foes who come too close with knives fitted to the ends of their tails. This is the only true means of building trust among their peers.
DETAIL_MERCENARYEARTH_S01: Many mercenaries were once members of armies or militias throughout the galaxy, but none will speak of their past. As veterans of the battlefield, many are well-versed in military tactics, and even more are animated by bloodlust. What they all have in common is their meticulousness in preparing for combat. They know all too well that the slightest mistake or tiniest leaking of information can be fatal. As such, the act of showing one's face is a sign of hard-won trust—an unspoken rule among their ranks.
DETAIL_MERCENARYFIRE_H01: The strongest consensus among mercenaries is that any job ought to be carried out through and through so long as one is paid; however, it is also a well-understood fact that one's martial arts skills are of utmost importance in gaining the trust of both comrades and employers. Mercenaries master every weapon they can and clear every mission they are capable of to build a resume of accomplishments. This is the only true means of building trust among their peers.

They know all too well that the slightest mistake or tiniest leaking of information can be fatal. As such, the act of showing one's face is a sign of hard-won trust—an unspoken rule among their ranks.
DETAIL_MOKDAIMETEORITE2112_H01: Mokdai's desire to entertain viewers with flashy, fun effects even in the midst of intense battles has given him this new form. His gift sack Parallel Weapon is filled with ether and creates energized gifts that invigorate all who come into contact with them. He also commands an energized sled Parallel Weapon that he can use to ram enemies if needed and to deliver gifts to select individuals wherever they may be. Mokdai glides through the winter night sky, flying to deliver Christmas joy to those waiting for Santa.
DETAIL_MOKDAIMETEORITE2112_H02: Christmas is Mokdai's favorite day of the year. He has lived on Earth for as long as he can remember, and his first memory was of life in a refugee camp for those whose planets had been destroyed by Kaibutsu. Though they lived with the fear of Kaibutsu hanging over them every day of their lives, they would always celebrate Christmas with a modest yet warm meal. Remembering that warmth and sense of togetherness, Mokdai solemnly wishes for Christmas to be a day where joy visits all equally, no matter how sordid their lives may be.
DETAIL_MOKDAI_H01: When it comes time for heroics, Mokdai transforms into his idealized version of an "awesome hero" with a Parallel Weapon that can make the most of his abilities to boot. His suit's gloves and boots enhance his hidden physical abilities up to their maximum potential, allowing him to jump to unthinkable heights and dish out shattering punches and kicks. Mokdai already has fearsome physical strength, and with his suit making him even stronger, he could not ask for better hero armaments.
DETAIL_MOKDAI_H02: Mokdai always looked up to heroes, learning everything he could about them, yet they always seemed impossibly out of his reach. He would never call his appearance "awesome," and past trauma from a horde of Kaibutsu causes him to cower before large numbers of them. He could not in his wildest dreams think that he would ever become a hero himself, that is, until heroes and operators showed him a different path...
DETAIL_MOKDAI_S01: A friendly employee of Parallel Flight, Mokdai is in charge of rolling the cameras and adding in visual effects. Though he looks like a Cosman Therian, he was actually born and raised in Fukuoka, Japan. A consummate nerd with a quick mind and deep knowledge of heroes, villains, and Kaibutsu, he impresses all with his battle strategies. Though he looks round and fluffy, his lineage has endowed him with terrifying physical strength.
DETAIL_MONOMASAWORKOUT2312_H01: The Parallel Cue he received was supposed to have been preset with a normal Santa Claus outfit, but upon transforming, the outfit proved to be incomplete. It came with a Parallel Weapon that creates star-shaped energized entities. Spurred on by the Christmas spirit, Dolovain, the parasite within Monomasa, makes a wish unbefitting his parasitic existence. His prayer, hamstrung by faint hope, is for the happiness of the Hito closest to him, and to dream that he may see tomorrow.
DETAIL_MONOMASAWORKOUT2312_H02: "Monomasa" is two beings in one body—Dolovain, the parasite, and Monomasa Osato, the host. These two hold opposing desires. Should one's wish be granted, the other's will be left ignored. Yet, can the same be said for Christmas Eve? For, on that miraculous night, the fleeting thoughts of spending time with family, sharing joy, and dreaming of tomorrow's presents all take shape under the stars. Dolovain has desired that this form embody this very starlight. Yet, just as "Monomasa" is not Dolovain alone, that starlight is always accompanied by a shadow.
DETAIL_MONOMASA_H01: When the time comes to transform, Dolovain moves his infestation to the surface, morphing Monomasa into "Monster Trooper." Dolovain's slime-like body wraps around Monomasa's, forming armor to protect him and enhance his physical capabilities. With the ability to stretch, contract, and thrash about at will, Dolovain fights against his former Kaibutsu comrades with inhuman tactics, devouring the devourers to survive another day.
DETAIL_MONOMASA_H02: Monomasa was born into an elite family, living his whole life by the wills of others. He was, in essence, a puppet. One day, exhausted by life and looking for a place to end it all, he happened upon a Kaibutsu on the brink of death. This Kaibutsu could speak, and it refused to eat people of its own accord. It offered Monomasa a suggestion, and after a brief exchange, Monomasa decided he would give the Kaibutsu his body and give up on his future. Dolovain's wish, in turn, became Monomasa's future return. He hopes that Monomasa's mind will resurface in their body and that the young man will find the will to love on his own volition.
DETAIL_MONOMASA_S01: Monomasa Osato is a strange being. He is a Therian Cosman possessed by a Kaibutsu named Dolovain who has its own consciousness, and it is Dolovain who people interact with at all times, as Monomasa's soul is trapped in a deep slumber. Kaibutsu are typically hollow vessels, so it is strange enough to find one with an ego, but what makes "Monomasa" a truly special being is his role as a "Villain of Justice" who respects and treasures all life. Whereas "Monomasa" is simply quiet and timid, Dolovain's demeanor is cool, calm, and collected.
DETAIL_MORIYASU_H01: Driven by the dream of discovering the 'best drink' in the entire galaxy—and of sharing that ultimate brew with as many people as possible—Moriyasu chose to become a hero. He transforms clad in a flamboyant hero suit designed to liven up any celebration, wielding massive parallel weapons in the form of a giant hammer and a sake barrel. The hammer serves not only as a weapon, but also as the key to its counterpart: by shattering the lid of the barrel, Moriyasu can unleash a flood of beverages, from fine liquors to every other drink he knows. As the battlefield fills with rising spirits and the intoxicating excitement of combat, Moriyasu himself becomes ever more refined in his movements, cutting down anything that stands in the way of the feast.
DETAIL_MORIYASU_H02: Raised as the son of a long-established sake brewery, Moriyasu came into conflict with his family over his vision of ideal brewing, which clashed with their strict devotion to traditional methods. Leaving home at a young age, he set out with a single driving desire: to learn about every kind of alcohol in the world and one day create his own perfect drink. To that end, he worked as a buyer for a major alcohol wholesale company, gaining experience while saving every bit he could. After resigning, he used those savings to open his own brewery. Moriyasu's Yamatsumi brand follows a philosophy completely opposite to that of his family, producing a wide range of beverages in both style and flavor, from sake and wine to whisky. As a result, it has continued to grow into a shop beloved even beyond its home planet. He has since reconciled with his father, and the two are said to share drinks together now, trading sharp critiques of each other's brews as they raise their cups.
DETAIL_MORIYASU_S01: The owner of a sake brewery on the outskirts of Orient City, his full name is Yamatsumi Moriyasu. He has an easygoing, open-hearted nature and rarely lets small details bother him, laughing off most problems and drinking away the rest after giving them a moment's thought. Perhaps because of this temperament, he is hopeless with fine details, leaving inventory management and bookkeeping entirely to his employees. Still, his keen eye for sake during the brewing process and his natural sociability have made him a fitting public face for the business. Outside of running the brewery, Moriyasu indulges in a personal hobby of collecting alcohol from across the cosmos. From time to time, he invites friends to gather at a counter set up in a renovated space at the back of the shop, where he casually opens it as a small, informal tavern.
DETAIL_NARIHITOMETEORITE2112_H01: Unable to forget the superhero figure he received as a Christmas present as a child, Narihito dons a hero suit of vivid red and gold. The hero of his memories wore a suit made by Doctor X that could resist any heat and most impacts, and Narihito's suit possesses incredible durability. It has equally powerful offenses, as well, and its right arm portion can transform into an energy cannon that is capable of annihilating a mountain at full power. Narihito vows that as long as he wields that mighty cannon, the children will safely have their Christmas.
DETAIL_NARIHITOMETEORITE2112_H02: With meteor impact imminent, Narihito thinks of the superhero he looked up to as a child. The hero in the stories would always show up in the nick of time to save the day, no matter the danger. He eventually grew up, got a job, and stopped holding out for heroes when he learned how the real world worked. Even now, though, he strongly believes that peace shall one day come, and just as the heroes in his past did, he, too, wishes to be the hero who protects everyone in need. He has been saved by heroes in both stories and reality, and his heart, filled with wishes to save others in turn, burns bright and radiant, like a sun upon the world.
DETAIL_NARIHITO_H01: Narihito specializes in information warfare. In his hero form, he weaponizes his own enormous collection of hero data—the best there is in the galaxy. He defuses any hostile situation by searching through his memories and records for the latest data on opposing heroes and Kaibutsu to extrapolate and execute the most effective means of attack. Though this ability sounds all-powerful on paper, if his information is fuzzy or incongruent with reality in the slightest, his militarization becomes drastically ineffective.
DETAIL_NARIHITO_H02: A large part of what drives Narihito's frightfully obsessive pursuit of information on heroes, villains, and Kaibutsu is his deep desire to reunite once more with the hero who saved his life. Said hero saved countless innocents, Narihito included, then disappeared without so much as giving his name. As much as Narihito has tried to remember this heroic figure whom he has admired for so long, that hero remains but an enigma in his memory. For years, he has pursued that image of the perfect hero shrouded in mystery, but until he catches up, he will keep on being a hero-cum-reporter in search of just the right scoop.
DETAIL_NARIHITO_S01: Narihito Karue, a Terran reporter from Kobe, Japan, works for the news company Taiyo News. Though he appears calm and collected at first glance, he turns into a passionate, near-frothing geek whenever the topic of heroes comes up. His coworkers rarely see him at the office since he is always running around every which way in search of news leads on heroes. A veritable encyclopedia, he is deeply knowledgeable about heroes, villains, and Kaibutsu from many regions and eras.
DETAIL_NESSENMASQUERADE2310_H01: Nessen visited a traditional festival hoping to find inspiration for a new event, and what he saw surprised him. People were putting everything they had into the festival's revelry for nothing more than their own enjoyment. He wished to protect them and their genuine joy, and thus he gained a new form with a hero suit as black as the night sky. The suit's accessory Parallel Weapon conjures up light that can change shape. The light attacks foes as much as it defends himself, becoming his dance partner as they waltz across the battlefield.
DETAIL_NESSENMASQUERADE2310_H02: "I have no idea how my work will be perceived by others. I'm simply giving shape to all that I am." These wise words from a tailor made Nessen reflect on his own understanding of hospitality. Indeed, regardless of whether his guests fully accepted or appreciated his generosity or not, he would continue to give his best. He realized that that was the hospitality he had been aiming for. As he looks down the path he knows he must travel, the resolution in his eyes shines like the night sky gently welcoming the moon into its company.
DETAIL_NESSEN_H01: Taking on the form of a bathhouse assistant, Nessen wields a gigantic paddle as his sword in his hero form. The paddle is wreathed in a water-like energized substance, and he coalesces the crowd's heat to raise the temperature of his blade. As their excitement boils over, so does that blazing-hot blade, becoming far hotter than even the boiling point of water. Alas, because he lacks the martial arts training to complement this formidable strength, his heavy swing provides a few too many openings for his opponents to exploit.
DETAIL_NESSEN_H02: His heart hurt by so many cruel, insensitive remarks, Nessen closed himself off from others, but he found solace in the comforting hot-spring waters of his parents' hometown and the warmth of those who lived there. In turn, the warmth of the town pushed him to grow into the excellent hotel manager he is today. For that, he is eternally grateful. His fondness for the town, surpassing even his feeling of indebtedness to it, is what drove him to become a hero. As long as the town he loves and protects continues to grow as a resort beloved by all, his dream shall live on.
DETAIL_NESSEN_S01: Nessen is the man in charge of the hot spring resort and the hot spring inn which overlooks it, located in the southern part of Orient City. Born in Shizuoka, Japan, his full name is Nessen Mochizuki. His mixed Terran and Cosman blood gives him a rugged appearance, with two sharp horns that often strike fear in those he first meets. Though gentle and calm by nature, he is flawed by an excessive sense of responsibility. He also likes bathing to an unusual degree, going for a soak at least five times a day.
DETAIL_OBSIDIUSCRISIS2404_H01: Filled with tempestuous rage after his younger colleagues were crushed and his own dream was torn apart and dissected, Obsidius vowed to do everything he could to fight those who sought to rule over him and his allies. Wielding a massive Gatling gun, he transforms into an avatar of destruction, raining death and destruction upon all who are foolish enough to be the oppressor. Even when hopelessly outnumbered, he will always encourage his sworn comrades with a warm smile as they charge into the fires of war. Yet, for all of Obsidius's boldness and bravado, there is, indeed, something out there that terrifies even him.
DETAIL_OBSIDIUSCRISIS2404_H02: Obsidius still clings to the dream of unraveling the secrets surrounding his birth, which actually fuels his passion as a scholar. The possibility of the joy of cracking the mysteries being stolen from him by others is also, ironically, why he refrains from undergoing examinations at hospitals and clinics. His incredibly durable body is the result of being dragged along on Marfik's wild adventures, as well as conducting mineral surveys on his own accord. The handy side effect of all this is that his durability largely spares him from injury and disease. On the flip side, such sturdiness also makes it hard for him to notice any encroaching illnesses.
DETAIL_OBSIDIUS_H01: When the situation calls for heroics, Obsidius dons a suit consisting of work clothes and a helmet reminiscent of a miner. His Parallel Weapon is a rock drill that hardens the more he knows about his target; even if he cannot destroy something with a single blow, information gained from breaking off a piece of its structure strengthens the drill. At its best, the drill becomes impossibly hard, capable of shattering anything—even breaking through the unknown.
DETAIL_OBSIDIUS_H02: Obsidius's earliest memory is of growing up in the orphanage. The only connection he has with his hometown is the bracelet made of a mysterious crystal he was told he had been wearing since birth. What is this crystal? Are there any planets that produce the same kind? If he ever finds such a planet that produces it, would that be where he originates from? Diving head-first into the mysteries that surround him to get to the bottom of them is his dream. As such, he continues to sail through the stars in search of answers.
DETAIL_OBSIDIUS_S01: A Bos Therian Cosman and mineralogy professor belonging to Orient City University, Obsidius believes strongly in field work and travels all over the galaxy in search of rare minerals, having both the vitality and toughness needed to keep up with his mind's boundless curiosity. While still a student, Marfik, another adventuring professor belonging to the same agency, was his mentor. Because Obsidius focuses on getting his hands dirty in the field, his understanding of machines outside of his field is poor, particularly those that require precise operation. He also has a soft, big brotherly side to him, forged from taking care of the younger children while growing up in an orphanage.
DETAIL_OKITAKACRISIS2404_H01: As the highest authority in the UEHA Japan Chapter and a veteran hero, Okitaka takes the field once again to save the younger heroes in their moment of need. He draws the same rifle affixed with a bayonet he gained proficiency with back in his cadet days and lunges into the struggle against AI-controlled chaos. His mobility is less impressive than it was at his peak, owing to his long years of serving as a strategist on the back lines. Still, his ability to quickly analyze battles and pick up small visual details has improved, showing the fruits of his long career as a hero.
DETAIL_OKITAKACRISIS2404_H02: Though Okitaka has now solidly established himself as a commander and a strategist, he had a much simpler dream back when he first became a hero. All he wanted was to protect those close to him from anything that threatened them, and his weapon of choice was a rifle affixed with a bayonet. Over time, he gained more opportunities to handle battle strategy, which actually led him to update his simple dream. He now wants to become a commander who can bring out the best in his comrades and allies, transitioning into more of a support-role hero. What has not changed, however, is the love he has for his comrades and his resolve to prioritize saving lives.
DETAIL_OKITAKA_H01: A longtime admirer of Zhuge Liang, Okitaka transforms into the hero renowned as "The Commander," a strategist wielding a war fan and shogi board. He stands out from other heroes in that, rather than fighting on his own, he champions strategy and teamwork to win his battles. His shogi board simulates how enemies and allies alike may interact on the battlefield. Okitaka moves his pieces around the shogi board, coordinates with his operator about the moves he sees are possible, waves his war fan to boost the morale of his allies, and leads his team to victory.
DETAIL_OKITAKA_H02: Two negative forces battle within his heart. One is the frustration of being kept in the command room giving orders and thus not taking the field and fighting with his allies. The other is the fear of dragging his allies down when he does take the field. He has been off the battlefield for years, after all. His sense of responsibility is far stronger than his demeanor suggests, so he accepts his position and lives with the frustration he feels from having made the right choice. As for what direction the battle will head when he does decide to join it, well... not even he knows.
DETAIL_OKITAKA_S01: Okitaka Takadono is an Osaka-born, middle-aged man who works in the General Affairs Department of Orient City Hall while serving as the commander of the UEHA Japan Chapter. Pleasant, sociable, and easygoing, he does not give off the air of someone who serves in an essential government post, but it is without question that his skills as a commander are understandably second to none. The tight-knit relationship between the UEHA and Parallel Flight is thanks to the deep bonds formed between Okitaka, Ryekia, and Huckle when they fought side by side in the past.
DETAIL_ORBITER_H01: When Orbiter transforms, he gains two Parallel Weapons: armor tough enough to withstand space debris and an anti-gravity module. Equipped with gravity generators on his chest and limbs, he manipulates gravity fields to allow himself to act freely, even in environments with little or no gravity. Also, by controlling the gravity of specific coordinates, he is able to draw a target closer to him or keep them in place. These powers come from Orbiter's deep desire to fly freely throughout space, which is itself an expression of his innocent, uncompromising passion for adventure.
DETAIL_ORBITER_H02: Orbiter is the model name of a certain kind of military spacesuit. Since he cannot remember his own name, he took on the name he found inside his suit. The pilot of Orbiter, formerly an external mechanic for a space battleship, found himself thrown into the void in space after an enemy attack during an interstellar conflict. Floating through space and seeing his coming end, he elected to preserve his unrealized dream by copying his consciousness data into the suit's assistant AI. Thus did imperfectly inherited memories and a childhood dream form the genesis of Orbiter, the astronaut.
DETAIL_ORBITER_H02_CLEAR_QUEST: ■■■■■■■■■ is the ■■■■■ ■■■■ of a certain kind of ■■■■■■■■ space■■■. ■■■■■ he cannot ■■■■■■■■ his ■■■■, he took on ■■■ ■■■■ he ■■■■■ inside his ■■■■.  The ■■■■■ of ■■■■■■, formerly an external mechanic for a space ■■■■■■■■■■, found himself ■■■■■■ into the ■■■■ in ■■■■■ after an ■■■■■ attack during an ■■■■■■■■■■■ conflict. ■■■■■■■■ through ■■■■■ and seeing his ■■■■■■ ■■■, he elected to ■■■■■■■ his ■■■■■■■■■■ ■■■■■ by ■■■■■■■ his ■■■■■■■■■■■■■ ■■■■ into the ■■it's ■■■■■■■■■ ■■. Thus, the imperfectly ■■heri■■■ mem■■■■ and child■■■■ dream ■■■■■■ the ■■■■■■■ of Orbiter, the astronaut.
DETAIL_ORBITER_S01: A boy with a deep interest in space who would like nothing more than to zip about the infinite cosmos. In contrast to his immense frame, he has an innocent and curious personality and is known to rapidly change the expressions shown on his face display. Orbiter always wears a spacesuit used for external ship labor, and he displays a strong resistance to taking it off. He seems to be working toward becoming an astronaut one day, going out on walks and playing while calling it "training" and "information gathering."
DETAIL_PHEIN_H01: He wears a bulky protective suit under his cape that fills with ether when it detects powerful impacts to keep him safe from harm. Keeping with the defensive theme, his Parallel Weapons are shields with robust grips that help him deflect and parry his opponent's attacks. He slices at opponents with blades of energy upon knocking them off-balance and nullifying their attacks. Parallel Weapons represent the inner nature of their users, and Phein's are no exceptions. They manifest his desire to protect those he is in charge of at all costs, thus also serving as his swords.
DETAIL_PHEIN_H02: Phein lost his father at a young age, leaving him alone to raise his younger brother in poverty. His brother passed away from an illness soon after, and Phein was powerless to stop it. It was the sheer strength of his desire for the power to protect his brother that awakened his hero powers, enabling him to defend the weak so that they wouldn't fall. Still, ever since the day of his awakening, he finds it hard to use his powers for himself, for in his mind, he is the one who let his brother die. Can such a person, his anxious mind asks, be allowed to wield such great power?
DETAIL_PHEIN_S01: A mercenary born in the slums of Maserimaose III. Focusing on security, rescue work, and suppression, he strives to protect the weak throughout his career. Protecting Hito in the field has won him a formidable reputation as an excellent protector. Being a man of few words, the harsh statements he makes toward those he is in charge of painfully stand out. They are born from worrying too much about them; he purposely wants to be disliked by them so they will not follow him into battle. He always carries around the candies his brother used to love, and he is often spotted sharing them with those who are suffering from hunger.
DETAIL_PLAYER_S01: A rookie hero Operator, you had been cast into this universe upon a mysterious Cosman named the Broker, having merged yourself with another version of you that exists in a parallel universe. Because the memories of your "other" self are so strong, the memories of you from "this" universe are spotty and hazy. Broker has nicknamed the current version of you "Special Edition 'You,'" and your abilities certainly live up to his moniker, as your ability to interact with parallel universes is outstanding even compared to other Observers.
DETAIL_POLARISWORKOUT2312_H01: Polaris Mask conjures up a grand plan to hold special Christmas performances all across Earth. He visits Parallel Flight with an eager look and a Parallel Cue preset with a Santa Claus outfit, and when he transforms... he makes a surprising discovery. Parts he had not ordered were included with the costume. Namely, large glove Parallel Weapons fashioned after bear claws. These gloves, which leave visible trails behind when he slashes with the claws, seem oddly familiar to the wrestler.
DETAIL_POLARISWORKOUT2312_H02: Polaris Mask takes pride in himself and the name he has built up over the years, and he keeps his mask on as proof of that. He gives presents to the needy without any hesitation or thoughts of charity and altruism, because Polaris Mask is an individual who extends a helping hand to those weaker than him. This concept of what a hero is, which he has held since childhood, is the same reason that Kensuke Kitagami cannot quite accept the bear claws that come with his suit.
DETAIL_POLARIS_H01: Donning a wrestling costume far flashier than his professional outfit in the ring, Polaris Mask transforms into Polaris the Great, wielding gravity rings fashioned into boots as his Parallel Weapon. With the power to strengthen gravity on the battlefield, he introduces crushing weight to both himself and his foes, forcing all parties to battle on the brink of their abilities to deliver a grand show to the audience.
DETAIL_POLARIS_H02: Polaris the Great's signature high-flying move, "Polaris Buster," makes full use of his considerable musculature to decimate foes who struggle against intense gravity. Even under intense gravity capable of squashing anything Earth could hope to impose on him, he smiles on, with his muscles creaking, as he gives the crowd that battle on the ropes, which they so desire. It is all done in service of his goal to fight the galaxy's strongest.
DETAIL_POLARIS_S01: A masked pro wrestler who wanders the stars, Kensuke Kitakami is a Sapporo-born Terran who is always in search of a worthy opponent. In years past, he had reached the very height of the professional wrestling world on Earth, proving the supremacy of his strength, but that was not enough. Still unsatisfied, he took to the stars in search of a new challenge. Gregarious by nature and a terminally positive thinker, his actions are impulsive and instinctual. While he may be a hero, possessing all the traits that classification suggests, he is also a troublemaker who causes as many problems as he solves.
DETAIL_PROCYCHOCOLATEFES2303_H01: This is the form Procy takes when he resolves to do what is right—both as a hero and as boss of his school. His student-reminiscent hero suit reflects his resolution to face the feelings he had ignored and could not be forthright about. As a poor student, he had dreamed of striking it rich beyond his imagination. Yet, even with that dream out of sight and out of reach, he began to see the promise of what lay beyond material gain. Now, as he wields fists strengthened by trading blows with his roughneck friends, he leads the charge to protect those dear to him.
DETAIL_PROCYCHOCOLATEFES2303_H02: On the day Procy resolved to leave the slum where he grew up to go on a moneymaking journey, a boy offered him a scarf as thanks for saving his life. How did the boy feel as he handed over that torn, tattered scarf? Though unable to comprehend why at the time, he now knows what drives heroes to sacrifice themselves despite seeking nothing in return. Hence, he wears that scarf around his neck as he dashes, faster than anyone else, to go help his friends in need.
DETAIL_PROCY_H01: Procy had strongly desired to be rich, and this sincere wish clearly shows in his rather rare, specialized hero form, which focuses entirely on making money. The tiny robot fluttering around him and the towering hammer that he carries around with him constitute his set of Parallel Weapons. The tiny robot tells him that his actions in the moment are what will lead him to the greatest possible profit, with his "lucky hammer" there to take whatever shape is needed to solidify his one-in-a-million chance of striking it rich into a 100% guarantee.
DETAIL_PROCY_H02: Having grown up in brutal poverty, never knowing whether he would see tomorrow, Procy had always dreamed of becoming rich and powerful so that he could live out life without monetary restraints, most of all. Holding onto this desire dearly in his heart, he labored away in the mines, mallet in hand and dust in lungs, day in and day out. One day, when a Kaibutsu attacked, he noticed how the mallet in his hand had transformed into a hammer Parallel Weapon made of gold. Becoming a hero changed everything for him. If he were to stake everything on his heroing, his dream of becoming rich might just come true. How could he possibly ignore such a wager as that?
DETAIL_PROCY_S01: Procy runs the Earth Camp Heroes' Guild, which is a bar popular with heroes for grabbing intel and comparing notes. Though he has the adorable appearance of a small dog, he is a veteran hero with a career spanning over twenty years. He is also a long-time friend of Ryekie and Huckle. Procy is good-humored and caring to those around him, but he has an unrivaled obsession with money. He hates paying more than he has to for anything, and he always has an ear out for get-rich-quick schemes. Ironically, keeping the bar running seems to have saddled him with a substantial amount of debt.
DETAIL_PUBRASEERRISINGMOON2410_H01: During the ceremony to celebrate the birth of a hero, Pubraseer remembers the day he became a leader himself. The saber Parallel Weapon he wields is able to call forth the ship he used to crew in energy form. The spacefaring navigation device Parallel Weapon he wields can spread a gentle light around him which encourages and heals his allies. Both hold in them the wish that he safely reaches his destination with his allies, and that all will make it home safely.
DETAIL_PUBRASEERRISINGMOON2410_H02: Designated as a leader, the easygoing Pubraseer found himself filled with the hope and resolve he once shared with comrades before being separated from them. Their common dream was to have a fruitful journey and return home. This dream never came to fruition, and Pubraseer lost even those who would share in his frustration. Left with little, he seeks a new way to put his life to use. He wields a saber to cut open the future, a space compass given to him by his comrades, and wears a suit that keeps him on edge. With all of this left to him, he guides his new friends, pushing them forth to the future.
DETAIL_PUBRASEER_H01:
【一部データの破損があります】
■■■■り■し、ヒーローとしての力に目覚めたパブラシア。その■■レルウェポンは、■■たちと■に■■から■■■という決■の表れであり、その手には■■の■に立■■■■旗を掲げている。その旗型のパラ■■ウェ■ンは通常閉じて槍として使用■るが、仲間を■護する際や安全地■■と導く時には大きくたなびく。また、パブラシアの■ーロ■■■■は、■■■■以前に■■していた■■■の■■■あった■のデ■■■と■■■■いる。
(サマーダイブ・アミューズメント！7話クリア時に破損箇所は修復されます)
DETAIL_PUBRASEER_H02:
【一部データの破損があります】
パブラシア本来の性■は■■く■気なもの■■■■が、■■■の■■■■■しての自■や■■、■レ■■■ーが■■れ、自己■■に■■責■感■■い■■■■■■が生まれた。記憶のフ■■シュ■■■■より、過去■■■を■■■し■パブラシアは、今は■■■■たちを■う。■■■■■■■に■って■■■れた自身の――【この先は破損が致命的であり表示できません】
(サマーダイブ・アミューズメント！7話クリア時に破損箇所は修復されます)
DETAIL_PUBRASEER_H03: Upon regaining his memories, Pubraseer awakens to his powers as a hero. His Parallel Weapon is an expression of his will to continue sailing with his crew and serves as his flag to plant in untrodden lands. Though he generally keeps his flag unfurled so that he may use it as a spear, he unfurls it and lets it fly high when he needs to protect his allies or lead them to safety. His hero suit draws inspiration from his past, as well, with a similar design to the uniform he once wore as a spaceship captain before falling victim to amnesia.
DETAIL_PUBRASEER_H04: Pubraseer's innate personality is to be cheerful; however, upon becoming a spaceship captain, the confidence and duties expected of him have brought on so much pressure that his personality has shifted toward one of diligence and a strong sense of responsibility bordering on self-sacrifice. His former memories have gradually returned with repeated flashbacks, but his heart now aches for the crew members who passed away. Reminiscing on the five comrades who saved him, he realizes the sheer value that his life has and that it is not his alone to live. He grips his flag and holds it high as he gazes out at the stars shining on the future, vowing to live onward for all of them.
DETAIL_PUBRASEER_S01: Pubraseer is a cheerful, easygoing Canis Therian Cosman who works on the crew of a cruise ship that sails through space, where he mainly cleans and runs errands. He had drifted onto a beach shore near the ship when it was under construction and was taken in by the crew. Most of his memories had been lost, and he could hardly talk, but his intense curiosity allowed him to absorb volumes of vocabulary and other knowledge with ease. Pubraseer occasionally hears incomprehensible speech coming from the pendant he has been wearing even since before his rescue. Moreover, this is always what causes him to have horrible headaches.
DETAIL_RAIZI_S01:
A Hero Operator affiliated with the Independent Heroes. Impeccably sharp wits and cunningness earn him a daily fortune as a gambler. Raizi is a "perceptive" Observer who utilizes multiple senses in tandem which he claims connect himself to pathways to parallel universes and draw those alternate realities toward him. Although he typically keeps his focus and cool, he trembles in fear around ghosts, spirits, and other supernatural anomalies. The reason for this reaction must be tied to a traumatic childhood experience.

Raizi was blessed with superb powers as an Observer at birth, which ensured that he would have a terrible time growing up. His tendency to play the "tough guy" was an adaptation to growing up in a rough environment—a persona necessary to survive and thrive. Conversely, thanks to an older man looking after him and helping him hone his gambling talents, he gained a degree of respect for the older generations. Sometimes, Raizi will space out, but he claims this is because he is observing parallel universes. Yet, no one can ever be sure what he says is true since he never cares to elaborate on what he has observed.
DETAIL_RAKTATHERMAE2307_H01: A doctor dispatched to the Capital of Water, famous for being a popular summer destination to beat the heat, he is amazed by how the city's medicinal baths soothe the mind and how its beautiful scenery also aids in soothing the soul. He is blown away by how healthy its citizenry is. He has vowed to care for both the physical and mental well-being of all his patients. This resolve has given him his new outfit, along with a water jug Parallel Weapon filled with the very water that nourishes the beautiful sights of the city. All who come in contact with this water are rejuvenated, as if they were gazing upon a cascade of flowers blooming on the water's crystal-clear surface.
DETAIL_RAKTATHERMAE2307_H02: When he was a medical intern, Rakta had a Hito patient who simply could not get out of bed no matter how physically healthy he had become. The man had lost his hometown and had not once smiled ever since. Rakta's inability to help the man tore him apart; he desired to heal both the body and the soul of his patients, and to stay by their side until the day they chose to stand up on their own. Wielding a water jug Parallel Weapon, filled with the very water that nourishes the city's beautiful greenery, which is every bit as magnificent as what could have been found in the hometown that one Hito patient of his had yearned for so much, Rakta makes no secret of his new resolution as a doctor.
DETAIL_RAKTA_H01: When duty calls, Rakta transforms into "Doctor R," the lab coat-clad hero. Wielding scalpels and forceps as Parallel Weapons, he uses them to fight foes and save lives in equal measure. Drawing from his core principle of saving every life that he can, the medical tools in his hands are designed to be incapable of killing anyone, foes included. This means his hero powers truly shine through when it is time to rescue those in danger.
DETAIL_RAKTA_H02: Rakta's scalpel Parallel Weapon cuts through physical matter, tunneling into his target's innards. The cuts deal no actual damage and are easily sewn back together. As a doctor, he has taken the oath to first do no harm, and he swears to uphold that oath even when transformed since it gives meaning to his existence. Even in the thick of battle, his oath acts like a binding contract that restrains him.
DETAIL_RAKTA_S01: An Asian-Lunarian surgeon, Rakta Salya is a resident of a general hospital in the Lunar Cities. Intensely driven and by the books as a doctor, his skills have gained him great professional acclaim, but his stiff approach to everything often leaves his passions underutilized. Early on in his career, a senior doctor told him that few things were more important to a surgeon than stamina. Ever since then, he has delved into health and fitness, trying all sorts of wellness methods and going to the gym five times a week. He is one of those fitness geeks who never shies away from pouring effort into all the wrong places.
DETAIL_RASTABAN_H01: Vowing to become a truly "big" man capable of protecting and guiding the family of settlers still caught in the unending turmoil, he transforms into a hero with the rugged, powerfully built appearance of a seasoned warrior. His attire, reminiscent of a medieval Norse fighter, is modeled after the "heroes of the early frontier," figures so legendary that even his battle-hardened father once admired them.
