His primary weapon is a massive circular shield. Though he carries a dagger as a secondary arm, his wish is focused on safeguarding his comrades, giving the shield far greater performance. With exceptional durability, it can protect both himself and his allies from a wide variety of attacks. In addition, the bladed outer rim can be set spinning, allowing the shield to be hurled and wielded like a chakram or boomerang, turning defense itself into a formidable means of offense.
DETAIL_RASTABAN_H02: At the core of the way he stands on the battlefield—hiding his timid, self-effacing nature while trembling beneath a show of bravado—lies a deep-seated complex toward his late father. That father was one of the great heroes who brought a vast war to an end, a charismatic leader whose presence inspired both admiration and awe. To him, the man was an object of reverence, but also a crushing weight of expectation. Because leadership is not inherited by blood, the next commander might well be someone else. Even so, having been personally trained by such a legendary figure, it was inevitable that eyes would turn toward him. Accepting this, he devoted himself to the study of tactics and to relentless training, forging himself into a warrior fit to lead the next generation, even as he mockingly referred to himself as a "war virgin." He etched tattoos into his body that call his father’s image to mind, a constant reminder of the man he strives to become. And so, even today, he puts on airs and stands tall on the battlefield, determined to grow into a truly "big" man.
DETAIL_RASTABAN_S01: A young man who serves as a miner, mining overseer, and the leader of a settler expedition at a rare-metal mine on the frontier planet Muirauka VI. In the chaotic aftermath of the Great War, he is said to be a towering, fearless hero who commands a band of hardened ruffians and continuously adds new feats of valor to his legend. The reality, however, is somewhat different. While he is undeniably quick-witted and excels at devising strategies and commanding his forces, he becomes noticeably faint-hearted whenever he is forced to stand on the front lines himself. A minor threat is enough to make him shout at the top of his lungs, and a small kindness can leave him hopelessly smitten, revealing a surprisingly innocent side that stands in stark contrast to his reputation. He has a fondness for using the phrase "big" to describe things—especially the man he wishes to become.
DETAIL_REXERVOLCANO2402_H01: The new form reXer obtained while filming a show at a volcano, with new Parallel Weapons to match. Small fireball units float around him, manipulating heat and magma energy, and he also has a mighty crossbow that shoots flaming bolts powerful enough to pierce any foe. The suit covers very little skin, giving the impression of a hunter gone fully to the wild side, and it is made to keep its wearer comfortable under extremely high temperatures. Even when surrounded by molten lava in the bowels of a volcano, reXer will reward his stream viewers with his signature "cool" smile.
DETAIL_REXERVOLCANO2402_H02: "This is the hardest stage I've ever cleared. I don't think anyone else can pull it off... Well, anyone but you, Alex." As he stands before the volcano, the first thought that comes to mind is how eager he was to be the first to clear the volcano stage his father had made. Even now, donning the mantle of the hero reXer, he holds onto the memory he knows to be true. His love for his father has not faded, either.
DETAIL_REXERVOLCANO2402_H03:
"This is the hardest stage I've ever cleared. I don't think anyone else can pull it off... Well, anyone but you, Alex." As he stands before the volcano, the first thought that comes to mind is how eager he was to be the first to clear the volcano stage his father had made. Even now, donning the mantle of the hero reXer, he holds onto the memory he knows to be true. His love for his father has not faded, either.

He could never have dreamed of surpassing his father had that father never existed. Even now, when he is ready to fight as a hero himself without the reXer mantle, his feelings toward his father have not changed. Although he wears a suit identical to the one his father let him peek at, as a reward for clearing the impossible volcano stage, he wields a crossbow Parallel Weapon which is much different. reXer... or rather, Alex, puts into words the feelings he has carried proudly for so long: "Thank you, Father, and goodbye."
DETAIL_REXER_H01: When he transforms into his hero form, complete with a colorfully glowing visor and armor, he wields an enormous Parallel Weapon that can shift into a greatsword or battle-axe. He is able to adapt to his opponent's capabilities and the conditions of battle, fighting like an agile hunter taking down a massive monster in a video game. However, a recent change in his combat style has led to confusion and concern among some of his fans.
DETAIL_REXER_H02:
【このファイルへのアクセス権限がありません】
（バーチャルフェスタ・ロワイアルの最終話公開時にアクセス権限を取得できます）
DETAIL_REXER_H03: The reXer of today is not the same person as the reXer that once was. The hero known by his adoring fans has since been replaced by his son. A father in the real world who was wiped out of existence in a battle with Kaibutsu, his son inherited his avatar and continued his legacy under the same name. reXer displays great prowess in e-sports, and as fortune would have it, he is able to keep his father's career going as a professional gamer. However, his abilities as a hero leave far more to be desired. Unperturbed by this, the younger reXer has but one wish: to see the hero his father had built up return to the world stage.
DETAIL_REXER_S01: A professional gamer of indeterminate age belonging to Neo-Talents Productions' e-sports team "μ-Hyperions." In virtual reality, he works as both a pro gamer and a digital hero. He has what it takes to maintain the highest rank in any game in any genre he plays. While he has the outward appearance of a mature, muscular man with a calm manner of speaking to match, his true character is quite a bit more childish. He was briefly a hero in the real world as well, but rumor has it that he has completely vanished.
DETAIL_ROIKER_H01: As a hero, Roiker wields two Parallel Weapons: an astrolabe and a telescope-shaped gun. The gun is loaded with all the data on universes that he has observed and analyzed, allowing him to recreate and launch energized chunks of limited portions of stellar or cosmic environments. The astrolabe's functionality is similar to that of the Ether Searcher, allowing him to search for heroes, villains, or even Kaibutsu in magnifications that range from all of space itself to the most finite resolution on a specific area.
DETAIL_ROIKER_H02: Roiker's wish is to satisfy his infinite desire for knowledge pertaining to the multiverse. As an orphan who grew up watching the stars nightly, he would often contemplate why he was all alone as he watched them twinkle. When his fondness for space led him to read more, he learned about parallel universes from one of the many books he had picked up. This awakened his desire to meet and speak with himself from one of those parallel universes. It was only a matter of time before he started researching the multiverse in an effort to quench his thirst for knowledge.
DETAIL_ROIKER_S01: Roiker is a Therian Cosman professor who belongs to the astrophysics lab of Japan's most prestigious university. A young genius who studies parallel universes, their interactions with each other, and the capabilities and traits of Observers, his mentor happens to be the inventor of the Ether Searcher. A classic scholar by temperament, his speech is rigid, and he rarely smiles. He is surprisingly competent at housework, however, with a talent for both cooking and cleaning. Roiker has scaled back his hero activities for certain reasons, making him relatively unknown.
DETAIL_ROUDINSTELLA2510_H01: The Galaxy Carnival Expo, a festival of festivals. Roudin is there, acting as an advertising Hero for the Japan Pavilion. He doesn't know too much about this place called Japan, but he worked with Sui and Barrel to put together a suit that would look good in the festival and set the mood. The costume he dons is reminiscent of the mounted archers of old, and he has a bow Parallel Weapon to match. The arrows fired from it become fireworks when launched, and are made not only to defeat threats, but to encourage those staring down in gloom to look up and smile. With that dream of providing relief tucked away in his heart, Roudin decorates the battlefield and the night sky alike.
DETAIL_ROUDINSTELLA2510_H02: Roudin is always showing those around him a good time with his charming banter and magic tricks, wearing a laid-back smile all the while. One wouldn't think it from a first impression, but he's had his share of setbacks. Many of them, in fact. When his popularity as a magician had dwindled, he suffered the cruel words of those he mistakenly thought would cheer him on. Unable to take it anymore, he ran off and moved to the city of Tesfinite, where he lived for no purpose and with no hope. Even then, all it took was a moment to change his life. He was looking down when he heard fireworks above and noticed their light reflecting on the ground. Glancing up, he admired the colorful explosions as if they were an outstretched hand ready to pull him out of his slump. That is why he endeavors to share his message on stage and in his daily life: you can hang your head in gloom now, because eventually the moment will come when you look up again.
DETAIL_ROUDIN_H01: Transformed into a hero, Roudin wears a flashy stage outfit. Having been a hero as a child, he still holds onto some pieces of the old days. The cloak he used to wear then he now wears as a sash, and his old mascot partner now pops out of his top hat. His magic rod and silk hat serve as his Parallel Weapons, unleashing a variety of magic tricks, both deadly and flashy, that turn battles into entertainment which bystanders are compelled to watch.
DETAIL_ROUDIN_H02: In days past, Roudin had an impressive career as both a genius stage magician and a hero. The older he got, however, the more his popularity faltered. As his dream began to crumble into uncertainty, he lost the ability to transform. He cast his past away and resigned himself to drifting, only to drift into a city of show business and find himself picked up by the owner of an old hotel and employed as a hotelier. Though Roudin does not let on how he feels about his new home and friends, they seem to have had a large influence on his decision to return to the magic he had once abandoned.
DETAIL_ROUDIN_S01: A hotelier who works at a well-established hotel on Muirauqa III. With his sloppy hospitality and insolent tone, one can hardly call him talented hotel staff—however, his natural magnetism and conversational skills that are light-hearted without being over-familiar or insulting make him surprisingly popular with the guests. With a successful career as a popular childhood magician in his portfolio, he relies on those old tricks even today, using his magic to calm crying children and arguing couples.
DETAIL_RUTILIX_H01: Having grown up watching his noble knight of a father, Rutilix takes after that stoic, fatherly image in his hero form—sporting an imposing mane, flowing cape, and heavy armor. Wielding a rapier whose blade is made of light, he lets the fruits of his training speak for themselves as he darts across the battlefield, with his heavy armor not impeding him in the slightest. Though his swordsmanship has hardly improved upon transforming, his passionate thrusts do, on occasion, evoke a miracle.
DETAIL_RUTILIX_H02: Given how his kingdom is bound by an age-old tradition in which only the firstborn may be heir to their family fortune, his society would never lend a hand to Rutilix on account of his lastborn status, no matter how laudable his accomplishments may be. With no connections and no one volunteering to be his sword instructor, he must invariably spur himself on to new heights in solitude. Though his efforts are well-nigh hopeless, his dream of becoming a noble knight who protects the crown and the people of his kingdom, which he has deeply held since childhood, compels him to never give up.
DETAIL_RUTILIX_S01: A young squire belonging to the small, off-world kingdom of Aracidia, to which he pledges his allegiance, Rutilix's zeal and rigorousness are laudable to a fault, but his quick temper and painful lack of swordsmanship leave much to be desired. As the youngest son of an underprivileged household, he is often looked down on in his calvary unit, and he finds himself in the unenviable position of lacking any real achievements of his own. Still, his unyielding will and unrelenting training to become a knight have won him King Alphecca's endearment. Coincidentally, he is constantly squabbling with Akashi on account of their similar temperaments.
DETAIL_RYEKIEXMAS2012_H01: Though Ryekie was supposed to be on hiatus due to getting injured on the job, a certain chain of events, along with his own personal feelings on the matter, has brought him back as a hero, albeit in a new yet temporary form. This form makes him incredibly sensitive to plant-based compounds which induce a state of ecstasy, rendering him drunk, essentially. This drunken-like state is what likely triggered his bottled-up emotions to explode, which in turn accelerated his heartfelt desires to then grant him this new form. Even his injured areas are properly reinforced for that extra protection.
DETAIL_RYEKIEXMAS2012_H02: Donning a flashy dancer's kimono, Ryekie fights with a folding fan adorned with lightning. This hero form, temporary though it may be, was born from his heartfelt desire to wrap up the fighting as quickly as possible so that he could host a banquet to thank his junior heroes for all their hard work. The guilt of putting so much pressure on his junior heroes to compensate for his hiatus, along with being frustrated by his inability to do what he does, culminated in his new form exploding onto the scene once the bottle worked its magic. Once he sobers up, he will surely fall into a state of self-deprecation for allowing himself to be so forthright with his desires.
DETAIL_RYEKIE_H01: When it is time to electrocute evildoers, Ryekie transforms into "Bolt of Justice," an S-rank hero donning a white cape. In combat, he fights by creating lightning from the built-up electricity in his body, wrapping bolts around his legs and fists to imbue each blow with a mighty zap. He can even adjust the force of his blows, ranging from the humble shock of a stun gun to the electrifying blast of raw lightning from the heavens.
DETAIL_RYEKIE_H02: Ryekie hopes to continue being a superhero who acts as the embodiment of justice. He has confided this to his former hero partner, and he has also made this vow to his comrades who have fallen in battle. Today, Bolt of Justice is an imposing superhero who will smile no matter how much the odds are against him, having persevered through days of gut-wrenching tribulations and tear-filled combat.
DETAIL_RYEKIE_S01: Ryekie is not just a hero, but the most accomplished superhero on Earth, as well as Parallel Flight's mightiest salesman. A Cosman born off-world, his fur constantly builds up static electricity, demanding that all his clothes be made of insulating materials. Ryekie is brimming with confidence and pride about being a hero, and he always wears a half-mask fashioned after headgear so that he may transform at any time. His voice is also very, very boisterous.
DETAIL_RYUSEI_H01: In hero form, Ryusei wears a suit, fit with boardshorts, with a top that shows off his musculature, and his greatest weapon is most certainly his own muscular beauty. The ring Parallel Weapons attached all over his suit resonate with accolades thrown his way for his physical beauty during his live streams and amplify his power. When he unleashes all that stored power of approval, his physique becomes ever more robust, making him drop-dead gorgeous.
DETAIL_RYUSEI_H02: Ryusei had always hated himself for being weak and introverted, but he was unable to take the first steps toward changing his image. That all changed the day he found himself caught up in a Kaibutsu attack. After putting their life on the line to save him, a hero with ripped muscles left him with the inspiring words, "Don't give up. Build yourself up, one step at a time. Your training will never betray you, and you will become your greatest hero." Deeply moved by this motivational message, Ryusei immediately began training from scratch and has never stopped since. He hopes that one day he can be someone else's inspiration to start working on themselves.
DETAIL_RYUSEI_S01: Ryusei is a former aesthetic bodybuilding tournament winner who joined Neo-Talents Productions after becoming a fitness model. As a model, his goal is to popularize body sculpting by having people adopt healthy habits into their lifestyles. He is a well-loved model, and his self-affirming smile, filled with confidence and positivity, perfectly complements his sculpted body which adds to his popularity. Ryusei has a hobby of collecting swimwear, gym attire, and board shorts, and he even has a whole room packed just for shorts.
DETAIL_SADAYOSHISURVIVAL2309_H01: Living off the land on a deserted island has allowed Sadayoshi to unleash his true feelings and break out of his normal, defense-focused attire. His new suit brings to mind a beach volleyball player. He uses a sun visor Parallel Weapon to lock onto targets to guarantee that he lands all his hits with his volleyball Parallel Weapon which launches dense, energized projectiles. Lighter without his hefty glove Parallel Weapons and free from all that once bound him, Sadayoshi can now jump to ever greater heights.
DETAIL_SADAYOSHISURVIVAL2309_H02: Sadayoshi had always repressed his inner desires. Yet, after spending time with villains who follow their own path in pursuit of their own ideals, he came into contact with true freedom. Though his resolute belief in letting no evil go unpunished has not changed, he has started to believe that understanding the other person is the first step toward changing himself. As he changes, he realizes that he must choose a path for himself rather than simply walking down one decided for him. Emotions surge through him as he dances across the sandy beach, his eyes squarely on the ball, paying no attention to the sweat or heat. The smile on his face is bolstered by a lifetime of experience and confidence, now shining brighter than ever.
DETAIL_SADAYOSHI_H01: When in his hero form, Sadayoshi dons the outfit of a military officer with formidable gauntlets and greaves as his Parallel Weapons. His intense training has left him with far greater close-quarters combat capabilities than other soldiers, and his Parallel Weapons allow him to unleash strikes and kicks a hundred to a thousand times stronger than normal. His power is so great that he must apply proper restraint depending on the environment where he unleashes his attacks. Should he strike with full power, fissures and earthquakes would surely follow.
DETAIL_SADAYOSHI_H02: Sadoyoshi has been taught that he must cast aside his own ego to become a perfect protector of the Japanese people, and his desire to defend them at all costs has led to him becoming a hero. People will mock him—calling him a puppet of the state or a dog of the military—and some of their barbs even make it through his armor. What he does not realize is how his true desires and emotions he has locked away, unwilling to show to others, are what will enable his powers as a hero to become far greater than he can even imagine once he decides to unleash them.
DETAIL_SADAYOSHI_S01: Serving as a colonel in the Japanese Defense Bureau, Sadayoshi leads the army's First Hero Battalion. His full name is Sadayoshi Ikusabata, and though he has the appearance of a Cosman, he is a naturalized Japanese citizen adopted by the prestigious Ikusabata family. Strictly trained as a soldier to serve the public, he treats everyone with the utmost etiquette while possessing considerable combat capabilities. He sees every mission through to completion with loyalty and efficiency. However, because he has lived his life entirely on the tracks laid out for him, he has difficulty getting along with those who have strayed, whether by choice or by circumstance.
DETAIL_SANTETSUWONDERLAND2602_H01: 貴重な岩石カカオを巡る大会「コズミック・カカオ・チャンピオンシップ」に参加することになったサンテツは、パラレル・キューを用いて、童話の登場人物のような衣装を身に纏う。そして握るのは、幼い頃の憧憬が大剣として顕現したパラレルウェポン。重く鋭い斬撃は、立ちはだかる敵をあっけなく両断する破壊力を持つ。これまでのサンテツらしからぬ戦闘スタイルで叶えんとする願いは、昔の自分にできなかったことを成し遂げること。そんな心境の変化には、とある人物との出会いが関わっているらしい。
DETAIL_SANTETSUWONDERLAND2602_H02: 生まれてこの方、様々なジャンルの本を読み漁ってきたサンテツだが、幼少期にはファンタジー小説に傾倒していた。その根底にあったのは、両親が自分を見てくれない現実から逃げ出したいという切実な想い。異世界に飛び込んで大冒険を繰り広げる主人公たちのように、自分もどこか遠くへ行きたい――しかし当然ながら、そんな願いは叶わなかった。それから月日が経ち、幼い幻想から醒めなければならないほど成長したサンテツは、やがて家を飛び出した。自分の本当の居場所が、どこかにあると信じて。
DETAIL_SANTETSU_H01: Santetsu's abnormal fascination with and knowledge of books are heavily reflected in his hero abilities. By creating an "index" with parameters he determines, he is able to control time and space by swapping around the actions of both his opponents and allies. He is also able to manifest books he has read, quoting passages to conjure up the scenes described before his eyes. The ability requires him to remain still and shut out the world around him to focus, which proves to be his weakness.
DETAIL_SANTETSU_H02: Much of Santetsu's childhood was spent home alone, where books were his life and his salvation. It was only natural that he would wish to read all the books in the world. This has led him to become a hero who fights to protect books and valuable texts from those who do not understand their worth. With his habit of etching every book he reads into his memory, his knowledge will undoubtedly surpass that of all others in due time.
DETAIL_SANTETSU_S01: A Terran born in Okayama, Japan, Santetsu Tokuhara works as a librarian in a public library. Generally uninterested in anything outside of collecting and reading books, his messy hair and rough beard tell the tale of his laziness—"what a pain" being his favorite phrase. Yet, he possesses an impressive ability to remember most of whatever he reads in great detail, and since he has read a variety of lost books and historical texts, he is prized by many organizations for all that knowledge. To add to his lazy bona fides, however, he sticks hard to the principle of doing exactly what is asked of him and no more while expending the least amount of effort.
DETAIL_SAOTOME_H01: As a Hero, Saotome wears a suit representing his conception of what a tourism ambassador would look like. His Parallel Weapons are, of course, a long flag that easily dwarfs his height, and a sturdy tower shield. This kit sees him protecting his allies with the shield while waving the flag to encourage and invigorate them—a reflection of his dear wish to protect Enoshima and guide it to a brighter future. He can release a blade affixed to the tip of the flag to use it as a spear, but because his wish is defensive in nature, its attack power is nothing to write home about.
DETAIL_SAOTOME_H02: Saotome had seen his local hero, Enoshiman, fight up close. Back then, he'd viewed Heroes as performers, taking down Kaibutsu with flair and style while never forgetting to smile and encourage others. After witnessing the Heroes getting wounded in the Kaibutsu attack on Enoshima Village, however, his views changed drastically. Seeing them risk their lives to protect the needy and powerless, he wished hard to protect them in turn, and to ensure a brighter future for Enoshima and children everywhere. This powerful wish was picked up, and it opened a Path to a parallel world.
DETAIL_SAOTOME_S01: Saotome is a civil servant working at Enoshima Village's town hall and has long been a pillar of support for the region. Though liable to play loose with the details, his pleasant attitude and friendly demeanor have won him popularity with the islanders, who affectionately refer to him as "Town Hall Saotome." He's lived alone with his Hero superfan of a son ever since his wife passed away, and while he has a handle on most of the housework, that aforementioned sloppiness with finishing touches often gets him yelled at. Still, he loves Enoshima from the bottom of his heart, and he's so fond of the island's mascot character Li'l Shimeow that merch of the little guy is attached to many of his possessions he carries with him daily.
DETAIL_SEIICHIRO_S01:
Seiichiro is an Observer who works as both Vice-Minister of the Japanese Ministry of Defense and as the Chief Operator of the UEHA Japan Chapter. Hailing from Sakai, Japan, Seiichiro Tenma has everything going for him, including a brilliant mind, stunning good looks, incredible reflexes and coordination, and a blessed upbringing. He also has the confidence to match it all. His domineering personality and stubbornness in the face of mistakes and corruption, however, have not won him much popularity in the ministry. Still, his ability to listen to others and lead a team is second to none, and Okitaka is very fond of him for that.

Overwhelming confidence and considerable pride have protected Seiichiro from the probing eyes around him ever since he awakened as an Observer at a young age. He would boldly shoot down unreasonable demands, and he would overcome discrimination with charm and skill. The somewhat narcissistic impression he gives off reflects the life he has lived resisting oppression and external pressures. His ardent rebelliousness is also aimed at the Broker, whom he works against secretly through an underground organization to achieve his revenge.
DETAIL_SENSETTIA_H01: Transformed, Sensettia wields a microphone and a bladed keyboard as her Parallel Weapons. While she can swing her keyboard like a sword or axe, she can also play it while she sings, turning her very voice into a weapon. Her singing may bring joy to all who hear it, but when channeled through her Parallel Weapon, it turns her voice into a force to be reckoned with, along with her indomitable personality. Spreading out like waves all around, her performances grant her allies power and pierce through her enemies as sonic blades in equal measure.
DETAIL_SENSETTIA_H02: Wing size was almighty where Sensettia grew up. Everything from social status to singing talent was thought to be the domain of those blessed with large wings. Sensettia, with her tiny wings, grew up under the boots of neglect and oppression. She was given no accommodations, no help, and no expectations. Yet, she had a dream to become a singer-songwriter who would be known and beloved by all throughout the cosmos, and with nothing but hope in her heart and the resolve to put in the work, she took to the stars to pursue her prize, fighting anxiety and insecurity along the way.
DETAIL_SENSETTIA_S01: A winged Cosman girl who seeks to make it as a singer-songwriter, Sensettia tends to push people away. Yet, she is deeply passionate about her craft and pursues her dream with single-minded determination. Her singing and performing talents are vast enough for her to make a modest living traveling the stars, playing on the streets for anyone who will listen. She is insecure over her small wings and often appears to be self-conscious and even embarrassed over them.
DETAIL_SENTHAK_H01: Sensaku transformed with the wish to give shape to the shapeless dreams of others, taking on the garb of the Japanese craftsmen of ancient Earth. The cube Parallel Weapon he wields multiplies with his creative imagination, creating holograms in the shapes he dreams up. These holograms can momentarily take on the mass and weight of what they are based on, facilitating Sensaku's preferred combat style of controlling his opponents' movements with his materializing illusions before pummeling them with his imposing musculature.
DETAIL_SENTHAK_H02: Sensaku was born and raised in a mercenary group on a far-off planet where only strength was prized. Warm and loving by nature, he found himself unable to sink into their values or truly find a place to call his own... until he happened to catch sight of an idol concert on Earth. The only emotions there were the love and admiration of stans towards their idol, and no one was greater or lesser than anyone else. Over the years, he realized that some are looking to become stans, and others want to be the kind of person they themselves are stans of. Either way, Sensaku wishes for as many people as possible to feel even a fraction of the admiration he felt during that concert, and thus he holes himself up in the corner of his storeroom again, dedicating himself to his creative work.
DETAIL_SENTHAK_S01: Sensaku is a bulky Cosman whose rough way of speaking masks a warm, laid-back personality. He stowed away on an immigrant ship that departed Earth long ago. A mercenary before a stowaway, he made use of the optical camouflage he used back in his war days along with his hologram avatar to form a pleasant relationship with the ship's denizens while concealing his identity. When not fighting back on Earth, Sensaku was obsessed with idol culture. The corner of one of the ship's storerooms where he lives is buried with merch he brought from Earth with him as well as stuff he made himself.
DETAIL_SHAFTVIRTUALFESTA2210_H01: Shaft asked himself, "How could he exist in a world with no space taxis?" After much thought, he came to the conclusion that he would become capable of picking up and delivering customers with his own two legs. Taking on the appearance of a rickshaw driver, he wields wheel-shaped Parallel Weapons that grant him speed and maneuverability so great that no one can catch up with him on the battlefield. He gets his strength from his utmost faith in his well-trained legs from his years as a rugby player and his heartfelt desire to not leave a single friend behind.
DETAIL_SHAFTVIRTUALFESTA2210_H02: Shaft has always been a team member, a fact he grew more acutely conscious of after starting to work as an independent space taxi driver. Prizing the harmonious bonds of a team overall, he does his utmost to recreate them, even with a makeshift group. Shaft does not simply cling to past glory and memories of better days. By creating a place of belonging within his team and keeping it operating smoothly, he manages to put all the experience he has accumulated to good use.
DETAIL_SHAFT_H01: Shaft's navigational system Parallel Weapon projects a mapped-out path at his feet, puzzling out any danger en route to his destination to track down the safest route possible. Not only can the system be used for enemy scouting and trap detection, but it can even calculate ambush routes and locate spots perfect for eluding enemies—providing sublime assistance for Shaft to direct his allies to launch their attacks.  Of course, if he needs to open up a pathway, he can just as easily tear down walls that may be obstructing his desired path with a mighty tackle.
DETAIL_SHAFT_H02: Invigorated by newly embracing the ideal of bringing people dear to him safely to their destinations, Shaft has broken out of the dull cycle of life in which he had felt confined. His fiery zest for life is ablaze once more. Though his self-confidence has yet to return to what it was back during his glorious prime, he can still accomplish what he puts his mind to. He has realized that it is not a future handed to him but a path that he himself forges that is worth shifting into drive.
DETAIL_SHAFT_S01: Shaft is a former professional rugby player who now works as a space taxi driver. As an athlete, his motto was to carry the ball all the way to the goal without ever hitting the green, and he certainly possessed the bulk and grit to do just that. Every step he took moved him forward, even as the opposing team slammed into him. This earned him the nickname "Iron Man." Despite being so gentle and diligent, he can, at times, be clumsy and low in self-esteem. He has the tendency to be very harsh on himself whenever he blunders.
DETAIL_SHIDEMASU_H01: Taking to the battlefield to protect valuable clients, Shidemasu's suit is built for defense and mobility with the expectation that he will be the one taking the hits. His Parallel Weapon is a long stick with a stamp on its tip named The Appraiser. The writing on the stamp expresses the ideal decision to ensure the client escapes the disaster they face. Shidemasu can unleash its power and effects by stamping nearby floors or walls. Since the stamp's goal is protection, it cannot heal or repair the client, nor can it harm or destroy the root cause of said disaster. However, it can still be used as a humble combat staff to dish out punishing, physical blows.
DETAIL_SHIDEMASU_H02: Shidemasu's dream is to create a world where heroes can live safely. Ever since a hero suffered grievous injuries while protecting him right before his eyes, he has wanted to work in a field where he can protect those who sacrifice themselves to help others. To Shidemasu, insurance is a means for the client or those they leave behind to recover from tragedy. He also believes that his sworn duty is to protect his clients before said insurance takes effect. He buries his emotions and keeps on smiling because he never wants to worry his clients or give them any reason to feel anxious.
DETAIL_SHIDEMASU_S01: Shidemasu Hanemaru works for the prestigious company Jupiter Insurance in their Hero Department. In times past, his job was to enter battlefields and rescue the insured, but he has recently transferred to a department that mainly deals in sales. Shidemasu keeps a smile on at all times and will always converse using the politest tones and language, but hints of violence and bloodlust sometimes leak through into his conduct. This, combined with his imposing stature and prominent scars, leaves him with poor sales numbers. A poverty of emotional expression seems to cause him difficulties with customer service as well.
DETAIL_SHOENVALENTINE2102_H01: When disaster struck, revealing everyone's secrets against their will, Shoen fought his corner. His garb covers every inch of his body, giving him the appearance of a spy while simultaneously expressing his heartfelt belief that there are some things better left unsaid. Clothed in the perfect attire for infiltrating an enemy organization, he wields a large brush disguised as a humble umbrella. When the situation calls for combat behind enemy lines, he will draw his brush and make use of the copious amount of ink stored in his suitcase—fighting to protect secrecy for what it stands for.
DETAIL_SHOENVALENTINE2102_H02: Prizing discretion and poor at conversation, timid Shoen fears the depths of his desires being found out above all other fears. At the heart of this fear is a painful memory of how he once fell in love with the one he had sworn to serve. He found himself traumatized—flustered by feelings a person of his station had no business possessing, suffering from the ignoble, forever separation from said lover, and incapable of expressing his feelings on the matter. Having such wanton desires and letting them get the better of him, not to mention his cowardice... All of it left him feeling nothing but shame. So, he sealed those memories away deep inside his heart where he was certain they would never be revealed again, or so he thought.
DETAIL_SHOEN_H01: Shoen transforms into a hakama-clad hero wielding an enormous calligraphy brush as his Parallel Weapon. Using his tail as an inkpot and energy extracted from his body as ink, he writes living characters in midair. Those symbols behave as their meanings dictate, fading into oblivion as mist once they have fulfilled their purpose. The impact the symbols have on their targets, as well as the effects they impose, differ based on their meanings.
DETAIL_SHOEN_H02: Shoen's deepest desire is to write characters that truly live. Each time the words he writes in the air gain life, fulfill their purpose, and fade away, he feels bitterly disappointed by himself and toward his lack of mastery. He reminisces on the calligraphy he saw once in a Japanese temple and remembers the unending vitality of its inked brushstrokes. Until the day that he can create an object of such beauty with his own hands, his cycle of ambitious ventures and bitter regrets will continue.
DETAIL_SHOEN_S01: Shoen is an educator who operates a small calligraphy classroom in Orient City while working as a university guest lecturer. A Cosman born off-world, he found himself deeply fascinated by the culture of the first Earth nation he encountered, Japan, and has since been spending his life in pursuit of perfecting his calligraphy. A prodigious, scowling man of few words, he often gives off a fearsome impression that obscures the fact he is truly a softy who loves kids. He even has the habit of folding origami as gifts for them whenever he meets one.
DETAIL_STERIOWHITEOUT2512_H01: On a planet blanketed in endless snow, Sterio gave shape to a new wish. The spike-shaped parallel weapons mounted to his legs grant him unwavering footing, anchoring him to the ground and allowing him to advance across any terrain. In the hands of someone with Sterio's immense strength, they can just as easily become weapons capable of shattering any obstacle that bars his path. His second parallel weapon is modeled after a dogsled, designed to carry those dear to him safely to their destination. It responds to its owner's desire to 'keep moving forward,' nullifying resistance from wind, snow, and even harsher elements. However, should Sterio falter or give in to fear, the weapon's power fades in an instant, demanding unwavering resolve to be used to its fullest.
DETAIL_STERIOWHITEOUT2512_H02: Muirauka VI stands in stark contrast to Sterio's current home, a world defined by conditions entirely its opposite. To him, it was a planet filled with nothing but 'firsts': the cold yet refreshing wind, the breathtaking snowscapes, and—above all—a battlefield where people truly fought to take what mattered most to them. Unlike the familiar tension of a hunt, where the roles of hunter and prey are clearly defined, this silver-white world was steeped in a different kind of intensity. Even so, Sterio's curiosity could not be contained. With a wish burning in his chest to run as far as he could, as fast as he could, on his own two feet within the time he had been given, he pulls the dogsled onward. He carries comrades and family to their destinations, and when its seats finally lie empty, the question of who will ride there next is one that only his future self can answer.
DETAIL_STERIO_H01: Sterio's Parallel Weapon is a winding horn that allows him to gather objects of his choice when he blows it. If he uses it on the atmosphere, it summons up winds, even calling forth cumulonimbus clouds and causing storms. Understanding it mostly on an intuitive level, Sterio uses it as a "flute that calls a lot of winds" and does not think too deeply about it. As his family's hunting dog, his job on hunts is to chase prey and support the other hunters. This style does not change when he transforms, and he supports the heroes on the front line with all that he has.
DETAIL_STERIO_H02: As a little pup, Sterio loved playing with the toys that his father gave him. His favorite in particular was a flute made from a beast's horn, and its pitch eventually became the signal for the family to gather together. No matter where he is or what situation he finds himself in, Stereo's brother and parents are always in his heart. Indeed, it was the desire to always live with them, to fulfill his role as a hunting dog, that pushed Sterio to awaken as a hero. No one outside of his loved ones seems to know why he is as stuck on his family as he is, and he makes no effort to volunteer this information.
DETAIL_STERIO_S01: A young Therian Cosman who lives on the developing planet of Muirauqa I. Picked up by a family of Space Hunters who protect the planet's pioneers from dangerous native lifeforms, he lives as a hunter's apprentice. Don't let his enormous size and strength fool you, however—his heart is as big as his frame, and he possesses a gentle soul. When danger comes to his family or hunting grounds, however, he completely shifts and throws himself at the threat with no care for his own life. Sterio treasures the parents who gave him his home and the brother he grew up with more than anything, and he strongly believes he will stay with them for all of his life.
DETAIL_SUBARU_H01: A weaver of tales, Subaru transforms into a hero with a very strange weapon. His beloved fountain pen is a Parallel Weapon that can rewrite the "flow" of whatever scene he finds himself in. It changes the course of events as they are written on manuscript paper floating in midair. As long as the story developments make sense, he can change the future flow of a battle. However, since these developments must be handwritten, his power requires time.
DETAIL_SUBARU_H02: Subaru hopes to compose the most compelling, true-to-life story conceivable. If you were to dig down to the very core of his creative mind, you would find vivid accounts of how Kaibutsu attacked his hometown. The countless dramas of love and friendship woven among those who fled in terror are not stories made possible if one were solely confined to a library. As terrible as it is to say, that horrific incident is what broadened Subaru's heart and expanded his worldview, and so whenever he sits down to write, he relives that day and seeks to recreate those feelings on paper.
DETAIL_SUBARU_S01: The novelist Subaru Nobeyama (his full name and pen name), born in Hamamatsu, Japan, is based in Orient City. His old-school prose and incredible plotting have won him a steady fanbase. Though his works are filled with love, passion, and humanity, the author himself is grumpy, sarcastic, coldly rational, and acts like he is twice his age. He hates needless outings and having others ruin his concentration, so he tends to lock himself up in his room.
DETAIL_SUHAILCHOCOLATEFES2303_H01: Suhail was determined to become the galaxy's greatest pirate when he descended on Tronecion and encountered an inorganic life form. This was how he met his dearest of friends. Upon regaining his memories of the past, the left arm part that his friend left him changed form into a marvelous microphone. His outfit, reminiscent of a Japanese cheer squad's uniform, works in concert with his Parallel Weapon to make his voice audible to the whole galaxy. Suhail's voice resonates with his friend's, shaking the stars and stealing the hearts of all who hear him.
DETAIL_SUHAILCHOCOLATEFES2303_H02: Suffering partial memory loss due to a Kaibutsu attack, Suhail struggles to conjure up his lost memories. What he does remember is the promise he made to his friend on that fateful day: to become the greatest pirate in the galaxy and plunder all of the cosmos' attention, adoration, and opulence—just like he has never forgotten the day he met that friend, or the day he formed his pirate crew, or the day he lost his left arm. That unforgettable promise is what enables him to maintain such a stirring smile. His friend had taught him the valuable lesson that if he cheered loudly and passionately enough for the universe to hear, his voice would resonate back to cheer himself up.
DETAIL_SUHAIL_H01: When it is time to fight, Suhail transforms into the villain "Captain Tronecion," using his prosthetic left arm as his primary weapon. The arm is a graft left behind by his friend who hailed from the homeworld of mechanical life, Tronecion, and it can assume various forms according to Suhail's volition using the anti-Kaibutsu system programmed into it. His personal favorites are the "Magic Hand," which extends itself to strike the target wherever it is, and the "Energy Gun."
DETAIL_SUHAIL_H02: Suhail's left arm serves as a memento of the friend who fell before him when they had walked the pirate path together. It also serves as a manifestation of his vow to become the greatest pirate in the cosmos. No matter how many times he is arrested, he always breaks out of jail. No matter how large the bounty on his head is or how determined law enforcement becomes, he always stands tall and proud before his crew, laughing all the while. He lives larger than life, yet what drives him is the promise he made to his late friend.
DETAIL_SUHAIL_S01: A pirate captain who sails across seven solar systems, recognizable by his prosthetic left arm, Suhail is a benevolent bandit who robs from the haves who possess affluence and power and gives what she robs from them to the have-nots that serve said haves. Though not the brightest star in the galaxy, his winning boldness and loud charisma have won him the loyalty of many, and his crew is hundreds strong. Obsessed with whatever catches his fancy, this hedonistic pirate only deals with targets and heroes he personally finds interesting.
DETAIL_SUI_H01: Sui transforms into a hero wielding Parallel Weapons of needles, thread, and fabric scissors while clad in a dress that mirrors the one their beloved mother designed for them. Their weapons can directly manipulate spaces, allowing them to sew objects from other spaces into theirs, or sever an object's connections with where it has belonged. It is also said that watching them dance in combat, leaving glittering threads in their wake, is a sight to behold.
DETAIL_SUI_H02: Dysmorphic and always standing out from their peers, Sui's one light in life was their mother, who always accepted them. When Sui lost their mother, they lost their attachment to life and wished daily for nothing more than to vanish from this world. What was it, then, that made them desire life once more and hope to leave their mark on the world?
DETAIL_SUI_S01: Sui is an aspiring fashion designer studying under a mentor in Orient City. Half Lunarian and half Terran, born in the Lunar Cities, they grew up with clothing as an integral part of their life, leaving them with a deep knowledge of all things concerning apparel and fashion. They have a dry, almost aloof temperament with a penchant for cutting words. This leaves them in a bit of an awkward position; though communication is paramount in their profession, they have difficulty dealing with others. Moreover, the disconnect they feel between the body they were born in and their mind and sense of self has troubled them from a young age.
DETAIL_TABIT_H01: Tabit wears a tight-fitting bodysuit when he transforms, taking advantage of the mobility its lack of encumbrance provides to slip around to his opponent's backside before transforming part of his body into a giant blade to slash at them. The moment he does attack, he is so agile and silent that it is as if he were teleporting. To protect his comrades, Tabit makes full use of his ability to turn his body into a weapon at will along with his wealth of experience as a soldier.
DETAIL_TABIT_H02: Though it is difficult to tell from his appearance alone, Tabit's entire body is made up of nanomachines. He was created to blend into human society during the interstellar war to blend into human society as a top-level spy, with his nanomachines capable of disassembling his body in part or in whole on a whim. Once the war ended, however, Tabit and his unit vowed to one another never to assault organic life forms except in self-defense. All he desires now is to live out the rest of his days with his comrades in peace.
DETAIL_TABIT_S01: As a former commander of a special forces brigade that fought in an interstellar war of years past, Tabit always puts the comrades who fight alongside him first. This nobility does extend to others, however, as he never forgets to return a favor. He and his unit wander the stars, attempting to return to their home world which the war had torn them away from. As an aside, while Tabit himself does not seem terribly bothered by it, there seems to be a reason as to why his language faculties are suffering from partial malfunction.
DETAIL_TAIKA_H01: As a Hero, Taika's suit expresses his deep desire to fully and utterly serve his master. The suit itself looks very much like a butler's, while incorporating flash and flair that shows his pride in his work. He wields two Parallel Weapons to maximize the potential of his master and his allies: a monocle that accurately captures the target's abilities, special traits, and intentions, and daggers that allow him to carry out the support his target desires. His daggers are versatile, able to deliver strikes as well as enhance the abilities of allies, but since Taika firmly takes a supporting role, his ability to wound and destroy on his own is lacking.
DETAIL_TAIKA_H02: Belonging to the Hero License Association from the start, Taika has had the ins and outs of the butler role beaten into him since childhood. Taking matters further, he honed his abilities to perfection on his own in anticipation of the day he would be sent to his master. While others acknowledged the results as wildly impressive, a distinct lack of interest in creativity or leadership left him feeling dissatisfied. This changed when he encountered his current master. The immense pleasure he felt at the sight of his master's potential increasing each time he offered a helping hand gave Taika a reason to live. He came to feel pride in serving his master, vowing to aid them in carrying out their duty, even if it meant sullying his own hands.
DETAIL_TAIKA_S01: A Therian Cosman who dutifully serves his master while calling himself the "perfect butler." He has a rather haughty streak for a servant, and his frequently rough speech stands out. However, his serving philosophy is to enhance his master's strengths and abilities, and when it comes to his results, no complaints can be levied. While his boundless self esteem leaves him immune to others' attempts at evaluating his worth and character, he flies into a rage at any insults made towards his master. On that note, he desires to put the affairs of any potential master in order and becomes oddly restless when they are not.
DETAIL_THEOREOL_H01: Over the course of his very long life, Theoreol has assimilated a wide variety of objects into his body. Once fully absorbed, an object is stored as information and can be used as an alchemical catalyst. The experimental apparatus Parallel Weapon Theoreol uses optimizes his alchemical processes, allowing him to carry them out with mind-boggling speed and efficiency. He uses the apparatus to instantly generate anything within the scope of his knowledge.
DETAIL_THEOREOL_H02: Theoreol calls himself a failed experiment because of how the alchemist who concocted him purposefully made him "imperfect." For what purpose was he made that way, and why did his creator make such a failure? He knows that his creator tirelessly conducted his research in an effort to attain the Philosopher's Stone, which is every alchemist's ideal and the very symbol of perfection. Perhaps, Theoreol thought, creating it would reveal the truth about him. Hitherto, for years upon years, he has continued his alchemical research alone, and he shall continue to do so.
DETAIL_THEOREOL_S01: Theoreol conceals every inch of his body with clothing, and he wears a uniquely designed mask to hide his face. Most would stop to do a double take if they were to pass by this suspicious-looking alchemist. In actuality, his carnal identity is that of a slime-like homunculus created by an alchemist from a long-dead planet. Thereol has lived for a staggering amount of time, wandering the galaxy ever since the destruction of his planet, as he continues his alchemy research. His lack of interest in any other research has left him with a dearth of social interaction relative to his years of existence. This means that he is somewhat out of touch with common decorum.
DETAIL_TOSHUVIRTUALFESTA2210_H01: Toshu trained to overcome his own weaknesses by fighting mysterious foes in unfamiliar territory, which led to his gaining a new hero form. With a clear and serene mind that can feel the changes in the air through his skin, Toshu swings his blade at just the right moment. This new vision for being a samurai that Toshu now heralds pacifies his proclivity for explosive outbursts—which, in turn, helps lead him and his allies to victory.
DETAIL_TOSHUVIRTUALFESTA2210_H02: The stoic Toshu has overcome many of his weaknesses through scrupulous training, but there is one weakness he cannot overcome despite his best efforts: his fear of water. Unable to swim due to this fear, there are few things he dreads more than aquatic battles. Overcoming a deeply ingrained fear is no easy task, but he cannot move forward by avoiding it. Rather than conquering his water phobia per se, he has instead chosen to train himself on how to remain calm in places where water is present in abundance.
DETAIL_TOSHU_H01: When Toshu first arrived on Earth, he met a man he came to laud as the "samurai with the noblest soul on Earth." That man inspired him to take on the appearance of a samurai of old whenever he transforms into a hero. Wielding swords whose blades are made of pure energy, he has adopted a combat style befitting his hot-blooded personality—slicing into opponents at the slightest opening and giving them no quarter. His focus on offense, however, leaves his defense with much to be desired.
DETAIL_TOSHU_H02: What drives Toshu in his pursuit of kendo perfection is his desire to reach the level of that true samurai he once met. The man called himself Sakimori, and Toshu learned Earth-style swordsmanship under his mentorship. With his mentor having vanished, this way of life has crystallized in his mind as the ultimate ideal lifestyle he must always strive for. Ergo, he must wield his blade on the battlefield till the fateful day he can finally recognize himself as a true samurai.
DETAIL_TOSHU_S01: Toshu is an educator at Hinowa Athletics University and is the supervisor of their kendo club. Raised in an off-world family of knights, he is as stoic a warrior as they come. Though, for all the mental training he puts himself through, he has an awfully quick temper. Touching his beard is a surefire way to get him to yell at you. Because of how stiff he is, he is utterly incapable of expressing his feelings directly. Even to express "I like this" or "I love you," he must resort to more roundabout means of expression.
DETAIL_TRAINEEEARTH_H01: Cosmen heroes garner high praise on Earth, and the most famous among them possess tremendously high innate strength. Terran trainees know all too well that they do not possess such incredible innate physical prowess. However, they firmly believe that there are things that only they as Terrans can protect and opponents that only they can face off against. These strong beliefs fuel their harsh, hard-line training, and that training may even give them the strength to defeat even the mightiest of Cosmen.
DETAIL_TRAINEEEARTH_S01: Terran heroes who have donned the suit to protect Earth, each take tremendous pride in being a hero, and they all insist on keeping their hero helmets on even during off-hours. Because of how enthusiastic they are about their job, they can often be seen training hard at nearby gyms or hero practice centers after work and on weekends. Since Cosmen brought "hero" culture to Earth, many of the trainees view Cosmen with admiration. This adoration for Cosmen is reflected in the designs of their helmets and costumes.
DETAIL_TRAINEEFIRE_H01: Cosmen heroes garner high praise on Earth, and the most famous among them possess tremendously high innate strength. Terran trainees know all too well that they do not possess such incredible innate physical prowess. However, they firmly believe that there are things that only they as Terrans can protect and opponents that only they can face off against. These strong beliefs fuel their harsh, hard-line training, and that training may even give them the strength to defeat even the mightiest of Cosmen.

Since Cosmen brought "hero" culture to Earth, many of the trainees view Cosmen with admiration. This adoration for Cosmen is reflected in the designs of their helmets and costumes.

However, they firmly believe that there are things that only they as Terrans can protect and opponents that only they can face off against. However, they firmly believe that there are things that only they as Terrans can protect and opponents that only they can face off against. However, they firmly believe that there are things that only they as Terrans can protect and opponents that only they can face off against.
