DETAIL_TRAINEEWATER_S01: Terran heroes who have donned the suit to protect Earth, each take tremendous pride in being a hero, and they all insist on keeping their hero helmets on even during off-hours. Because of how enthusiastic they are about their job, they can often be seen training hard at nearby gyms or hero practice centers after work and on weekends. Since Cosmen brought "hero" culture to Earth, many of the trainees view Cosmen with admiration. This adoration for Cosmen is reflected in the designs of their helmets and costumes.
DETAIL_TSUNEAKIROOKIES2408_H01: Tired of getting tossed about by the internal politics in a spot he'd infiltrated, Tsuneaki ran off and found himself in the Hero City Summer Festival. Though he managed to go undercover as a rookie hero to stay out of the public eye, a mysterious device was pushed onto him. Before he knew it, he was pushed onto the public stage. Realizing that he was going to be exposed and punished before long, his deep wish to have a summer in peace granted the stealthy hero a new form. While it may look like nothing more than a summer vacation outfit, it comes with a Parallel Weapon as powerful as any other.
DETAIL_TSUNEAKIROOKIES2408_H02: "Rokusei" isn't just a temporary name meant to get him by incognito; it's the hero name he came up with when he first awakened. He'd wanted to introduce himself to the masses one day with a name to go with his inherited surname. This, however, did not come to pass, and the days went by. Now, his moment has arrived. Cloaked in a long-held yearning for the ordinary, a self-professed rookie hero is born. Using his onmyoji mysticism to transform his watery Parallel Weapon into a variety of toys, he makes the summery beach his own.
DETAIL_TSUNEAKI_H01: Tsuneaki longed to become like the onmyoji of old Japan so much that, upon obtaining his hero form, he gained their powers along with their garb. His Parallel Weapons are paper tags known as "shikifuda," which he can transform at will into a variety of animated spirits called "shikigami." Though this ability is powerful, it demands a staggering amount of stamina, requiring him to supplement View Power with energy that he obtains from ether flows known as "dragon veins"—as is taught by the onmyodo. However, dragon veins may only be accessible under certain conditions and in certain places, so his strength as a hero is environment-dependent.
DETAIL_TSUNEAKI_H02: Absolutely no information about him is available. This includes information about whether he is even a hero or not. According to the scant eyewitness accounts available, he would appear out of nowhere, solve conflicts in the blink of an eye or run to another hero's aid, then vanish. For reasons unknown, none of the hero streams he has appeared on have been archived, no one has seen him untransformed or in his private life, and even the best journalists find it nigh-impossible to uncover who he truly is.
DETAIL_TSUNEAKI_H02_CLEAR_QUEST:
Absolutely no information about him is available. This includes information about whether he is even a hero or not. According to the scant eyewitness accounts available, he would appear out of nowhere, solve conflicts in the blink of an eye or run to another hero's aid, then vanish. For reasons unknown, none of the hero streams he has appeared on have been archived, no one has seen him untransformed or in his private life, and even the best journalists find it nigh-impossible to uncover who he truly is.

Tsuneaki is an onmyoji hero belonging to the Japanese Defense Bureau, who primarily handles jobs that a public-facing institution such as itself cannot pursue under the light of day"—namely, the undercover investigations of other organizations. This is the reason for his secrecy. Only a few high-level officers in the bureau are even privy to his job details, and when it comes to the general public, only the most obsessed hero fans would know that he even is a hero. He was trained by a Terran who was willing to teach a Cosman the knowledge, traditions, and techniques of the onmyoji. Succeeding his old mentor's position and dreaming of a day when all may be equal regardless of race or social position, he volunteers himself as a pawn of the government—living in the shadows until his dream becomes a reality.
DETAIL_TSUNEAKI_S01: Tsuneaki was born and raised in the town of Shinraku, which was established by Cosmen who had moved into Kyoto. Calling himself a "local actor," he loves socializing with others, making him fairly well known back home. On the other hand, few know about his private life, and he is loath to speak about it. A past incident had taught him to habitually avoid speaking his mind truthfully, making him poor at communicating his feelings even when the situation demands it. He enjoys Kyoto's locale and culture, and for that, he has mixed feelings about his heritage.
DETAIL_TURBAK_H01: When Turbak transforms, he dons a suit decorated with imitation animal bones and feathers reminiscent of the ritual clothes of his homeland. The thread that issues from the tip of his staff is Turbak's Parallel Weapon. It emits a dim light as it dances across the battlefield, stealing the attention of all who look at it. This visual distraction is not where the thread's true value lies, however. It has the ability to connect. Much like Turbak's dream of bringing hearts together and leaving memories within them, the thread pairs entities together. For example, he can connect a collapsing building with a standing one to slow the damage, or he can connect himself with another individual to share the burden of a painful experience or memory.
DETAIL_TURBAK_H02: Born to a shaman family on an obscure planet, Turbak had endured brutal training since childhood in preparation for his role of connecting people with the planet and preserving memories. There had not been a doubt in his mind that he would someday take his father's place as shaman, until one day, his village changed entirely. Valuable minerals had been discovered in the land, and the village abruptly stopped living in tune with nature and turned into a great city in a mere ten years. On the day it was announced that the shaman's festival would end with his father's generation, Turbak left his homeland to walk his own path. As he took to the stars, he thought of his life and his culture. He concluded that as long as he remembered it, and it remained in the thoughts of others, the festival of his home would never die, and the meaning of his life until then would not fade.
DETAIL_TURBAK_S01: Turbak works as a tour guide for Mercury Tours, a large, independent travel agency. Always wearing a smile and friendly to everyone, one would be hard-pressed to find a better example of a kindly youth. He performs excellently on the job as well, never failing to study up on tour destinations and always attending to the guests he guides with utmost care. When it comes to document work and properly budgeting the tours, however, he is ruinously incompetent. It is said that his time spent in the office always coincides with his boss getting a headache. As a Cosman born on a far-off, obscure planet, his feather-like hair is all natural.
DETAIL_VALORAY_H01: When not adventuring in his hunt for rare ingredients, Valoray uses two Parallel Weapons as a hero. His hook sling fires hooked ropes for mobility and item retrieval, and his goggles detect if anything they perceive is edible and safe. His horns are also blessed with the ability to detect the slightest air currents and faintest hints of magnetic fields, and he makes full use of these natural abilities and his equipment to ensure the safety of himself and those he travels with.
DETAIL_VALORAY_H02: In his youth, Valoray had a partner he adventured with. His opposite in many ways, that person was bold, strong, and always made their taxing adventures successful with their strength. In the middle of one of their adventures, however, a moment of carelessness left him direly injured, forcing him to retire. After failing to fully communicate the danger to his partner at the time, Valoray vowed to never be careless again. A wish formed in his heart that no one would suffer the pain of having their life change so radically in an instant. Thus he imagines all possible dangers, comes up with all possible counterattacks, crosses his t's and dots his i's, and after all that, he says what he always says: "I'm worried."
DETAIL_VALORAY_S01: Valoray is an ingredient hunter who travels planets far and wide in search of the rarest, tastiest ingredients. As a side job, he uses the knowledge gained from the variety of planets he's visited to act as a guide for ingredient-hunting tours, to sell handmade travel food, and to write recipe books. While blessed with a warm and laid-back temperament, Valoray is cursed with a tendency to worry that borders on illness. Such anxiety has led him to employ intense detail in his writing, with his camp-cooking recipe book including long passages on dangerous zones of relevant planets, well-explained safe routes, survival techniques, and more. This makes it famous as a survival handbook beloved even by experts, of which Valoray himself has no clue.
DETAIL_VICTOMHEROFESTA2109_H01: As someone who has prioritized saving lives even at the cost of his own during his hero career, Victom comes fully equipped for aquatic rescues. Skillfully weaving through the waves on his paddleboard, he reassures those he saves from drowning with an outstretched hand and a dazzlingly kind smile. This unexpected side of Victom catches many off guard. Whatever it is that brought about this drastic change in his demeanor, it would have been caused by some course of events during the summer festival.
DETAIL_VICTOMHEROFESTA2109_H02: His coworkers, as well as general hero fans, have a solid impression of Victom as being stiff, quiet, and stoic, with a rough, imposing expression hidden behind his mask. He does not disagree with this strait-laced assessment of himself, but he seems to be self-conscious about his forbidding countenance possibly inciting fear. Making a child cry from just picking up the little one's ball at the beach has left a deep impression on him. He instead hopes to become a hero who can put a smile on children's faces... which likely comes from the fact that he, too, once had a family.
DETAIL_VICTOM_H01: Victom transforms into "Captain Rescue," a hero whose armored suit reminds onlookers of a rescue squad member's uniform. His Parallel Weapon is a rope that can reach his rescue targets in the shortest possible distance, whether they are in a burning building or in a Kaibutsu's stomach. With his suit and rope able to break through any obstacles between him and those in need of rescue, he saves lives with wall-shattering speed.
DETAIL_VICTOM_H02: Victom watched the streets burn and his family perish during a Kaibutsu attack he was powerless to stop or alleviate. It was then that he realized how he desperately desired the power to save each and every powerless individual from harm in the world. While he bears many scars over his body, not the least of which are the burns under his mask, he is driven to keep on rescuing those in need by a deep sense of responsibility and a burning hatred of Kaibutsu.
DETAIL_VICTOM_S01: The captain of Orient City's Fire Department's Hyper Rescue Squad, the London-born Victom Vincent is always seen wearing a helmet that fully obscures his face. Victom is coolheaded under any form of pressure and is quick to make decisions, making him a natural-born rescuer. Though he treasures the lives of others, his philosophy of living and dying for them leads him to treat his own life with a distressing level of flippancy.
DETAIL_VISCUNAM_H01: Viscunam wields four mechanical tentacle Parallel Weapons which jut out from his back. He had always wanted more arms to produce more inventions, and his hero form manifests that wish. He can control the tentacles at will, whether to assist in his lab work or to utilize their claws and lasers in combat. Their tips can change shape independently to whichever form he needs them to be in the moment.
DETAIL_VISCUNAM_H02: Viscunam adored his father, who was an inventor known the world over before being eaten alive in a Kaibutsu attack, only to be forgotten by the world upon his death. Enraged that no one else could remember his father, he vowed to become an inventor so great that no one could ever forget him. Despite his constant blunders and failures, it is that frustration he has felt since that fateful day which brings him back into the lab every morning to make new inventions.
DETAIL_VISCUNAM_S01: Viscunam is a Therian Cosman scientist who makes a living selling his inventions—though his motivation is less about making money than it is about seeing his inventions get the recognition and popularity he believes they rightfully deserve. He possesses absolute confidence in his intellect, spending countless hours in his lab every day contriving the perfect inventions. Alas, his ability to grasp the notion of "supply and demand" is a tad problematic. As a result, all of his inventions are eccentric oddities with questionable practical use. As an aside, though his abilities are as solid as they come, his horrifically poor luck and tendency to have his head in the clouds often result in embarrassing blunders.
DETAIL_VLAHAM_H01: Though a calm and gentle graveyard keeper, Vlaham has another face: that of a Kaibutsu hunter. When on the hunt, he speaks with a roughness unthinkable to those familiar with him before his transformation and acts with an imposing demeanor, but this is also part of him. Wielding a bayonet-attached rifle as a Parallel Weapon and wearing a ferocious smile on his lips, he slays Kaibutsu with no mercy or hesitation. The beasts he targets steal the memories and very perceptions of those they swallow, blaspheming the proper death that all living things are owed, and for that, they deserve no quarter. His strict principles as a Kaibutsu hunter keep him away from most other battles heroes engage in, such as those against villains and the ones in hero shows.
DETAIL_VLAHAM_H02: In days past, in a certain land on a certain planet, there was a noble house that built itself on monster slaying. As the last descendant of said house, Vlaham fell gravely ill before coming of age, consigning him to spend his days bedridden. While incapacitated, the Kaibutsu came to his fief. He lost his family, his people, his land, his everything. The moment he accepted his coming death as his mansion collapsed all around him, he found the monstrous power his family had sealed away and accepted it into himself. Empowered with a newly robust body and highly enhanced physical capabilities, he slew the Kaibutsu and mourned his family and people, now remembered only by him. Then came the price of his power: he would have to suffer the pain of the incurable disease that ravaged his body. Accepting this unending suffering, he vowed to protect the death all were owed, as both graveyard keeper and hunter.
DETAIL_VLAHAM_S01: Vlaham is a goat Therian Cosman who works as a graveyard keeper on a certain planet, caring for the graves of, and memorials to, those who perished in Kaibutsu attacks. As would be expected from one who presides over a realm awash in the silence of death, who spends his days praying for the departed, his demeanor is both calm and gentle. He does, however, have his hobbies, including an obsession with ruins, tombs and mausoleums, and he possesses a great collection of documents relating to them and footage of his visitations. Staying in the dark for so long has left him with a weakness to strong sunlight, giving him a penchant for walking about with a sun parasol. Still, he is often seen growing weak under blazing rays while staggering along.
DETAIL_VULPECULAMIRRORS2511_H01: In his new form, Vulpecula has a new hourglass Parallel Weapon in place of his pocket watch. What happened to the great thief who terrorized and amazed the Milky Way? How did he attain this new Hero suit of his? Even his most ardent fans do not know, nor has anyone been made privy to the meaning of this "new chapter" he mentions.
DETAIL_VULPECULAMIRRORS2511_H02: As sure as can be, Vulpecula has found himself a new dream. With it, his power to cast out the past and leave everything other than himself behind has also changed. Replacing it is the power to share the present with others and forge paths to the future. No longer will he run from threats now that he has taken up a sword with which to confront them. In the face of his reinvention, his fans and believers wonder, what will become of his career as a flashy thief? Will he—perish the thought—become a Hero? Rumors abound, yet Vulpecula remains silent. If anyone wishes to know the truth, they will have to know his inner depths.
DETAIL_VULPECULAMIRRORS2511_H03:
In his new form, Vulpecula has a new hourglass Parallel Weapon in place of his pocket watch. What happened to the great thief who terrorized and amazed the Milky Way? How did he attain this new Hero suit of his? Even his most ardent fans do not know, nor has anyone been made privy to the meaning of this "new chapter" he mentions.

New Info: Unlocked by clearing the last episode of Event Quest "Town of Goodbyes"
The dashing thief Vulpecula realized, to his despair, that his wish would only lead to emptiness and destruction. Facing the painful past he had locked away in himself, he vows to take back what should have been his present day from the Kaibutsu that stole it. He must, so that all people may bask in the glory of the moment, and he will pierce through the Kaibutsu that would threaten it and forge a path ahead to an ideal future. This wish is made manifest in his Parallel Weapons: the hourglass, and the sharp sword shaped like the hand of a clock.
DETAIL_VULPECULAMIRRORS2511_H04:
As sure as can be, Vulpecula has found himself a new dream. With that, his power to cast out the past and leave everything other than himself behind has also changed. Replacing it is the power to share the present with others and forge paths to the future. No longer will he run from threats now that he has taken up a sword with which to confront them. In the face of his reinvention, his fans and believers wonder, what will become of his career as a flashy thief? Will he—perish the thought—become a Hero? Rumors abound, yet Vulpecula remains silent. If anyone wishes to know the truth, they will have to know his inner depths.

New Info: Unlocked by clearing the last episode of Event Quest "Town of Goodbyes"
Vulpecula will not become a Hero. Even should he atone for his sins and have all his deeds forgiven, as long as there are those who have been saved by his thievery, he cannot deem the path he has walked a mistaken one. The beam of light he saw in the darkness with his comrades was, after all, the light of dawn. He has not abandoned the past nor been imprisoned by it, but has faced it, and his path now is to show his "new chapter" as a dashing thief to all. The new Hero suit is but the prologue to the next stage of his career.
DETAIL_VULPECULA_H01: The Parallel Weapon Vulpecula uses is a transformed version of the pocket watch he keeps on him at all times. It is able to affect time as experienced by himself and those around him, letting him accelerate and decelerate time at will while he acts freely. This enables him to move and attack with what appears to be supernatural speed—indeed, to those facing him, it appears as though he disappears the moment he activates his power. While impressively powerful, the greater the area of effect he exerts his power, the greater the strain he imposes on himself. His ability is terminally weak against powers that stop time and hamstring movement, so he keeps these weak points confidential.
DETAIL_VULPECULA_H02: Vulpecula wishes for a world where no one needs to look back on the past and can instead treasure the present. This is the source of his obsession to steal things of the past and liberate all from the chains of the sadnesses of old. Thus, he dons the mask, hiding his true feelings, and ventures throughout the galaxy in efforts to help those living in sadness forget their suffering and enjoy life to the fullest. Though he claims he has cast aside his own past, his aspirations are squarely founded on said past, a contradiction he must bear as he pursues his mission.
DETAIL_VULPECULA_S01: The dashing thief Vulpecula is well known for stealing priceless cultural artifacts and destroying cultural heritage sites. He fancies his actions "thefts of scenery." All his daring thefts are announced beforehand via some enigmatic, poetic warning video which he posts on the dark web. His lofty ideals have won him a not so insignificant cult-like following, with many of his more passionate believers enthusiastically becoming his henchmen. While no one knows his true face on account of the fox mask he always wears, the countless copycat criminals he is responsible for have ensured that the world of preserving cultural heritage can know no peace.
DETAIL_WOLFMANEARTH_H01: Wolfmen prefer lightweight weaponry and equipment and flexible clothing to capitalize on their innate, heightened physical abilities. This tendency is highlighted further upon transformation. Their highly developed auditory and olfactory senses come at the cost of being weak to strong light; most wear sunglasses or visors to augment their vision. As such, the Wolfmen's fondness for sunglasses in day-to-day life has a compelling backstory to it.
DETAIL_WOLFMANEARTH_S01: Wolfmen are Cosmen who outwardly resemble wolves that have been migrating into Earth's sphere of influence en masse. Their young people are often labeled as roughnecks for having impulsively immigrated with hopes of making money to take back home. In reality, every Wolfman, much like Terrans, has a distinct personality, unique preferences, and his own dreams. Even among their villain population, there are just as many who are genuinely proud of their villainous deeds as there are those who possess a strange adoration toward heroes.
DETAIL_WOLFMANSHADOW_H01: Wolfmen prefer lightweight weaponry and equipment and flexible clothing to capitalize on their innate, heightened physical abilities. This tendency is highlighted further upon transformation. Their highly developed auditory and olfactory senses come at the cost of being weak to strong light; most wear sunglasses or visors to augment their vision. As such, the Wolfmen's fondness for sunglasses in day-to-day life has a compelling backstory to it.
DETAIL_WOLFMANSHADOW_S01: Wolfmen are Cosmen who outwardly resemble wolves that have been migrating into Earth's sphere of influence en masse. Their young people are often labeled as roughnecks for having impulsively immigrated with hopes of making money to take back home. In reality, every Wolfman, much like Terrans, has a distinct personality, unique preferences, and his own dreams. Even among their villain population, there are just as many who are genuinely proud of their villainous deeds as there are those who possess a strange adoration toward heroes.
DETAIL_WRESTLEREARTH_H01: They wear gaudy, villainous masks and costumes when taking to the ring. With no weapons but their mighty flesh, they fight against their competition, always upping the ante in flash and style to keep the audience entertained. Their role on the battlefield can be summed up as follows: playing the villain, making the audience cheer and howl, and creating a show all can enjoy. Even the chains on their attire are mere stage props with no real heft to them. They wear cute mascot characters of their favorite animals on their waists to show their consideration for the children in the audience.
DETAIL_WRESTLEREARTH_S01: Heel wrestlers take on the role of "villain" in the ring. Though heels are often hated by children as a consequence of their role, they count many children and youths among their fans as a result of their tireless efforts to make professional wrestling a medium of enjoyment to them. Despite their standoffish demeanors, their fans know deep down just how much the heels love them.
DETAIL_WRESTLERFIRE_H01: They wear gaudy, villainous masks and costumes when taking to the ring. With no weapons but their mighty flesh, they fight against their competition, always upping the ante in flash and style to keep the audience entertained. Despite their standoffish demeanors, their fans know deep down just how much the heels love them.
DETAIL_YASUHIKO_H01: As a hero, Yasuhiko dons a flashy gold outfit and fights with the tricks he knows best, which are animal acts. He calls into battle ferocious manifestations of energy out of the beasts that have performed with him from memory, of which there are four in total: Leonard the friendly lion, Rufina the laid-back elephant, Bogdan the gentle tiger, and Dahlia the proud giraffe. These animals blitz forth at the crack of his whip, and they coordinate flawlessly to efficiently bring down foes with a pizazz that has the audience cheering them on as if they were performing a show.
DETAIL_YASUHIKO_H02: Yasuhiko's dream is to have Circus Yatomi go galactic and be loved by all. Parting ways with its previous ringmaster, his father, over deep disagreements has left him with a bag of mixed emotions considering how it was his father who revived it. Still, now that he himself is the one running the circus, he can finally lead it like he had dreamed of doing since childhood. He has a troupe that trusts him fully, and he wishes to do right by them and raise the circus's potential as high as it can go. Yasuhiko is animated by a strong sense of responsibility and a strong love of the circus, which are both powerful enough forces to cancel out his negative feelings toward his father.
DETAIL_YASUHIKO_S01: Yasuhiko Yatomi is the young ringmaster of a storied circus based in Orient City. While growing up, his Japanese father was dedicated to running the circus in Japan, so Yasuhiko lived with his Russian mother in Moscow. Viewing countless circus shows as a child and having a ringmaster for a father kindled his passion for circuses and nurtured his deep knowledge of them. He has a pleasantly competitive demeanor and loves showing people a good time more than anything. Unfortunately, constant conflicts with his father and his inability to run the circus as he wishes have cast gloom over his heart.
DETAIL_YOHACKLASTRESORT2506_H01: Yohack visits the distant island of Enoshima as the Este Volta's local hero, wearing a suit reminiscent of a lifeguard. Wishing to save whoever may be crying behind the proverbial door as soon as possible, he revs up his jet ski Parallel Weapon. This jet ski sees all obstacles as waves and breaks through them, blasting its way to the person in need and kicking up a spray of water as it passes by. While this ability is fantastic for rescue situations, it has little utility on the offensive side. This is because to Yohack, not hurting the person he wishes to help takes priority over all.
DETAIL_YOHACKLASTRESORT2506_H02: Yohack cannot say no to a request, since helping those in need is the ideology behind his actions. He knows all too well that when people have a hand to help them up, they can move forward in life. He's been on the receiving end, after all, making his belief unshakable. Now, he grips not a key, but the handle of his jet ski. Gone is his wish to simply open the door, replaced by a desire to save the person crying out behind it. He crashes through any and all obstacles on his jet ski and offers up his hand with a smile, hoping to provide even a little courage to those in need.
DETAIL_YOHACK_H01: Yohack dons workman's clothes in his hero form, similar to those of the locksmith who once saved him. His Parallel Weapon is a master key that manifests his desire to save those locked away. Able to open any lock, his key also has the power to treat his target's heart as a locked door and open it. This allows him to draw out his allies' hidden potential. Yohack can also use his ability to open up the hearts, whose doors are closed, of his targets so that he may hear what they wish to keep hidden. Even so, violating the inner worlds of others in this way is an act he is not eager to perform.
DETAIL_YOHACK_H02: At a young age, Yohack had found himself locked inside a room in a spaceship after a Kaibutsu attack. The door's lock had been twisted, preventing him from opening it from inside. Sitting there trembling with fear, he heard the voice of a man who introduced himself as a locksmith. The man started working, providing encouragement to Yohack the whole time until he finally finished and unlocked the door. Deeply moved by the man who saved him, Yohack followed him to Muirauqa IV and entered his tutelage, hoping to one day be able to help people out of their binds, just as he had been helped out of his.
DETAIL_YOHACK_S01: Yohack is a young man who works as a locksmith on Muirauqa IV. He is able to solve most lock-related problems, from the oldest locked vault to the latest electronic security systems. His great skill with locks has won him esteem and acclaim, with clients even approaching him from other planets. Yohack's natural dexterity makes him a skilled cook and DIY handyman. He loves being useful to others and accepts requests with a smile, making him well-liked by his neighbors. His inability to say no sometimes works against him, however, and he takes on so many requests that he quickly finds himself in over his head.
DETAIL_YOSHIORITRAIN2305_H01: Courtesy of the galactic railway's mystery train, Yoshiori's new form includes two gun Parallel Weapons to protect the train's passengers and a pair of sunglasses to detect danger. This preserves his style of eliminating threats with force of arms while also showing his resolve to defend those in his care. The suit is highly mobile and geared against ambushes, allowing him to use his tough body and great mental fortitude to defend his targets, even if at the cost of his life.
DETAIL_YOSHIORITRAIN2305_H02: Imperceptible by Hito, Yoshiori had once thought himself a ghost. He went unnoticed, even after all those days of desperate training to achieve his childhood wish. Falling prey to cynicism and disappointment, he began saying his dream was no longer and had never been possible. Now, however, all those excuses are gone. With guns clenched in his nearly faded hands, his long-held wish to protect people has returned. Believing that, as a professional bodyguard, he can be the difference between their life and death, he lunges between those he has been charged to protect and the dangers that face them.
DETAIL_YOSHIORI_H01: Back when he was a soldier, Yoshiori was both feared by his enemies and trusted by his comrades. It was the one time in his life when he was best perceived by others, making him a known figure—a somebody. He wants that existence back, and his villain form reflects that, with it being a reincarnation of his own uniform and weapons created from his memories. He also has regained the right arm and abdominal area he had lost from the Kaibutsu attack. In this form, Yoshiori's stomach is connected to an alternate plane from which he can pull from an array of weapons that he has used in the past. He seems most fond of machine guns.
DETAIL_YOSHIORI_H02: After being swallowed by a Kaibutsu on the battlefield, Yoshiori essentially became someone who had not existed prior to being spat out. He had vanished from the minds of his friends and family, from government registries, and from every record imaginable. People can neither see Yoshiori, nor touch him, nor even hear his voice. In the depths of despair, he vowed to himself that no matter what it took, he would reclaim his existence. He would become a person again. Thus, he continues to fight, aiming for the day that those he loves will be able to realize he still exists in the world.
DETAIL_YOSHIORI_S01: A Terran villain who serves as the Observer Exio's bodyguard, Yoshiori was formerly a talented member of the Union of Earth Hero Agency's Special Operations Unit until a run-in with a Kaibutsu that nearly digested him left his existence in turmoil. Now, he cannot be perceived by life forms other than Observers and those with hero aptitude. Though he acts as rough as he looks, he is more like a loyal dog than anything, displaying strict obedience to those he has acknowledged, such as Exio, to whom he feels overwhelming gratitude.
DETAIL_YOTARO_S01:
While a young salesman of used goods on the surface, behind the scenes, Yotaro is a villainous Observer who specializes in searching the dark web. Masterful at dealing with numbers and information, reading the room and intentions, and speaking to get what he wants, he is a born merchant, and it makes him his daily bread. Most of the livos he earns, however, disappear as compensation for all of the destruction his bodyguard Gaisei causes, leaving him struggling to save any money. On the flip side, rumor has it that he sells the spoils of combat Gaisei brings back to a suspicious scientist.

When Yotaro observes someone, he perceives them in terms of taste and smell, understanding his target's "flavor." The awakening of this powerful ability within him, however, completely changed the young zaibatsu heir's life. Hiding his powers and acting like nothing had changed ground his mind down, and a rude revelation came during an untimely Kaibutsu attack. Exposed, he reflexively ran away from home and came to live his life as a villain. While on the other side of society, he met Gaisei, and while he sees the man as both ridiculous and violent, they live a comfortable life of mutual respect.
DETAIL_YUHANG_H01: Yuhang's Parallel Weapon is a much larger version of the Chinese cleaver he so often uses. The weapon can cleave a target, but it can also slice through space if connected by a strong enough Path, creating a passage to his kitchen, which exists outside of time. In his kitchen, he can use energy built up from attacks as ingredients to make a variety of dishes that will immediately invigorate all those who eat them. Cooking in the kitchen takes significant mental and physical strength, however, so he is unable to take advantage of it as often as he would like to.
DETAIL_YUHANG_H02: Left orphaned by a Kaibutsu attack, Yuhang had lived in a refugee camp from a young age. One of the cooking volunteers had prepared what they called the "Taste of Happiness" for him. Yuhang never forgot the taste of it, nor the looks of joy on those who ate it with him. It was at that moment he knew he wanted to be a cook. He was later adopted by a chef who owned his own restaurant, and he trained hard to become the well-known cook he is today. Even now, however, he wanders the cosmos in search of something that can match the Taste of Happiness.
DETAIL_YUHANG_S01: Yuhang Cai is a cook who works at a high-class restaurant in Taipei when the fancy strikes him. As optimistic and prone to idiocy as they come, he is known for his irresponsibility and occasional, sudden bouts of wanderlust. When it comes to cooking, however, his serious switch flips on. He prepares food with such skill and delicacy that every restaurant he has helped on impulse tries to sink their claws into him. A truly adventurous researcher and eater, he will try anything to find out how it tastes. This has sent him to the hospital many, many times, and the M.A.H.A. doctors are all dreadfully familiar with him.
DETAIL_ZANIAH_H01: The multi-tailed whip Parallel Weapon Zaniah wields is split into four long strands and possesses great versatility. Whether she needs a fierce weapon to attack her foes, a supple rope to liberate treasure, or a petal-shaped shield to protect her allies over a wide area, she gets the job done. The weapon bears a resemblance to the flower pendant Zaniah received from her family as a child.
DETAIL_ZANIAH_H02: After getting caught up in a fierce Kaibutsu attack, young Zaniah found herself in the slums of a planet she had never even heard of. There, the other slum dwellers treated her like their own flesh and blood. Eventually, however, the local authorities began demanding a monetary tribute, making the hard life of Zaniah's new family even harder. That was when she realized that the weak have everything squeezed out of them by the strong, and that no hero will come to save them. Zaniah would have to do it herself, so she took to the stars, seeking to take back what was stolen from her family.
DETAIL_ZANIAH_S01: Fancying herself a master thief, Zaniah travels the stars in search of valuables. Though haughty in word and demeanor as a result of her initial princess-like upbringing, the true goal in her quest for a pretty penny is to give back to her friends and adopted family in the slums who raised her as one of their own. The truth is, her family knows that she is not the type to give up once she sets her mind on a goal. So, they follow her at a distance out of concern, always cheering her on from the shadows.
